column2: ['James Caldwell High School is a great school with lots of different opportunities available. For a small school, there is always a lot going on. The tight knit student culture is great and comforting.', "Overall it is a very good high school to prepare you for college. Unfortunately, I was bullied a lot and the administration didn't do anything to help me. They were very bias whenever I went to them and always picked  the other person;s side even when I had evidence against that person.", 'I enjoy going to James Caldwell High School, the school is very clean and modern but changed could be made.Some of the teaching staff could be fixed, as many students tend to have complainants about specific teachers but nothing is done. I think that students opinions and changes they suggest should be considered. It would greatly benefit the school and many students future.', 'My experience at James Caldwell High school so far, would be considered lucky. I feel lucky to be apart of this school, because of all the resources provided in order to make learning easier. The school also provides the students and staff with a lot of safety procedures, in order to keep the students and faculty\'s lives safe. I am very aware that there are schools around the nation, that aren\'t as fortunate as James Caldwell, to have resources even as simple as a textbook. Although most students do not take into consideration all the "luck" we have in order to learn with our resources, I do think about how lucky I am. That is why when I walk into James Caldwell High School, I feel fortunate to know that I am able to learn with a lot of resources that can boost my skills in learning. I learned over the years, not to take such objects for granted.', "The overall high school experience was great but it was mainly due to the students around me. There are many great teachers, but there are a handful that aren't nearly as passionate. Another con of this school is the disparity of extracurricular activities. Sports get way more funding and focus than they deserve, leaving the music program and other clubs lacking. Even within the sports scene certain sports get more attention then they deserve. It was wholely up to the students to create a substantial music and club presents. There is a lack of initiative from the administrative front to help non-athletic programs progress and grow.", "James Caldwell is a pretty good high school as it goes. The administration isn't the best but they are friendly and fair with their jobs. The teachers are mostly all friendly with the odd one or two who are kind of off. The school has really good sports programs probably because they put more money into sports than they should, which kind of leaves nowhere near enough for academics. I'd still say that even with old books that are falling apart, our academics are still very good because of how many classes we're offered as electives that we get to choose. The electives give us the option to choose certain classes that we specifically want to take along side our required classes. Diversity isn't the best just because of the area we live in. They offer us a lot of support for after high school like guidance counselors giving us special meetings to help us find college prospects as well as scholarships, and give us classes on how to do taxes and find housing.", 'I like the choices for regular classes, language classes, electives, clubs and activities, and the guidance department. What I would change is the mandatory school activities, teaching the students morality would be a plus, and educating the students in proper social conduct and teaching them respect', 'As soon as I walked into James Caldwell High School, I felt like it was my home from home. On the first day of school, our principal said this was the "place of the possibilities". I made new friends, joined new clubs, sports and other activities at James Caldwell. I discovered myself here and this school has helped shape me into the person I am today. I enjoy coming here because it is more than just school. It is a very enjoyable time and the people here are more then friends; it is like a family. My Vice Principal said to me, "This is the happiest place on Earth besides Disney World,". I knew by the first month that this was my new reality.', 'I have had two daughters study at JCHS. I would give the teachers 5 stars. I have never met more dedicated faculty and staff. Academics are strong and I agree with other reviews that the school could benefit from more advanced level classes but does an excellent job with the resources it has.  Both my daughters were active in the music program which also benefits from great faculty and  well-organized parent support. The administration is solid, but what keeps me from giving this school 5 stars is the lack of a real, tangible effort to outwardly address issues of race and gender.', 'Very good school for overall student involvement and growth. I find the resources, teachers, as well as the administration supportive to the students. School culture and diversity is good.', "As a public school, it was accommodating to the needs of high achieving students, but it lacked encouragement to those students who weren't always in the spotlight. It often favored students who already did well in school, thereby allowing them to continue to do well, but not always push those who might have needed a little more motivation by making their horizons seem limitless. Also, the lack of diversity was stifling to young growing minds.", 'I am so grateful to have been able to have attended a high school that has prepared me to take the next steps in my life to pick a college after applying to a few. The teachers were always making sure everyone in the classroom understood the lesson that was being taught. I wish the teachers provided more assistance and understanding to students, like me, who get overwhelmed by the demands from each class. Instead of just learning what the curriculum requires, life skills would be very beneficial as well.', 'I was able to get a good education at JCHS. The students with special needs were not quite as lucky. Overall I benefited a lot academically, but I did not enjoy going to this school. It was an unpleasant experience.', 'I was challenged academically everyday at James Caldwell in my numerous AP classes and I had some amazing teachers. However, some bathrooms are outdated and some kids use them as an excuse to vape. The administration has buckled down on these kids but it would just be nice if they could stop on their own. I also played sports and while we have pretty good sports programs, they can only go so far because of the coaching. If we had better coaches who knew more about the game, our teams would do better.', 'James Caldwell high school has tremendous teachers and opportunities if the student chooses to take advantage of them. The honors classes that I took were extremey difficult but rewarding and resembled APs. The students who take regular classes and excel will be taught well and have been accepted to some competitive schools. The honors and AP teachers are passionate.', "James Caldwell Highschool is a good school because all of the teachers and administration are always trying their best to support their students and help them excel.  My high school helps us prepare for college by offering many AP courses and making the regular classes challenging as well. Another pro about the school is the variety of clubs and sports that we have. Some cons about the school is that we do not have a lot of diversity because the population if the school is primarily white. Also the food isn't the best in the cafeteria but we are allowed to bring our own lunch so it's not that bad.", "Excellent experience with two students going through this school. The administration listens to students' and parents' concerns. The teachers are dedicated and genuinely care about their students. They could use more high-level/ AP courses for the most motivated students, but given the small size of the school, it's understandable.  My only negative comment is that there is not much diversity and that brings a general culture that lacks cultural awareness and sensitivity in the school. The administration is proactive in addressing individual concerns in this regard, but could do more to improve in this area.", 'I like that the preparedness and thoroughness when it comes to colleges, I do not like the corruption and administration abuse of power', 'Huge lack in diversity, the whole school is white. The food is atrocious, in which I received (minimal, but evident) nausea and food poisoning from. Many of the teachers are very easy to approach and amiable. Lots of clubs and a large focus on sports.', 'Good enough academics that everyone graduates and goes to college. Still has one of the most racist mascots (and therefore traditions like the "War Chant" at football games) that you\'ll see in the 21st century.']

column6: ['James Caldwell High School is a decent high school. However, it is extremely white with little diversity and struggles to be an accepting space for LGBTQ students or anyone who is different.', 'As a current student, I have a great appreciation for JCHS. While some teachers are not very helpful or supportive, there are many teacher who are very educated and know what they are doing. The administration is pretty good and attempts to solve all issues at the school, but sometimes they ignore large issues. The classes offered are all pretty good with a large amount of AP choices and the AP teachers are all very dedicated to their students. Overall this school has a few flaws, but has some very good classes and teachers who prepare students for the future.', 'I like that James Caldwell High School has a good amount of friendly teachers. But the majority or them are careless and unhelpful. The student body is also very rude to each other, and many students are bullied. I believe our administration should be taking action to solve these problems.', 'At James Caldwell High School, I made friends and memories that I could never forget. Although my time with them was outrageously fun, my time actually spent in school was horrendous. To begin, the administration did not treat the students fairly. There were teachers who were very mean and verbally attacked kids and there were times where student got in trouble for things they were not involved in. Also, I did not approve of the cleanliness of the school. I always felt dirty while being there and there are always cave crickets in the field house bathroom. Do not get me wrong, there are some teachers that would go out of their way to help the students, but sadly that was not enough.', "James Caldwell is a small school that feels big. There are many great courses offered as well as athletic teams to join. The school prepares you for college and let's you sample many different subjects.", 'I liked how much this school valued is education. Teachers truly wanted students to succeed and I know  I am a better person because of it.', "Music program is great, I've been in it (district wide) for 11 years. They're funny, hard working and passionate about their jobs and the performance of students whether in band, chorus, orchestra or small groups. Not a big fan on athletics so I don't know much about them, but I know the coaches are good teachers. In a predominantly white neighborhood, there could be more diversity but it's growing slowly. Academics most teachers I've had are excellent. The clubs are diverse and you can easily find an advisor to help kickstart it. The cafeteria's teriyaki/sweet&sour/General Tso's chicken is amazing.", 'I have had quite a good experience, but I would have liked more orientation and help as a new student.', 'As a senior, I am ready to go off to college, but I know that I will look back on high school and be thankful for the strong academic foundation that it provided. Many teachers and administrative staff members have profoundly impacted me in positive ways and pushed me to be the best student I could be. There are many opportunities to find a place to excel and flourish whether it be through sports, community service, the arts, or any other extra curricular activity. I have always felt safe at school and know that all the staff take their jobs as teachers and role models very seriously. I am proud to be a Chief.', "James Caldwell High School is most definitely not a place of possibilities. There are multiple teachers who should not be teaching and don't care about their job at all. On multiple occasions I have had teachers who are awful and I could teach better than them. The guidance department is awful and uneducated on the college process. They don't help you when you ask for it. For instance, I sent an email to my guidance counselor regarding my outdated GPA on Naviance and to address that she hasn't met with me to discuss my future in a nutshell and she simply ignored my email. This is unacceptable and definitely not the way a school should be run.", "Overall, I'd say I had a pretty good experience. JCHS really has a lot of opportunities for everyone, more than I can say for schools around us, and they have an encouraging environment. However, they have only been like this recently, and many of the upperclassman can remember how things were much different back when they were freshmen while we were under our previous principal. JCHS is a great school for people in all trades and groups, and I consider myself lucky to be a part of it.", "As a parent of a recent grad and a current student,  I am very familiar with James Caldwell high school. Overall, I have been pleased with the academic program and especially proud of the music (band/orchestra) program. I would like to see more training and oversight of the teaching staff. Most are very qualified and enthusiastic, a few should have retired by now, and a small number should be supervised and offered more direction. The new football turf field looks great and the new drainage equipment on the other fields will make them more functional. I will say my daughter is a communications major at college and I wish JCHS had a larger focus on communications and film like other schools, because she should have had a better foundation.  I am a big fan of our district and support it in many ways. Overall, it's a very caring, safe, academically rigorous district and I'm proud to raise my family here.", "Again, JCHS is a gem and it is just a stone's throw away from my house", 'Curriculum has improved quite a bit with the new principal', 'Lot of fund-raising events take place and administration is always present and participating.  Even the superintendent of schools is very involved and participates in the annual 5k for Caldwell/West Caldwell education.', "MOst teachers are consistent with their grading and really emphasize and put alot of weight on homework.  Communication is excellent and begins immediately and my son's progress is monitored throughout the quarter,year. Also, grades are not given away.  Teachers make sure students rightfully earn their grade.", 'The school is very clean and mostly teachers love their job I enjoyed the school because a lot of my Teachers had passion.', 'Most teachers at JCHS enjoy there job. You can definetly tell who is  here for the paycheck and who is here for a passion', "The school nurse at James Caldwell High School was always fantastic and truly cared for the health and wellbeing of the students.  Although we didn't have large security measures that were taken, the school is in a great area and I've always felt safe.  There has never been an incident in which I felt unsafe, and the school does take precaution when it comes to drills.", "Many of the teachers are always willing to participate with the students in extracurricular activities.  I participated in student government, golf, Interact club (Junior Rotary), chamber music, orchestra, symphony, Key Club, Relay for Life, and more.  Just from one student's perspective, this can be representative of the diversity of clubs and organizations."]

column2: ['My experience at park ridge high school has been great overall. Although being a very small school, it is full of great people and teachers, who for the most part care and pay attention to you. There aren’t very many different clubs since there isn’t very many people to fill those that wouldn’t be that popular. But the academics and good teachers make up for it.', "Park Ridge is honestly a good community where you are definitely encouraged to learn, be an athlete, and be involved because everyone else is too. It's small but you do know all of the teachers and they become very helpful and personal that way.", 'It was good over all experience. The school is very small so there is not much diversity among the students. However, the staff is great; they have people who really care about the students. there were not that many clubs and it would be great to see that expand. Everyone is truly supportive and that can be seen at any function the school holds. The dress code rules were ridiculous when I was a student it would be great to see those be less strict. My overall time at the high school was good and now that I am in college feel like it prepared me well.', 'My experience at PRHS has been average. I have made many friends through extracurricular activities. The academics are decent and many challenging courses are offered. My favorite thing about PRHS is the internship opportunities during senior year. I have an internship and I absolutely love it!', 'great teachers and good teaching style from all of them. I find the class sizes nice because they are relatively small and it is a nice town too.', "I find that Park Ridge provides a challenging academic environment which is beneficial to student when thinking about preparation for college, but often times the students here suffer from a lack of sleep. Huge work load in each grade. But I feel like my grade has transitioned over the years from big groups of friends to everyone having a more select group, thankfully I have found one best friend I know I will continue talking to after high school. Unfortunately, because of the schools size not everyone finds that best friend, and the dating pool is nonexistent when you have been going to school with the same people for 12 years. Teachers are either amazing or terrible , most definitely a competitive environment. Some students will be exceptions to every rule because of their parents being difficult. Dress code is ridiculous but most teachers don't enforce especially as you get older. No block schedule.", 'Terrible school, the teachers don’t teach and many students are miserable here, a lot of kids left to go to private school.', "Most teachers I had were excellent- they were very hard working, taught material well to the students, and genuinely cared about the students as well. The cafeteria food was of good quality, and the building itself was beautiful. Classes weren't overly difficult, but definitely did require students to put in a decent amount of effort. Overall, despite the area being hard to adapt to, Park Ridge High School was a good experience.", 'My overall experience at PRHS was good but i feel they did not prepare me enough for life after high school. I feel that the town of Park Ridge alone adds to this mentality. Students go through the schooling system and never really get a taste of anything other than Park Ridge.', 'The only thing that was pretty good was it being senior year. The teachers are alright the English department does not get you ready for college that much. To this day I still do not know how to write an effective essay.', 'There are top notch teachers at this school, despite its small size. All teachers are willing to help. Being that it is a small school, there are only AP and regular classes offered. Occasionally an honors course will be offered but it is difficult when you are not quite an AP student in a particular subject, but not quite regular. These classes are only offered at one time so it is hard to make a schedule to fit all of your classes.', 'The extracurriculars at the school help form a sense of community. I do wish that more people attended football games just because as a marching band member, it was difficult to pump up the football team with the stands being empty. Girls Soccer was one of the sports with an incredible turnout for such a small school and those games were always the most fun, being that I was on the team for 4 years.', 'This school is unique because of its size. Many people do not enjoy small public schools, however I disagree. The size gave me opportunities to participate in several different activities because all clubs are in need of numbers. I was captain of the girls soccer team, ran track, and was in the marching band. The coaches and directors of clubs are very understanding and want each student to be well rounded.', "It is difficult to put a rating on all of the teachers because of how different they all are but overall, they are great and truly want the student's to succeed.", 'We are a small school so everyone knows each other and there is a lot of support for school events such as sports and musicals. But the school has lots of cliques which is what separates the students.', "Every teacher has a different teaching style and some better than others. There are some teachers who make is seen as if they have no respect for the students or don't care at all. There are some teachers who are willing to do a lot for the students at the same time.", 'The teachers are amazing, and always an email away if you need help with anything, or to set up an after school session. The curriculum is designed so that the students get the most out of each class. The scheduling process is done via powerschool, and then the guidance councilors review it, making sure that each student gets the perfect amount of balance and knowledge. The workload is difficult at sometimes but for the most part the teachers only assign what is able to be handled for the students. There are so many classes that it is hard to say which ones are popular but public speaking classes and the technology classes are heavily talked about among students.', 'PRHS has zero tolerance for bullying and feeling unsafe. Regularly practice drills are carried out randomly and taken seriously. The school nurse is the kindest and is always trying to help. I feel very safe in this school and would never think that I was not. In addition to the no tolerance of bullying, some students have even created a club to spread the awareness of bullying. They have passed out rubber bracelets, given talks and even painted murals on the hallways in school as a reminder of how crucial it is to be kind to each other in order to establish a safe environment.', 'My first year at PRHS I became a member of the Thespian Society and was heavily involved in the lighting and sound for the major performances in the theater whether it was for chorus or the school play. The thespian society is a great club that really goes out of its way to introduce and display the arts. Aside from my experiences some of my classmates are involved in the National Honor Society, Outdoor club, student council and more. I would have to say that our top extracurricular activities at PRHS are sports. There is a list of sports ranging from football,lacrosse, bowling, volleyball and much more!', 'As a student who transferred at the beginning of sophomore year it was overwhelming but the teachers, students and class activities helped make the experience relaxing. Since the school only caters to the town, which is very small, all of the students are acquainted with one another resulting in a close-knit, know your peers experience which is delightful.']
column4: ['My experience at park ridge high school has been great overall. Although being a very small school, it is full of great people and teachers, who for the most part care and pay attention to you. There aren’t very many different clubs since there isn’t very many people to fill those that wouldn’t be that popular. But the academics and good teachers make up for it.', "Park Ridge is honestly a good community where you are definitely encouraged to learn, be an athlete, and be involved because everyone else is too. It's small but you do know all of the teachers and they become very helpful and personal that way.", 'It was good over all experience. The school is very small so there is not much diversity among the students. However, the staff is great; they have people who really care about the students. there were not that many clubs and it would be great to see that expand. Everyone is truly supportive and that can be seen at any function the school holds. The dress code rules were ridiculous when I was a student it would be great to see those be less strict. My overall time at the high school was good and now that I am in college feel like it prepared me well.', 'My experience at PRHS has been average. I have made many friends through extracurricular activities. The academics are decent and many challenging courses are offered. My favorite thing about PRHS is the internship opportunities during senior year. I have an internship and I absolutely love it!', 'great teachers and good teaching style from all of them. I find the class sizes nice because they are relatively small and it is a nice town too.', "I find that Park Ridge provides a challenging academic environment which is beneficial to student when thinking about preparation for college, but often times the students here suffer from a lack of sleep. Huge work load in each grade. But I feel like my grade has transitioned over the years from big groups of friends to everyone having a more select group, thankfully I have found one best friend I know I will continue talking to after high school. Unfortunately, because of the schools size not everyone finds that best friend, and the dating pool is nonexistent when you have been going to school with the same people for 12 years. Teachers are either amazing or terrible , most definitely a competitive environment. Some students will be exceptions to every rule because of their parents being difficult. Dress code is ridiculous but most teachers don't enforce especially as you get older. No block schedule.", 'Terrible school, the teachers don’t teach and many students are miserable here, a lot of kids left to go to private school.', "Most teachers I had were excellent- they were very hard working, taught material well to the students, and genuinely cared about the students as well. The cafeteria food was of good quality, and the building itself was beautiful. Classes weren't overly difficult, but definitely did require students to put in a decent amount of effort. Overall, despite the area being hard to adapt to, Park Ridge High School was a good experience.", 'My overall experience at PRHS was good but i feel they did not prepare me enough for life after high school. I feel that the town of Park Ridge alone adds to this mentality. Students go through the schooling system and never really get a taste of anything other than Park Ridge.', 'The only thing that was pretty good was it being senior year. The teachers are alright the English department does not get you ready for college that much. To this day I still do not know how to write an effective essay.', 'There are top notch teachers at this school, despite its small size. All teachers are willing to help. Being that it is a small school, there are only AP and regular classes offered. Occasionally an honors course will be offered but it is difficult when you are not quite an AP student in a particular subject, but not quite regular. These classes are only offered at one time so it is hard to make a schedule to fit all of your classes.', 'The extracurriculars at the school help form a sense of community. I do wish that more people attended football games just because as a marching band member, it was difficult to pump up the football team with the stands being empty. Girls Soccer was one of the sports with an incredible turnout for such a small school and those games were always the most fun, being that I was on the team for 4 years.', 'This school is unique because of its size. Many people do not enjoy small public schools, however I disagree. The size gave me opportunities to participate in several different activities because all clubs are in need of numbers. I was captain of the girls soccer team, ran track, and was in the marching band. The coaches and directors of clubs are very understanding and want each student to be well rounded.', "It is difficult to put a rating on all of the teachers because of how different they all are but overall, they are great and truly want the student's to succeed.", 'We are a small school so everyone knows each other and there is a lot of support for school events such as sports and musicals. But the school has lots of cliques which is what separates the students.', "Every teacher has a different teaching style and some better than others. There are some teachers who make is seen as if they have no respect for the students or don't care at all. There are some teachers who are willing to do a lot for the students at the same time.", 'The teachers are amazing, and always an email away if you need help with anything, or to set up an after school session. The curriculum is designed so that the students get the most out of each class. The scheduling process is done via powerschool, and then the guidance councilors review it, making sure that each student gets the perfect amount of balance and knowledge. The workload is difficult at sometimes but for the most part the teachers only assign what is able to be handled for the students. There are so many classes that it is hard to say which ones are popular but public speaking classes and the technology classes are heavily talked about among students.', 'PRHS has zero tolerance for bullying and feeling unsafe. Regularly practice drills are carried out randomly and taken seriously. The school nurse is the kindest and is always trying to help. I feel very safe in this school and would never think that I was not. In addition to the no tolerance of bullying, some students have even created a club to spread the awareness of bullying. They have passed out rubber bracelets, given talks and even painted murals on the hallways in school as a reminder of how crucial it is to be kind to each other in order to establish a safe environment.', 'My first year at PRHS I became a member of the Thespian Society and was heavily involved in the lighting and sound for the major performances in the theater whether it was for chorus or the school play. The thespian society is a great club that really goes out of its way to introduce and display the arts. Aside from my experiences some of my classmates are involved in the National Honor Society, Outdoor club, student council and more. I would have to say that our top extracurricular activities at PRHS are sports. There is a list of sports ranging from football,lacrosse, bowling, volleyball and much more!', 'As a student who transferred at the beginning of sophomore year it was overwhelming but the teachers, students and class activities helped make the experience relaxing. Since the school only caters to the town, which is very small, all of the students are acquainted with one another resulting in a close-knit, know your peers experience which is delightful.']
column6: ['The teachers at PRHS are some of the best. Even when you are wrong or in need of help they never make you feel as if you are the only one lost. If you ask they always reciprocate with guidance and their ability to communicate the lesson to students is created in order for the most effective outcome. I am happy to call had/have them as my teachers.', 'The teachers are extremely helpful, always dedicating their time to the students. The athletics are great. There is a lot of school involvement. Many clubs and organizations to join.', 'Small community, great friendships, strong focus on academics and athletics. Great community spirit.', 'The appearance is their, but the actions are lacking. Not enough one on one attention. Poor preparation for college and beyond. Always looking the other way with those kids who are just squeaking by and get easily lost in the crowd due to not being the most popular, or smartest, or just has an unusual personality. Students are mean and judge mental. Bullying still goes on but in inconspicuous ways.', 'Everyone can join any sport they want. No one is rejected by a sports team and is able to play. During football season many students go to the football games to show their support for our school.', 'I feel the school is safe we never really had a problem and if we did school staff and police came immideatly', 'something for everyone I did 3 sports', 'Principle and Vice principle very involved in both school and after school activities', 'Great teams for a small school', 'Lots of choices, atletics, clubs', 'The building is old, a lot of parent involvement from my mom', 'The teacher s are good most of them really care', 'The school food is ok nothing special, always a salad', 'there really wasnt anything that the school did to impress me or excite me', 'i really only like 2 of them out of every teacher', 'the dress code is a big deal at the school. teachers are way to concerned with how kids are dressing and it is extremely annoying.', "i don't feel like a lot of my teachers genuinely care", 'The school is okay, nothing really exciting is provided by the school though. terrible school spirit.', 'Park Ridge tried their best to prepare me for the future. My senior year most of the time we were having assemblies on how to have a bright future. One thing I have to say about Park Ridge is that they want everyone to go to a college and have a bright future. I think only a couple of kids in my class did not go to school. When I got to college I felt prepared because I was use to the work load. ', "Park Ridge High school was okay. Education is very important and we ranked 13ht of the best public schools in Bergen county. We do have great teachers but the school is very small. People were not that accepting and nice. Also with it being such a small school, everybody knew everyone's business. "]

column1: Central Jersey College Prep Charter School
column2: ["Overall, CJCP is a good school. It's good for people who prefer smaller classrooms, opportunities for taking advanced courses, being pushed to get higher test scores, and getting extra college application help.", "I like this school because it provides students a great education and social involvement. This school ensures that students are ready for college. I'd like this school to offer more sport opportunities and clubs.", 'My school lacks diversity. They have a lot of white students and Indian. The minorities are looked down upon. An idea would be having teachers go to workshops that include how to deal with different students and situations. A big part of students going to school feeling like they are less than is because of the administration. The core classes in my school do not include honors courses, they have dual enrollment classes that make it impossible to pass with the amount of workload they give us. They also have AP classes that are helpful if passed. All of the classes are super challenging. The electives are super boring and they don’t have anything that is based on any career field. They have basics like music and art.', "What I liked was that this school prepares you for college. They do not let you slack and provide you with a lot of work that will make you prepared for tests and college. One thing that I don't like is how strict the school is. The teachers and administrators don't want to hear you or your explanations and can be close-minded. This school needs to work on their social opportunities especially sports and clubs but it does have potential.  Like every school some of the teachers are helpful and others not, it just depends. I personally think this school is diverse as I've met people from every race, religion, and ethnic group.", "This school is so horrible. They use unqualified teachers to fill in for staff that leaves to a new school. There are no sports, and no extracurriculars. The worst school I've been in by far.", "This school isn't for everyone. I've heard countless times from various students that the school is trash, if the school pisses you off once, it will continue to. From the perspective of someone who constantly heard the grievances, and compliments of the school and has come to their own decision, the school honestly sits right in the middle. I personally feel that everything that matters such as the cafeteria food, the education, and the safety of the students was handled very nicely, aside from some notorious substitute teachers that are popular amongst every grade in the school.", 'It has all you need to learn. This school has a good 84% in reading academics. And the good, good school cares more for academics than sports. Yeah sports are fun. Well at least they have teams for sports, but the place should improve on the entrance. Sometimes the doors are too heavy to open.', 'This school has its ups and downs. On one hand, it is a very diverse school and you can get along with most of the students and teachers. On the other hand, management is a slump and students have very little say in what goes on. The building can sometimes have problems and rules established by the handbook change at the most random of times.', 'I have heard mixed reviews of the place. I understand the education quality comes down to the individual teacher but how reliable is the review of the teachers keep changing - which Charternschools are known for!', 'Teachers are good but current administration is bad, they only care about the money and overspending.  They do not use the money where it is needed, they keep having studies done about expansion. The administration needs to focus in getting all issues hammered out before trying to expand enrollment or campuses. Administration was better a few years ago. School is getting worse instead of getting better. Blue Ribbon status was obtained by previous administration and for grades 6-12.', "The administration in this school is unnecessarily strict. Often times they make rules, don't enforce them, and then change them within a year. Teachers are nice if you actively build a relationship with them. Grades are mostly inflated and if you try you will get high grades. They give you the classes you want most of the time. Administration does not allow many freedoms and do not interact with students at all.", "The school helps involve students to gain a better education. The school has gotten students to take part in college credit courses. Central Jersey College Prep Charter School helps voice their opinions on the students' improvement and how can the student take a step further than what he or she has been doing. Currently, the school has taken part in helping students to take part in clubs and activities. By aiding the students to take a step higher than what the student is used to, the staffs work nonstop to get us closer to a higher goal. One thing that could help the school progress is if the staffs do not force the load upon the students. Instead, the staffs should aid the students to believe that they should accomplish the work themselves.", 'What I like most about my school are teachers. They taught with the passion of a lifelong teacher, someone who lived to inspire a love of learning in the next generation. Another good thing which I like to mention that makes my school be a special place is "diversity." The only change I would like to see is the wide variety of foreign languages offered.', "I like that you get to use chrome books for learning. I don't like that students opinions aren't really being heard or applied into the school. I'd like for the school to listen to students and not be so strict on the smallest things such as shoes or where to specifically walk.", 'Central Jersey College Prep was a fantastic School when Mr. T was the principal. Since the new principal, it’s not a happy place like it used to be.  Principal doesn’t even know his own students and has taken many things away.  Teachers are still good(except for a few).', "I like that this school greatly prepared their students for a college education. This process began through middle school and increased as students got into high school. Not only did the school's education help prepare students with what to expect for college but most teachers were very supportive and caring of their students which was also good to have.", 'TERRIBLE I CAN NOT STRESS ENOUGH WE DONT EVEN.HAVE A PROPER GYM THEY GIVE YOU ISS AND OSS FOR SKIPPING A CLUB WHEN YOU DONT EVEN HAVE THE PROPER ROOM FOR THEM. COME ON THEY LURE THE KIDS AND GET THEM INTERESTED AND THEN THEY DONT DO AND THING COME ON YOU DUMB PEOPLE MAKE A SCHOOL REALLY, NOT GARBAGE!', "Social-wise, CJCPCS is a very close community of students and  faculty, so everyone usually knows everyone. It's a close group, making it easier to get to know your peers and make friends easily. Small class sizes also allow students to have one-on-one communication with their teachers, allowing them to receive help in a more relaxing setting than if  placed among a large class. However, I would like to see change in administration and the way they view the student body. Even as a senior, it still becomes difficult to bring up certain topics or to discuss our own opinions without being ridiculed and ignored. We should be able to sit down with administration and be able to have a reasonable conversation where all of our opinions and views are respected without being shut down. Also, there needs to be more communication with the school and the student body and teachers, as major changes are performed that directly affect staff and the students, yet we are uninformed until days later.", 'I like how CJCP focuses on getting you into the college environment with the challenging work and the adaptation to technology to make it more accessible for students; however, I would like to have more club activity/club empowerment to perform activities that can raise awareness of the club and allow to raise funds for further club activity into the school, especially increasing student morale so that they genuinely enjoy learning in the environment CJCP provides.', 'The academics at this school are very challenging, yet rewarding and students take an abundance of college level classes to help prepare for a university level education. However more social clubs and athletic programs could help this school grow to even more of a potential.']

column6: ['Resources are good, but the building needs work.', 'We have few activities with very little variety.', 'Most teachers are devoted, yet some abuse power.', "We didn't have a real gymnasium it was a lunch room that was used as a gym.", 'The goods equally weight be bads', 'Great range of academics though the work is rigorous', 'A lot of teachers teach well and have many methods', 'No athletics here. Students have to sign up at schools in their respective towns.', "The school is great in academics and providing education, but the school is in not so good condition and we have make shift classrooms and a lot of leaks and the gym isn't even a gym.", 'Nothing is out of the ordinary. Pretty much everything is average or below average especially the gymnasium. ', 'Its a small school so most of the students are friends or associates. Everyone should know each others name', "One thing that I definitely don't like about the school is the lack of sports and school spirit. The equipment also isnt in the best conditions", 'The school has definitely pushed me to my limits and has made me work harder then ever in order to achieve the grades I was so used to getting.', 'There are lots of security cameras but no one is ever sure if they actually work. But every student and faculty member is required to carry a id at all times which is heavily enforced.', 'There are certain teachers who have a greater known passion for the subjects they teach while others are just average but still great teachers overall.', 'When in school, lunch inst always my favorite meal of the dey', 'My overall view of the school is very good. Throughout my 2 years at the school my work ethic has improved greatly and I love how the school puts all of our goals and resources right in front of us.', 'Some policies in the school are completely out of the ordinary while others are followed by all students', 'Most of the students in my school are far away from there homes, the participation in the after school activities arent as high as they should be due to students lack of transportation from these activities.', 'Teachers put a lot of work into curriculum']

column2: ["I had an amazing experience while attending Long Beach High School. They facilitated many sports and classes that gave everyone a chance to study their interests. They ranged between artistic and cultural classes such as IB Dance to express themselves. They had even had on classes such as Auto shop, metal shop and even woodshop. There are not many things that I want to change in our school. I would like our school to focus a little bit more on the sciences and mathematics that they provide. They should have more AP classes presented rather than a full IB class selection in many areas. This could easily be fixed and I'm still glad they provide accelerated courses in ours school.", "What i liked about long beach unified school district is how they have the resources I need and there's a staff there to help you with whatever it you need.", 'As a freshman, coming from a middle school in a small town, that consisted of 80 students per grade, I could safely say that transitioning to Long Beach High School was daunting, to say the least. However, with friendly students, helpful teachers, and a plethora of courses and clubs to choose from, I settled in quite nicely and quickly.  Being the only Freshman, to get into the school drama, ¨You Can´t Take it with You¨, I made some of my very best friends. All of which were older and helped guide me throughout the rest of my high school journey. Ever since, I´ve participated in 6 other school shows, portrayed leading roles, and became an active member of the Thespian Honor Society.  Through Long Beach High School´s theater program, I´ve grown as a person and have just flat out grown-up, with my best friends by my side. This goes to show that Long Beach High School had the resources and clubs that I needed to discover my passion, and for that, I couldn´t be more grateful.', 'This is a great school with a lot of cultural and racial diversity. The campus is right on the bay. It offers a lot of clubs and sports as well', "I was fortunate enough to attend a great school district that cares about the students and their future careers that they will one day pursue. The staff from the middle school and high school I attended provide opportunities for student to aid and help them. For example, they have amazing college advisers in my high school's College and Career Center in which they host workshops for students to complete college application, scholarships like this one or financial aid.", 'The faculty at Long Beach are astounding. They have a passion and a drive to see that the students succeed in every aspect of their lives and the years ahead of them.', 'In Long Beach High School the teachers are very nice. If you have any question there is always someone around to answer it for you. The hallways and bathrooms are kept clean by the awesome janitors who will always interact with the students. The only down side (probably like almost every other school) the school food could be better.', 'I moved in Long Beach about 3 years ago from Brooklyn, NY. I took online school: Laurel Springs for my 2 years of 8th and 9th grade. Transferring from online school to Long Beach High School, was at first a big transition. But the overall welcoming community from this high school opened me to multiple opportunities from sports to clubs and activities. I personally joined the tennis team because I enjoyed the sport, but it also allowed my to meet so many new friends. I was also interested in the theater production and I contributed to many plays and musicals as well. Overall, my high school showed me many opportunities in academics and my education. Also, my guidance counselor greatly helped me with my preparedness towards my college and my future.', 'Have teachers be more understanding and flexible. Some teachers refuse to understand that we play sports and take other classes. Few also refuse to understand our conflict', 'Throughout my entire four years at Long Beach Polytechnic High School, I have never had a bulling issue. The school is very diverse and the teachers and staff are trustworthy. I can easily confide in any teacher and any faculty. The sports teams are beyond amazing. I was part of Long Beach Poly Cross Country from 2015-2018 and it was a memorable experience. It was not a team but a family. The coaches, Coach Nate and Coach John, were very encouraging and always pushed the athletes further than the athletes thought they can do. It’s my last two months at Long Beach Poly and I still confide in both of these coaches with everything and anything.', "My experience in Long Beach High School has had its ups and downs. I would like to talk about the resources provided within the school. During my senior year at this high school, I faced hardships within my home life that began to affect my academics. The school then provided me with a therapist that was separate from the school district, and I was also able to visit the school's psychologist any time I felt it was necessary. The majority of the teachers here are more than understanding and kind. The school culture is very good, no one is extremely kind but no one is looking to harm anyone. What I would like to see changed at this school, however, is the facilities and the food. The bathrooms have essentially been transformed into vaping-rooms, and the bathroom stall doors are typically broken. This high school has a lot of course options and also offers the International Baccalaureate diploma, which will prepare you for college and make your transcript look excellent.", 'Long Beach High School has a diverse range of children attending. The school is similar to a melting pot containing all races, religions and beliefs. Long Beach High School also created a wide curriculum to help each individual students needs and or interests to help them thrive.', 'If you have your own group of friends they will help you to have a great high school experience. There are great teachers there and you can easily make a connection with them. There are also bad teachers who don’t know how to teach. By being involved in clubs and sports you are able to make new friends and you create a family of some sort.', 'Teachers are extremely caring.  Have grown up in Long Beach and the community is great. Everyone is very polite and mannerly', 'The staff within Long Beach High School is probably the best thing about the school. Everyone is willing to help as long as you give them respect. Whether it is a janitor who you share your problems with or your guidance counselor, the staff at Long Beach High School will always support their students. Success is achieved much easier when people are right behind you. Also,  many challenging classes are offered to the students. Counselors encourage taking these harder classes in order to better prepare for college. Extra help and other programs are available to students who struggle in order to almost ensure success. Another positive of Long Beach High School is the wide-range of clubs available. For any hobby or interest, there seems to be a club for it. The students are always kept busy and always have something that they can do. There is definitely room for improvement in the cafeteria. The food is not good and usually vending machines are not either.', 'Long Beach Senior High School has a very wide variety of classes. However, for those of us who would like to challenge ourselves with difficult classes, it is very difficult to balance our schedules. I struggle to fit all of the classes I would like to take into my schedule.', 'I like that the school faculty really cares about the students. The school offers different programs for students to help them in their academics...like AP and IB programs. Long Beach High offers a variety of electives like tv studio production and architecture .', 'I feel that Long Beach High School had a lot of opportunities to offer the students.   There was not a lot of diversity but I do feel like I learned a lot and am prepared for college.', 'Teachers are very attentive to my daughters needs, security in school is excellent and the students are focused in their studies. Great school to belong to.', 'The teachers are a mix of good and bad, many genuinely care about the students. Offer many good extra curricular opportunities. They  offer a mix of easy and very challenging classes, science research and volunteer opportunities. The guidance staff is amazing and will really work with you to set goals and stay on track.']

column6: ['I loved meeting many new people and becoming very close to them. I loved seeing everyone care for one another. But the problem is the id situation in our school is being taken to the next level. The teachers and administration need to stop hunting us down if we don’t carry around our ID cards to punch in once a day at lunch? Like what good is that. That needs to change and I would like to see all the teachers have open ears and listen to the students.', 'High school is what you make it, and if you want to be involved and have fun then there are clubs for you to do that with. Course offerings are diverse but structuring is rigorous. A lot of the interior is an eyesore and most of the bathrooms are busted as well. Overall, lots of school-wide events but would like to see more effort being put into the success of minority students into honors level courses.', 'senior year was the best year. despite the hurricane closing our school they made our senior year worth while', 'Food and bathroom sucks, IB program is a hoax, Teachers are unable to handle students, all around bad experience', 'Long beach senior high school is the best place to learn excellen teachers and education as well. Is Also a safe place', "Long Beach High School prioritizes an academic program (IB) in which most schools will not accept or don't acknowledge, wasting the student's time and money. However, the teachers, clubs and diversity are excellent. You're bound to find a solid group of friends within weeks of entering Long Beach, since it's such a large school.", 'Long Beach overall was an amazing experience, I did not have many problems with faculty and resources were always available to me. I enjoyed the learning environment and it was a safe space overall. The classes I took challenged me to the greatest of my caliber and I am thankful for that.', 'Although it was very tiring, one of the best parts about Long Beach High School was the ability to take part in the International Baccalaureate program.  That along with some amazing teachers to guide me along the way made me feel ready for the prodigious college workload I will be soon to face. Having such attentive and caring teachers by my side made high school worth it.', 'While it can be ratchet at times, depending on who you surround yourself with, Long Beach High School has many higher-level courses and enrichment programs available to students who wish to prepare themselves for college. Plenty of organizations and clubs to join and be a part of, however the food could be better improved.', 'School "Culture" is horrible. As lax as can be. Students are not pushed nor are they disciplined. Building and grounds are in horrible shape despite being renovated a few years ago.', 'I like the how there are many challenging courses available. There are many classes useful to prepare yourself for college.', "My Experience in Long beach High School was great, the teachers really give you so many chances to learn and be apart of the class. The teachers were so understanding and helpful with anything you needed I don't see anything that they would need to change.", 'The teachers are great and helpful but the social aspect of the school is rough and very clique oriented', "It's a great school with amazing teachers and administrators to help with your future. It is a great place to learn and has great extracurricular activities. It has various sports and clubs to choose from and they are fun and unique.Overall Long Beach High School is a great school to start your future.", 'I loved Long Beach Senior High School so much. My parents lived in Long Beach their entire lives so Long Beach', 'While the school has many great arts programs as well as technological opportunities, many of the fundamental classes are taught by uninterested or unmotivated teachers, creating an altogether negative learning environment.', "One of the best things about my high school is that the teachers really do care. They accommodate the students in every way. Whether it's giving extra credit, providing extra help, or encouraging students. I would have liked to see the school offer better food.", 'Long Beach High School is great.  Lots of variety of classes to choose from, great teachers and counselors and great extracurricular activities to choose from.  ', 'Long Beach Senior High School is a good school with excellent teachers. Academically, this is where Long Beach has a lot to offer. This school offers the International Baccalaureate Program. Students have the ability to obtain the IB diploma and graduate with credits for college.  ', 'The teachers are helpful and able to work well with students. Students often work collaboratively and help each other out. However, there are many students who are apathetic towards their classes and it would be nice to see them more engaged in their studies.']

column2: ['My experience at Wayne Valley high school has been truly unforgettable. The classes and many opportunities they offer here help you learn many new things that help prepare you for when you graduate and go to college. Wayne Valley also has various sports and clubs that you can join in which will then lead you to meet new people and experiencing new things.  For example, my experience in competitive cheerleading here is what most importantly completed my high school journey. From being grand national champions, 3x big north champio, and 3x state champions, the wayne valley competitive cheer team has achieved so much. Considering this, I am so grateful to have been able to experience these winning moments and  I will never forget it. Overall, my experience here at Wayne Valley has helped me discover my love for cheer and has helped me work pass my limits and learn and grow as a person.', 'I believe there is not enough attention paid to the mental health of the students.   It is a very difficult time in kids lives and there is tremendous pressure for success and a lot of competition.  Kids need an outlet that can be trusted.  I believe there should be off site  confidential counseling  available  to all students  free of charge.  It could be pain for through the taxes and cut costs in other areas.', 'At Wayne Valley HS, there is always a lot of activity and out of school things to do. What I loved the most is being a part of Television Production and a Varsity Soccer and Volleyball player. Everyone here is always involved and Friday Night lights are always a great experience since I run the student section for my senior year. These past 4 years have been amazing and it has been a pleasure to call myself a Wayne Valley Indian.', 'Wayne valley has been a lot of fun, but also a tough four years. Football games are always a blast in the student section, and the other sporting events are also very fun to attend. Valley has a lot of school pride against our rivals, Wayne Hills. The teaching staff is eh depending on the subject, most math teachers are not the best, but there are a few gems. Same with the sciences, but the history and english teachers are pretty great across the board.', 'I transferred to Wayne Valley in my senior year from Florida. Everyone here was so kind to me and they helped me a lot during my adaptation. I made life-long friends there. My college advisor helped a lot during my school year. Athletics here is a huge culture at Wayne Valley. They care about the students and the community.', 'Wayne Valley did a great job at providing opportunities to help educate us in a variety of different teaching methods and subjects to prepare for our later educational or vocational ventures. However, I think that more foreign languages should have been offered, including Mandarin which is widely spoken by the global population and can be helpful for those going into international relations or politics, as well as hands on research opportunities with medical practices and businesses to introduce research for those in the scientific fields as an exciting, rather than daunting, practice.', 'I had a positive high school experience at Wayne Valley. However, some of the teachers showed obvious favoritism and did not have the most effective teaching methods.', 'It was a good school. Teacher are very nice and compassionate. I enjoyed my time there and I would recommend it.', 'Many of my teachers from Valley have left a lasting impact on my life! There are fun ways to get involved with peers and extracurriculars that are prominent.', "Wayne Valley High School was a very different experience for me... meaning that in the best way possible! I found myself socializing with many people and making many new friends. The teachers are always willing to support students and are always available when students need them. The school's safety is of not much concern at all, with there being a police station right next to the campus. With its diverse AP courses, Wayne Valley will have you leaving its doors having an idea of what you want to accomplish in life. I am definitely glad that I was able to spend my four years of high school  at such a good school!", "Among the raid of various fake bomb threats, constant remarks of racism and injustice, with vaping and overall mean behavior flooding each corner, this school provides an awful experience. The food is always fried garbage, and overpriced. Kids are always stealing food in the cramped and crowded lunch line, pushing over people. The teaching experience is so inconsistent. You could have a teacher that pushes you to the edge, giving hours of homework a night. Or you could have a free period and an easy A. The outcome of this school is literally random, just a roll of the dice. If you don't die from the lack of air conditioning in June, or from teachers and students raising pitchforks against you, you'll die from the lack of knowledge this experience brings.", 'Great classes and teachers to prepare students for college.  Competitive athletics programs for all students.', 'I attended Wayne Valley for all four years of high school. The academics are very good. Much better than private schools. Although the teachers can be difficult and boring they seem to get their point across. Except for math which is very difficult for wayne students overall. The food is decent just common sodexo food. But seniors get to leave campus for lunch which is clutch.', 'I really enjoy being a student at Wayne Valley.  Our school is ran very well and I feel very safe there.  I enjoy attending all events that the schools hosts and I enjoy participating in sports there as well.  The teachers are great and I have made great relationships with a few of them through my years there.  The guidance department is very helpful too as when I have questions my counselor is always willing to help.  I have made a lot of friends there and I must say these past 3 plus years have been the best years of my life so far.  I am very proud to be a Wayne Valley student.', 'I like the sports programs and coaches. The counselors are very helpful and there are a lot of school activities that you can get involved in.', 'I liked that the teachers cared for the students and were willing to stay after school to provide extra help. I believe that by taking extra help, you can prepare yourself for what comes next and ace it. The thing that I would like to be changed would be to have a better solution to vaping in the bathrooms.', "Many of the teachers blatantly show their favoritism, and it is hard to overcome the teachers here who consistently give you bad grades after you question them. However, some of the teachers are really good. Also, the school is more focused on the football team, (which had a 1-9 loss-to-win ratio this year), but it really should be more focused on the teams that actually win, such as the girls' basketball and fencing teams. Finally, the school is disgusting. There are bugs in the girls' locker room, the auditorium, and the bathrooms.", 'Excellent academics, including many AP classes to choose from. Wayne Valley also offers a wide range of elective classes to choose from, from business to computer programming to marketing (dual enrollment with a local college) to  CAD. Great opportunity for students to explore what they may be interested in  for college.', 'I liked the teachers at Wayne Valley. They all care about their students and make sure we are keeping up with our work.', 'I graduated from Wayne Valley two years ago and my sister goes there currently. I enjoyed high school- from the academics, sports, teachers, and general atmosphere.']
column4: ['My experience at Wayne Valley high school has been truly unforgettable. The classes and many opportunities they offer here help you learn many new things that help prepare you for when you graduate and go to college. Wayne Valley also has various sports and clubs that you can join in which will then lead you to meet new people and experiencing new things.  For example, my experience in competitive cheerleading here is what most importantly completed my high school journey. From being grand national champions, 3x big north champio, and 3x state champions, the wayne valley competitive cheer team has achieved so much. Considering this, I am so grateful to have been able to experience these winning moments and  I will never forget it. Overall, my experience here at Wayne Valley has helped me discover my love for cheer and has helped me work pass my limits and learn and grow as a person.', 'I believe there is not enough attention paid to the mental health of the students.   It is a very difficult time in kids lives and there is tremendous pressure for success and a lot of competition.  Kids need an outlet that can be trusted.  I believe there should be off site  confidential counseling  available  to all students  free of charge.  It could be pain for through the taxes and cut costs in other areas.', 'At Wayne Valley HS, there is always a lot of activity and out of school things to do. What I loved the most is being a part of Television Production and a Varsity Soccer and Volleyball player. Everyone here is always involved and Friday Night lights are always a great experience since I run the student section for my senior year. These past 4 years have been amazing and it has been a pleasure to call myself a Wayne Valley Indian.', 'Wayne valley has been a lot of fun, but also a tough four years. Football games are always a blast in the student section, and the other sporting events are also very fun to attend. Valley has a lot of school pride against our rivals, Wayne Hills. The teaching staff is eh depending on the subject, most math teachers are not the best, but there are a few gems. Same with the sciences, but the history and english teachers are pretty great across the board.', 'I transferred to Wayne Valley in my senior year from Florida. Everyone here was so kind to me and they helped me a lot during my adaptation. I made life-long friends there. My college advisor helped a lot during my school year. Athletics here is a huge culture at Wayne Valley. They care about the students and the community.', 'Wayne Valley did a great job at providing opportunities to help educate us in a variety of different teaching methods and subjects to prepare for our later educational or vocational ventures. However, I think that more foreign languages should have been offered, including Mandarin which is widely spoken by the global population and can be helpful for those going into international relations or politics, as well as hands on research opportunities with medical practices and businesses to introduce research for those in the scientific fields as an exciting, rather than daunting, practice.', 'I had a positive high school experience at Wayne Valley. However, some of the teachers showed obvious favoritism and did not have the most effective teaching methods.', 'It was a good school. Teacher are very nice and compassionate. I enjoyed my time there and I would recommend it.', 'Many of my teachers from Valley have left a lasting impact on my life! There are fun ways to get involved with peers and extracurriculars that are prominent.', "Wayne Valley High School was a very different experience for me... meaning that in the best way possible! I found myself socializing with many people and making many new friends. The teachers are always willing to support students and are always available when students need them. The school's safety is of not much concern at all, with there being a police station right next to the campus. With its diverse AP courses, Wayne Valley will have you leaving its doors having an idea of what you want to accomplish in life. I am definitely glad that I was able to spend my four years of high school  at such a good school!", "Among the raid of various fake bomb threats, constant remarks of racism and injustice, with vaping and overall mean behavior flooding each corner, this school provides an awful experience. The food is always fried garbage, and overpriced. Kids are always stealing food in the cramped and crowded lunch line, pushing over people. The teaching experience is so inconsistent. You could have a teacher that pushes you to the edge, giving hours of homework a night. Or you could have a free period and an easy A. The outcome of this school is literally random, just a roll of the dice. If you don't die from the lack of air conditioning in June, or from teachers and students raising pitchforks against you, you'll die from the lack of knowledge this experience brings.", 'Great classes and teachers to prepare students for college.  Competitive athletics programs for all students.', 'I attended Wayne Valley for all four years of high school. The academics are very good. Much better than private schools. Although the teachers can be difficult and boring they seem to get their point across. Except for math which is very difficult for wayne students overall. The food is decent just common sodexo food. But seniors get to leave campus for lunch which is clutch.', 'I really enjoy being a student at Wayne Valley.  Our school is ran very well and I feel very safe there.  I enjoy attending all events that the schools hosts and I enjoy participating in sports there as well.  The teachers are great and I have made great relationships with a few of them through my years there.  The guidance department is very helpful too as when I have questions my counselor is always willing to help.  I have made a lot of friends there and I must say these past 3 plus years have been the best years of my life so far.  I am very proud to be a Wayne Valley student.', 'I like the sports programs and coaches. The counselors are very helpful and there are a lot of school activities that you can get involved in.', 'I liked that the teachers cared for the students and were willing to stay after school to provide extra help. I believe that by taking extra help, you can prepare yourself for what comes next and ace it. The thing that I would like to be changed would be to have a better solution to vaping in the bathrooms.', "Many of the teachers blatantly show their favoritism, and it is hard to overcome the teachers here who consistently give you bad grades after you question them. However, some of the teachers are really good. Also, the school is more focused on the football team, (which had a 1-9 loss-to-win ratio this year), but it really should be more focused on the teams that actually win, such as the girls' basketball and fencing teams. Finally, the school is disgusting. There are bugs in the girls' locker room, the auditorium, and the bathrooms.", 'Excellent academics, including many AP classes to choose from. Wayne Valley also offers a wide range of elective classes to choose from, from business to computer programming to marketing (dual enrollment with a local college) to  CAD. Great opportunity for students to explore what they may be interested in  for college.', 'I liked the teachers at Wayne Valley. They all care about their students and make sure we are keeping up with our work.', 'I graduated from Wayne Valley two years ago and my sister goes there currently. I enjoyed high school- from the academics, sports, teachers, and general atmosphere.']
column6: ["I've been going to Wayne Valley for 4 years now and my overall experience has been pretty average with a few good moments. The academics here at this school can be good or bad depending on which teacher you get. Most teachers here actually seem interested in teaching though and make an effort to make sure their students understand what is going on. On the other hand, some of the administrative staff do not seem to care at all and only do things that benefit them or fix problems that are easy for them. If you do a sport, most of the coaches here are great but you do have some that think they are when they are not. Overall, Wayne Valley is a pretty good high school to go to.", 'For the years I’ve spent at Wayne Valley High School it is hard to find one word to desrcibe them, but if I had to I’d say its been interesting. Overall the school is pretty okay with nothing spectacular of course, but it is a good school. Also theres a pool on the third floor.', 'My experience at Wayne Valley High School has definitely been one to remember. Most of the teachers that I have had teach well and keep me engaged and always wanting to learn more. Furthermore, I have been lucky enough to meet the best friend I have ever had during my high school career. Even though I am excited to be going away to college soon, there will always be a part of me that missed Wayne Valley.', "Overall, a great experience.  However as a senior, the lack of on site parking is an  issue for me.  We're required to share spots.  Participation in sports, after school meetings and clubs could make the ride situation a challenge.", 'Wayne Valley High School has overall given me a great high school experience. The courses are challenging, but the teachers will always be happy to answer your questions or stay after school with you. I feel very safe and accepted when I am in class or attending a school run event. There are many opportunities to get involved in the school like the sports, extra curricular activities or many clubs. Although this is an impressive high school, I would like to see more diversity among the students.', 'Wayne Valley has great teachers to help foster the growth of all their students. Valley has amazing school spirit and academics capable to prepare the students for college.', 'I liked the student environment and how everyone was treated as equal but the guidance consultants who are in charge of class scheduling were absolutely terrible.', 'Wayne Valley is a school that provides students with a range of classes to take. Teachers are very helpful and there are many clubs and sports to chose from to join.', "average school it's highschool you gotta just do it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!1", "I like most teachers at Wayne Valley. I think they're very nice and know what they are doing. I think Wayne Valley is in a nice town, too. I would love for the school to get some air conditioning and heat.", 'Going to Wayne Valley High School has shaped me as a strong, independent person. I enjoyed being a part of field hockey, peer leaders, and NHS.', 'Wayne Valley is a great school community. staff is very helpful and friendly. The children there are also friendly too!', 'I had a great experience at Wayne Valley during my 4 years there.  I was involved with Boys Soccer for 4 years.  I was in the NHS for my junior and senior year.I was able to take 6 AP classes where I scored a 4 or higher which allowed me to get credit for 4 college classes.', "Some teachers here are amazing. There are teachers that you feel comfortable with and trust completely to help guide you through the year. Then there are teacher who have no idea how to control the students and teachers who are arrested for selling heroine. It really depends on the class you are taking. You can be stuck with a terrible teacher, an easy teacher, a wonderful teacher, a strict teacher, etc. There are many clubs and organizations available which is nice. It might be nice if students didn't vape in the halls though.", "It's great school for sports and activity and it's in top 100 schools of Nj . Needs more challenging teachers in some area which brings best out in students", 'Wayne Valley offers a wide variety of classes that are surprisingly successful and unique. There re opportunities in workshop to build great pieces, in child development to get first hand experience with kids, and in TV to make productions and becomes hosts on the show.', "The janitors are always extremely accommodating towards sports and other activities. There are a bunch of opportunities for involvement in the community, in sports, and in clubs. However, the activities at Valley don't get recognized nearly enough town-wide, due to the fact that the other high school in our town is larger and better funded. Due to vandalism in one stall, almost all the guys' bathrooms at Valley have been locked for two and a half years (which is ridiculous). The teachers are mostly good ones, and are quite supportive overall. ", 'I enjoyed being at Wayne Valley. They provided me with many academic opportunities and assistance, as well as extracuriccular activities. In addition, it is a safe area to be around.', 'Good variety of AP classes. Intelligent teachers that work with students if they try. The Latin program could be fixed by eliminating the teacher. ', 'Overall, the academics of this school are very hard. Students are constantly overwhelmed with the amount of work they are given and the amount of tests and quizzes during the week. There are popular classes, mainly those taught by good teachers, such as business classes taught by Mr. Martinez. AP classes are very popular as well, with even Freshmen getting into AP classes sometimes.']
