column2: ['My experience in DP has been very mind-opening, the teachers here push me to be my very best. They also force me to step out of my comfort zone to try new things and that helped me become more open-minded.', 'School has a numerous amount of educational opportunities. The teachers create detail oriented lessons that help aid the classroom environment. However, the school should enforce safety better and pick the right students to be enrolled.', "It is a good school for academics. The school does push it's scholars to go above and beyond. It does help some students with college prep(mostly juniors and seniors). Allows individuals to gain the necessary education needed for their life. My experience was not the typically viewed high school experience, but I am set up for success in college. Democracy prep is a great school to send an individual. Also because of Democracy Prep, I was able to learn Korean and was able to take the Korean Lote exam. Learning such a different language allowed me to experience many different things I was unknown to.", "I'm a current student in Democracy Prep High School it's a school that functions around making sure every student that attend the school goes to a good college.", 'Democracy Prep Charter High School provides students of color a chance at a great education. Things that could possibly change is the discipline system.', 'Very welcoming and teachers love to help out scholars! This school will teach you everything you need to know to graduate with a Advanced Regents Diploma and know what to study at the end of your high School career.', 'My experience is both good and bad. I have made life long friends and Democracy Prep has given me opportunities that other schools can’t give me. However, their protocols are unrealistic and don’t prepare us for the world outside of school. The teachers truly do care for our learning, but they’re too on top of us for everything that doesn’t give us any independence or room to learn from our mistakes. My friends and I actually bond more when speaking about the changes the school can make. For example, they can let us walk through the halls without a pass, especially if we’re on our way to class, without being penalized. Also, they can not mark us late at 8:15 just because we’re not in our seats, but are in the building.', 'If you want your child to have a great chance at going to college I would recommend  Democracy Prep. With great college trips and international trips such as South Korea and Rome, parents will love this school for their kids. What makes this school the best is the teachers without the great teachers the school would not be half as great.', 'It is a great and informative experience that really challenges you as a student. That being said, it is not a school fit for everyone.', "Democracy Prep Public Schools takes immense care of each scholar's education; Teachers are invested in the lives and well being of the scholars. The school has high expectations of student's educational outcome; the general mindset of a passing grade is a 70 ( C -) and above. However, the school goes above and beyond to encourage students to score an average of an 83 ( B -) on all of their classes as if it was the bare minimum of a 70.  The school has a strict uniform policy to decrease risk of bullying and thief while travelling home on New York City's subways. The school provides higher level education to prepare students for college; by the end of senior year scholars are expected to have completed 9 regents exam with a score of 70 or higher, 10 civil skills, 100 hours or more of internships and pass their year long change the world research paper that requires them to have 30 pages or more of research and attempts of changing a current world- wide problem of their choice.", 'I hate this school so much. There were times where this school made me feel like I should not be living in this world anymore. No student should have to feel that way so the fact that I do feel this way is very bad.', "Democracy prep has been a very good school to me academically wise for the 7 years. I've been going to the school ever since 6t grade and they helped me get into my dream college Fordham.", 'Though many things about the school were difficult; the academics, the restrictions, the behavior control, there was a lot about it that I did have to acknowledge down the road. There were many things that I took for granted at the time while being in the school and now that I have graduated, it allowed me to realize the reasons as to why so many rules were put in place. Lots of the classes that I took still help me to this day. The skills that I have learned over the years of being in Democracy Prep has allowed me to successfully do well in my courses now that I am in college. I truly am grateful for the experience that was given to me. The community in the school is also a wonder to behold. Once you get to know people it feels almost like family because everyone struggles together.', 'Democracy Prep Harlem High is relatively new compared to other high schools. They have strict adherence to uniform, ethical and behavioral rules. They have DREAM BIG values which stand for Discipline, Respect, Accountability, Maturity, Bravery, Initiative and Grit. It is a close knit and Inclusive community. However, there are limited resources and the food is average at best. The people and friends will give you a positive overall experience.', 'Very good school in terms of academics very hard courses that forces students to have to work harder. With all our resources the graduation and college acceptance his very high and at the end of the year students graduate with an advance regents diploma.', 'Democracy Prep students are well behaved, respectful and hardworking. The system as a whole at Democracy Prep is amazing because the teachers are well qualified, and teach reasonable materials preparing scholars to earn an advanced diploma. Teachers also offer office hours to help students understand the class topics more.', 'The school does an excellent job preparing students for college and beyond. Students are exposed to rigorous work that constantly challenge them. I had a wonderful experience from 6th grade to 12th grade. Now I feel prepared for college and whatever that comes next.', 'Democracy Prep has pushed me to not just think critically academically but to think critically about my future. I am very fortunate to be surrounded by peers and staff members that motivate me to continue what I am doing in order to be successful high school and beyond. Without the amazing opportunities I receive from Democracy Prep, I would not have developed into the passionate an hardworking scholar I am today.', "DPCHS is a public charter school with a very rigorous curriculum. The school pushes students to complete their regents by senior year so that they are able to take AP classes during their senior year. The school also pushes students to aim for 80s or higher in all of their classes and on their tests instead of being satisfied by 70s. These efforts made by the school are a little bit extreme, but for the most part, it is reasonable because students should have this mentality when they go to college. I enjoyed a lot of the extra curricular activities at the school. The one of I loved the most was Men's group because it contained only male students and was meant to form friendships in that group so that we would bond with one another and be able to trust each other. The AP classes I took were very difficult but I made sure to pass those classes with 80s and above. I'm honestly happy that I was able to graduate from a school that offered me a challenge.", 'Democracy Prep Charter High School is a very rigourous college prepatory high school that prepares its scholars for living in America today. Democracy Prep works hard towards creating active citizen-scholars and with that comes a strict and challenging core curriculum as well as graduation requirements that involve civic engagement. The disciplinary sytem can be a little too harsh on scholars, however it is a great school in geeral.']

column6: ["What I liked about my school was the trips and how the teachers interacted with the students; however, what I don't like about DPCHS is that there policies and rules are extremely strict and have little to no room for change.", 'Democracy Prep Charter High School exemplifies the true meaning of unity and honesty. My high school consists of approximately only 300 students, and that allows us to be closer with each other which is why I feel comfortable enough to be myself. The teachers in my school support you in the academic aspect and the personal aspect. They always push you to be the best version of yourself.', 'My school allows for alot of freedom when it comes to our voices being heard; however, because it is such a small school our space is limited and we have to share many things such as even bathrooms. Democracy prep does truly care about my education and making sure I am a well equipped citizen by the time I graduate they’ve taken me to over three international trips from South Korea to Rome to Canada. I can see that the teachers are passionate about seeing their students do well too.', 'One of the things that I have liked about my experience in this school were the advance academic work that I was receiving as a student attending there. I was ahead of almost everyone in my other schools, which made it less difficult for me academically wise. However, I wish that this school gets into a safer environment and become less strict with the rules.', "Democracy Prep was an amazing school for academics. However, when it came to my opinions, I was silenced. I never really felt as if I had a voice in my school due to the fact that I was a minority. The school didn't really care about what the students had to say about the way things went on. They had a demerit system where students were penalized for little things such as talking, it belittled the students and made us feel less than the adults.", "The school is different from many other charter schools. It is strict but fair with its rules. The school starts preparing scholars for college from the first day that they attend. Teachers are actively involved in scholar's education and can be reached at any time through multiple different ways such as phone or email.", 'My son attended democracy prep from 6-12 grades. They prepare all students for college and ensure that they utilize their skills to the best of their abilities. Democracy prep Harlem high shouldn’t share facilities with any other schools that are for adults.', "What I like most about my school and that the teacher take the time to know you. You are greeted everyday with welcome faces and have a staff that will uplift you spirit. You are not alone in your studies and teacher take the time to assist you with your studies.It's like one big happy family, there are study classes and in between the studies are the fun time.", 'Its a very good school mainly because they push you to be your best, but it does have some faults through my eyes as a student which they can improve on.', 'Strong educational system influenced by Korean school systems. The level of disciplined required from scholars ensures successful futures not only in the workforce, but also with the community. Strongly community driven as well as academic and culturally.', 'I like the fact that teachers set high expectations for the students. I also like the support that Democracy Prep students and teachers offer to one another. The curriculum is rigorous and students at the school are really determined to make a change in the world. They are also very smart.', 'It is great. Glad to be apart of the Democracy Prep community. The academics are great. And the teachers push you to do your best. Also when it comes to College readiness, Democracy prep is always prepared .The model of the motto is to work hard, go to college, and change the world. Therefore, they prepare to go to college since the 6th grade. And there are always people there to answer any questions that you have about college. But there are something they still need to work on. But the aspects of what they need to work on varies on the Democracy High School you go to.', 'Democracy Prep Charter High School pushes students to work hard and achieve their goals. They make sure that every one goes to a college of there choice and successes in life. We also go on many trips to Paris, Korean, Africa and many others to make sure experience many different things that no one else as the opportunity to do. However I will like to see my school create a change in more student voice and opportunities.', 'Democracy Prep has a lot of good expectations that set students up for academic success. There are also incentives to make them keep up their grades and teachers who will require tutoring to make you succeed.', "I graduated from Democracy Prep Harlem Charter High School as the founding graduating class of 2017. I loved being able to grow in an environment that is small but where my classmates and I treated each other as a family. I was able to attend 3 international trips through DPHHS: Rome, Ecuador, and South Korea. These experiences were life changing. Not a lot of schools offer these amazing trips, and it just made me love this school even more. The help you get for college is awesome! You have a college team just focused on the juniors and seniors in the preparation for college. It's honestly an amazing school in all aspects and I would definitely place my kids in this school when I have them!", 'Democracy Prep Charter School was specifically designed to enforce a "college mindset". Within the school, students (at first) find it difficult to conform to the work load that is bestowed upon them. However, the heavy amounts of work the student is given prepares the student for college. In the school, students are faced with at least 8-10 pieces of homework and are expected to complete each piece. Because of the exorbitant amount of work students are given, alumni students return to the campus and explain that college life is easier for them; they are able to complete large projects and papers without feeling intimidated. The school also encourages a friendly environment; this includes pro-LGBTQ and anti-racism. The school teaches students how to apply their moral skills to the world, in which students learn how to adapt and communicate with others in the environment.', 'Democracy Prep took over my school when I was a freshman going into a sophomore.When the came my work load increased which was a positive looking back at it. Democracy Prep showed me that my school was very lenient with us . I grew up and matured much faster work wise with Democracy Prep.', "I'm currently a sophomore in this school and the only thing I need to say is there needs to be change. We're treated like prisoners and nothing seems to be changing. scholars are forced to learn Korean and get summer school if they don't understand the language.  children with behavioral issues are forced to sit in a room in which they are taken away from a proper learning environment and if they earn in school suspension, they are forced to do work that is taught that day without any help and if they finish,  they are forced to stare at a blank wall for hours. they make education seem like torture", 'Democracy Prep is a school that gives everybody opportunities. I was given to go to South Korea and South Africa.', 'What I liked about Democracy Prep was the determination and the goals set for the scholars. The teachers pushed and helped us to get in to the colleges that we wanted. I really appreciate everything about this school. However, the only thing that I wish that would change about this school is the location, for they are in need of their own building.']
column8: ["What I liked about my school was the trips and how the teachers interacted with the students; however, what I don't like about DPCHS is that there policies and rules are extremely strict and have little to no room for change.", 'Democracy Prep Charter High School exemplifies the true meaning of unity and honesty. My high school consists of approximately only 300 students, and that allows us to be closer with each other which is why I feel comfortable enough to be myself. The teachers in my school support you in the academic aspect and the personal aspect. They always push you to be the best version of yourself.', 'My school allows for alot of freedom when it comes to our voices being heard; however, because it is such a small school our space is limited and we have to share many things such as even bathrooms. Democracy prep does truly care about my education and making sure I am a well equipped citizen by the time I graduate they’ve taken me to over three international trips from South Korea to Rome to Canada. I can see that the teachers are passionate about seeing their students do well too.', 'One of the things that I have liked about my experience in this school were the advance academic work that I was receiving as a student attending there. I was ahead of almost everyone in my other schools, which made it less difficult for me academically wise. However, I wish that this school gets into a safer environment and become less strict with the rules.', "Democracy Prep was an amazing school for academics. However, when it came to my opinions, I was silenced. I never really felt as if I had a voice in my school due to the fact that I was a minority. The school didn't really care about what the students had to say about the way things went on. They had a demerit system where students were penalized for little things such as talking, it belittled the students and made us feel less than the adults.", "The school is different from many other charter schools. column2: ['The number one thing about Freehold Township High School is its teachers. FTHS has teaching professionals who care about their students and want to see them excel, administration who treats the building like a second home and students who show school spirit and academic motivation.', "Freehold Township High School has always been there to help. Whether it be struggling in a class, college preparation or whatever the case may be. Administration have very unfair and unethical rules. They also have a habit of not thinking through certain actions. However, they do a good job on keeping all students and teachers safe. I couldn't see myself in another high school for the last 3 years.", 'great school experience, great faculty, easy to get involved with an array of activities  .... an overall wonderful high school experience', "I liked the fun classes there were to choose from but I think they could get rid of some teachers that just don't care about their students or even teach at all.", 'Coming from a long line of private school attendees, choosing Freehold Township High School was by far the best decision I have made thus far. The community, environment and overall experience these past years have been extremely positive. I believe the education I have received is superior to competing schools in the area, as FTHS offers many ways for students to challenge themselves and proceed on a path to future success.', 'FTHS is a very safe school, and has great academics. I personally do not love the rotating block scheduling, but I had gotten used to a different schedule. Plus the fries are pretty good.', 'I enjoyed the welcoming atmosphere that the school created but I wish that it had a better way of introducing the students to clubs. I also wish that there was air conditioning throughout the entire school since it can be brutal near the end of the year. Everything else however such as the programs offered, teachers, and classes were wonderful to experience.', 'Food was horrible. Teachers are more worried about phones than teaching.  Not concerned about the more realistic things. Many teachers are extremely rude and miserable.', 'I hAtE tHiS sChOol AlOt, AND I HAVE AIRPODS nonononononononnonononononononononononononononononononononononononononononononononononoon more school', 'I feel our education was not as great as it could have been for the area we live in. Expecting more.', 'Freehold Township High School is a public school located in Freehold, NJ. This school serves grades from 9-12 and has an enrollment number of about 2,013 students. Overall this school has filled my needs both academically and athletically. With the diverse environment of students this school allows you to be yourself at your full potential. I would recommend this as a great public high school.', 'This is school has a lot of activities and opportunities for their students. The staffs are nice and layed back. The students are always working hard and nice to each other.', "There can be a lot said of Township, and almost all of it will be subjective. I found that most Honors and AP teachers are more than qualified and willing to help their students through every step of their high school careers, but some were lackluster and unenthusiastic, or downright callous. It's more likely for Academic-level teachers to take it easy on their students, to put in little to no effort at all. As for the administration, certain staffers were always engaged well with students and were always ready to help, while a select few others are clearly bitter about their jobs and hold little to no respect for the students they're supposed to work with. Clubs-wise, the variety is phenomenal, you'll definitely be able to find a niche and almost all of them help in some way to prepare you for college and further engagements with the world.", "From the beginning of freshman year to the year we all wait for senior year, my experience at Freehold Township couldn't be better. Having an IEP worried me for when I entered high school but with the help of all my teachers I was able to truly push myself and succeed in school.", 'My experience at FTHS was great, all the teachers and other faculties are very understanding and willing to help any students. The school itself has a lot of team spirt the football games in the fall are hands down the best. The school and district are awesome! I could not have complained in my four years I was there', "Great community. Larger school. No air conditioning. Teachers try to help you as best they can. Lots of AP work. Tests are tough, but if you study you'll most likely do fine.", 'I really enjoyed my time here at Freehold Township. I have learned a lot and made some wonderful friendships. The teachers are great and really put effort into their lessons. Counselors and teachers really help you push forward and challenge yourself,  they strive to help their students succeed. The coaches here are great and really look out for their athletes. Time flew by so fast! Could not have asked for a better high school experience!', 'Freehold Township High School is a large school with a good community and extracurricular. The main issues comes from the school juggling overpopulation and the quality of teaching ranging from excellent to quite poor.', 'Take advantage of the academic resources provided so you can better succeed! Whether that is receiving tutoring, advisement, or taking an AP class or dual enrollment to receive college credit.', 'The school is generally deemed as one of the best in the district, but has many problems when it comes to usage of things in school. Many teachers have given up on fully trying to correct or change ways and just ignore it half way through the year.']

column6: ['At Freehold Township High School, education is valued, as well as character. Teachers are invested in students’ lives academically and, at times, personally. There are many athletic opportunities and clubs.', 'I loved the fact that the teachers were so friendly! However, the block scheduling is a mess. Having everyone eat lunch at the same time is chaotic, messy, and it makes lunch miserable. I recommend a schedule that has at least two blocks for lunch. That way there is less chaos and tears.', 'The main thing that made my experience here more stressful than it should’ve been is definitely the administration and the people who are supposed to be “trusted adults”', 'My high school has prepared me for the college experience.  I am enrolled in the International Baccalaureate Program, a rigorous program that is only offered in 8 schools throughout New Jersey.  My teachers are approachable and want to see their students succeed.', "I enjoyed this school because it wasn't too easy, wasn't too hard. Most teachers are willing to work with you and don't want to see you fail which is nice, but the social scene is very cliquey and can feel isolating at times. All in all I had a decent experience at tis school", 'I think that the teachers at Freehold Township High School, for the most part, really care about the students and their success. One thing that I wish would change is the lack of air conditioning. Classrooms in the upstairs C,D, and E halls was honestly unbearable to concentrate in.', 'The teachers are friendly and helpful, the environment can be judgmental at times but as long as you stay on the right path any student will succeed. Offers a club, class, or sport for anyone. Overall, a politically forward and nice school.', 'The school is in a relatively wealthy area with great school districts from kids K-12. The area is very family friendly and they rank highly in academic performance and those that go to college.', 'My overall experience at Freehold Township High School has been fantastic! I have been given opportunities to be a successful student and athlete with the support of my teachers and coaches. The school spirit is amazing in how everyone supports each other in the classroom, sports games, club meetings, and even how students and teachers connect in school activities. What I love about FTHS is how everyone is so kind and supportive of one another, and I love attending a school with such great people around me. The one thing I would change about FTHS, however, is a better sense of the students feeling safer when coming to school with the whole gun violence issue taking place in our society. If we can find a way to keep everyone safe, while making everyone feel safe, this school would get even better!', 'Its a very mediocre school. Nothing too great but nothing too bad. Its a public high school nothing much to expect from it.', 'High school is supposed to be a great time. And Freehold Township allows you to do that. Over my time at Township, I have really enjoyed everything. As a student athlete (11 Varsity letters), I never felt that the workload was overwhelming, or that sports dictated my time. It was easy to balance all parts of my life (academics, athletics, and social). Overall the teacher are really good. Obviously you are going to have 1 or 2 teachers that you really don’t like, but in general, they really care about you. Also, the student body is really amazing. Everyone is very involved, and if they are not setting up or planning events, they are attending! The culture and pride that we have at our school is very high, as can be seen at events like Battle for the Duke, Battle of the Classes, Homecoming, etc. You are also always meeting new people. Township is relatively big and it’s not uncommon that I see someone that I never knew went there. You can’t go wrong with Freehold Township.', "It's a weird community, there's a lot of kids who have known each other since elementary schools so they're all friends. However there are lots of kids from neighboring towns as well. You have to find your place that you'll be comfortable then its smooth sailing from there.", 'I would prefer if the school actually honored all of its students besides those that are the popular choice. Teachers are big contenders of the popularity game and it hurts students like me.', "In my four years at Freehold Township High School, there of course have been some ups and downs, but overall my experience has been amazing. I've met so many new people and friends that will definitely be by my side for a long time. I've also learned so much from the teachers and those around me.", 'Its a good school and I recommend going there to anyone who needs a high school. The staff there are kind, the academics there are good, the atmosphere there is diverse and inclusive.', 'Has the IB program and honors and AP classes. Most of the teachers are good. A larger variety of sports and clubs.  Decent food and nice lunch ladies.', 'I graduated Freehold Township High School in 2013 and was very involved with school activities. I played sports such as cheerleading and lacrosse and was the captain of the Cheerleading team my senior year. I had great experiences while attending the school and enjoyed almost all of my academic teachers and classes. My advisor was very good at guiding me to a college that could fit me and teachers were always very supportive. Overall I had a great experience at this school for all 4 years I attended and I have great memories.', "My brief four years at FTHS was quite a roller coaster. It had its ups and downs but in the end, I really enjoyed being apart of the Patriot Nation! I am a full honor and advanced placement student, and I can safely say that in my academics, I took full advantage of what my school had to offer. As for clubs and activities, all four years I was apart of something different: I competed in art competitions for Art club, I had danced and performed on stage with my drama peers, I even delved into the art of music and joined the marching patriots. Out of school, I was a competitive gymnast, with a very taxing schedule. However, the teachers at Freehold Township really try to connect and help you out when you're working your hardest to do your best in not only your studies but your aspirations. Overall, FTHS was a great home, with great friends and events, and I definitely won't be forgetting about those precious moments spent in these lively halls.", 'Freehold Township has the friendliest and most kind-hearted teachers. The faculty and staff there truly care about their students and strive for everyone to be the best. Between sports, clubs, and academics Freehold Township always encourages each other to work to their maximum potential. When it comes to food, Freehold Township is also very caring towards their students. They have a fresh sub and wrap area with fresh cold cuts. They also have days when a sushi man comes and makes fresh sushi for the students. Freehold Township also prepared me for college and having the right resources by offering dual-enrollment courses and AP courses. Freehold Township was and always will be an amazing high school and I am privileged to have attended there.', "It's my senior year here and I can honestly say that the overall experience was very good. I came here from a different town and was able to make friends and adapt quickly. There are several clubs to join, electives to take, and things to learn. Yeah sure some of the teachers are absolute trash, we STILL don't have ac throughout the school and some of the ceiling is literally falling apart, but overall this isn't a bad school. I learned a lot and met some great people."]

However there are lots of kids from neighboring towns as well. You have to find your place that you'll be comfortable then its smooth sailing from there.", 'I would prefer if the school actually honored all of its students besides those that are the popular choice. Teachers are big contenders of the popularity game and it hurts students like me.', "In my four years at Freehold Township High School, there of course have been some ups and downs, but overall my experience has been amazing. I've met so many new people and friends that will definitely be by my side for a long time. I've also learned so much from the teachers and those around me.", 'Its a good school and I recommend going there to anyone who needs a high school. The staff there are kind, the academics there are good, the atmosphere there is diverse and inclusive.', 'Has the IB program and honors and AP classes. Most of the teachers are good. A larger variety of sports and clubs.  Decent food and nice lunch ladies.', 'I graduated Freehold Township High School in 2013 and was very involved with school activities. I played sports such as cheerleading and lacrosse and was the captain of the Cheerleading team my senior year. I had great experiences while attending the school and enjoyed almost all of my academic teachers and classes. My advisor was very good at guiding me to a college that could fit me and teachers were always very supportive. Overall I had a great experience at this school for all 4 years I attended and I have great memories.', "My brief four years at FTHS was quite a roller coaster. It had its ups and downs but in the end, I really enjoyed being apart of the Patriot Nation! I am a full honor and advanced placement student, and I can safely say that in my academics, I took full advantage of what my school had to offer. As for clubs and activities, all four years I was apart of something different: I competed in art competitions for Art club, I had danced and performed on stage with my drama peers, I even delved into the art of music and joined the marching patriots. Out of school, I was a competitive gymnast, with a very taxing schedule. However, the teachers at Freehold Township really try to connect and help you out when you're working your hardest to do your best in not only your studies but your aspirations. Overall, FTHS was a great home, with great friends and events, and I definitely won't be forgetting about those precious moments spent in these lively halls.", 'Freehold Township has the friendliest and most kind-hearted teachers. The faculty and staff there truly care about their students and strive for everyone to be the best. Between sports, clubs, and academics Freehold Township always encourages each other to work to their maximum potential. When it comes to food, Freehold Township is also very caring towards their students. They have a fresh sub and wrap area with fresh cold cuts. They also have days when a sushi man comes and makes fresh sushi for the students. Freehold Township also prepared me for college and having the right resources by offering dual-enrollment courses and AP courses. Freehold Township was and always will be an amazing high school and I am privileged to have attended there.', "It's my senior year here and I can honestly say that the overall experience was very good. I came here from a different town and was able to make friends and adapt quickly. There are several clubs to join, electives to take, and things to learn. Yeah sure some of the teachers are absolute trash, we STILL don't have ac throughout the school and some of the ceiling is literally falling apart, but overall this isn't a bad school. I learned a lot and met some great people."]

column2: ["Putnam Valley High School is an excellent school for academics. The teachers all show interest in the student's well being and try their best to accommodate all students. The Authentic Science Research program within the Putnam High school is stellar, with teachers that focus heavily on developing a student's presentation, public speaking, and interpersonal skills.The science programs at Putnam Valley High school are excellent and teachers focus heavily on current issues within the scientific community and strive to keep things relevant to the times. PVHS also allows students to find their own path through various extracurricular programs, some of which were developed by students themselves. Putnam Valley High School provides a unique experience that is different from most public schools, and it shows through the success of the students.", 'I believe Putnam Valley High School has equipped me for college and has prepared me for the real world. The guidance counselors and teachers are always there to give a helping hand and there are multifarious opportunities to be involved in different activities at the school.', 'The teachers are genuinely good people who want to help you succeed. There is an overall friendly atmosphere.', 'I thought Putnam Valley High School was a very student friendly school. The staff engaged with students to ensure they do the best they possibly could as long as students put in the effort to succeed.', 'Putnam Valley high school has a great student body that made me feel very welcome when entered the district during sophomore year, it also has a great staff, more specifically for me my guidance counselor, who has been of great help when explaining to me everything I needed to know about my steps after high school and who has been very supportive of my choices.', "Throughout my four years at Putnam Valley, I have come to realize that this school and its faculty have prepared me for more than just my college career, but my whole life. I have been challenged academically and pushed to strive by both my teachers and my peers. If I ever struggled with a subject, there was always someone there to help me. Rather it be a teacher or a student tutor, I always received the help I needed. While at Putnam Valley High I always had someone to turn to. The teachers and staff here have helped me through many personal and academic obstacles. If I ever needed help with anything, from deciding what I wanted to major in to what school I wanted to attend, there was always someone to aid me. Putnam Valley has always felt like home to me, not only because it is a small school in general, but because I have a support system here that many other schools can't provide to their students.", 'Great school. Definitely got a great education from here. Very technologically savvy school. Great resources for students. Guidance department was amazing help in looking for a university to attend.', "It is a small school. There are changes in the making with the schedule. We have one of the earliest start times in the country and they are looking to change this.  Currently, we have a block schedule system. The academic system is pretty good, but wouldn't say it is one of the best. There is a deficiency in the english department, however, the guidance counselors are very good at helping you through the application process. We have probably the best color wars in the country.", 'This school is unique because of the teachers and how willing they are to try new things. However, certain departments of the school lack attention and cause students to fall behind (i.e. the math department.)', 'Putnam Valley High School has been my home for the past four years. I have a huge connection to Putnam Valley High School and all the staff. This is a school where not only do teachers aid and support you but so do the janitors, the lunch ladies, the hall monitors, etc.', 'The administration and all of the newly enforced rules since the new principal began there has really ruined the reputation of PVHS. The new principal is trying to mimic other schools and their strategies, which is the complete opposite of what PVHS stands for.', 'In my experience with schools, they always lacked what I needed most and that was technology based programs. In Putnam Valley I have seen so many of these programs, which makes the school very advanced compared to other schools around the world. I am so glad to be enrolled in this school because it gives me chance to pursue my dream of being in a computer science major in college.', 'I love the school. All the teachers that work here really care about their job and make it very hard to not do well. All the staff make sure that you always feel safe.', 'A small school usually gets a negative reputation because everybody knows just about everything concerning their fellow students and staff, but what makes Putnam Valley different is their spirit. We, unlike most smaller districts, are able to come together and help shape a morale that we are both confident and proud in. What we lack in size, we make up in effort and dedication. We at Putnam Valley, never forget where we came from.', 'I had a good experience during my time at PVHS.  Being involved after school was a lot of help, it added so much fun to my time being there.  The turf field is amazing.  The teachers would put effort into helping the child succeed.  Well rounded school.', 'Putnam Valley is an average place to grow up. Putnam Valley High School is the school that you see in movies; the one where everybody knows everybody and there are quirky school traditions. I love going to school at Putnam Valley. The theatre and music programs are amazing. The teachers are all unique and inspiring in their own way. I like the modern look of our school, seeing how it was built in 2001. The only thing I would want to change about Putnam Valley is the school start time. Studies have proven that teenagers are not at their full potential academically or intellectually so early in the morning. The fact that classes start at 7:10 each day greatly impact students performance in class and on exams. Other that this, Putnam Valley is a wonderful high school to attend. ', 'Putnam Valley High school provides students with numerous opportunities to learn and explore skills outside of traditional course work. Students have the opportunity to join the STEM and authentic science research classes, or enroll in one of the many art courses that are available available. The performing arts center is equipped with one of the most  complex rigging systems in the area, outperforming even that of the Westchester Performing Arts Center. In addition to the schools dedication to the art and sciences, the school sports a competitive athletics program. Students will find every opportunity to explore their interests at Putnam Valley High School.', 'There should be better classes and more information.', 'A lot of sports and clubs are offered by this school. Many students are involved also.', 'Had a blast at this school. Created ever lasting friendships while getting a great education.']

column6: ['Great teachers. Small classrooms allow the teacher to know you and your needs.', "Mr. O is kinda fake but he's leaving so nothing to worry about. Good education here though. Teachers really do care. guidance councilors are amazing except Kilduff. She is just an idiot and there is a 99.9% chance she will mess up...not reliable and frankly doesn't care.", "It's not the best school in the world. Some of the teachers are good. But you get to use a laptop.", 'The teachers were great, helpful, and friendly. There were just too many rules that restricted students from normal things, such as backpacks or eating.', 'The extracurricular activities are great and helpful to students.', "I really do love this school, I moved here the first day of sophomore year from another school not too far away and this school is amazing compared to my old school, some kids who have been in Putnam Valley High School their whole life's don't realize how nice of a school they attended because they don't have the experience of attending a bad school.", 'I usually just bring food to school but this year we had a lunch rebellion when a student brought in sandwiches and gave them out for free so nobody would buy lunch, he did this because they raised the prices, the end result was they brought in more healthy alternatives and lowered the price back to what it was the previous year.', 'The only thing most kids get in trouble for in my high school would probably be senioritis and not going to class, my school is pretty nice and well kept and the kids tend to behave during school hours ususally, the most punishment is usually a warning and possibly lunch detention.', 'We are a very small school so we are able to have luxury with great sports equipment, we just got a new track and turf last year, and our fans are ridiculous, we just won the best fans in division 1 for our basketball fans, our basketball team has gone to county center sectionals the past 4 years in a row.', "In the Putnam Valley High School, I genuinely do like majority of the teachers, they aren't only good teachers in the classroom, but also good people in general who really do care about the students and there issues in school and out.", 'A lot of kids in my school are involved in extracurricular opportunities in my school, whether it is a club, a sport, a musical or a combination there is always a lot going on.', "I think that there are many good qualities and bad qualities at this school. Some things I wish I could change is the fluctuating temperatures in the classrooms (some are very cold while others are very hot, the rooms start to smell towards the end of the day). I like how are school is small because it gives you the ability to put a name to a face with everyone. However, I think this makes different friend groups more obvious. If I could redo my four years of high school one more time, I think  I would because looking back I do feel that I may have missed things I would have truly enjoyed. I think this school is unique because the teachers seem to genuinely care for students' well being, whether it be in school or outside school. I also think that although students at my school are not 'friendly friends', I think they are polite and would help someone out if a bad situation were to arise, I also think they would say something if something was off about someone.", 'The school offers a variety for students with food allergies and preferences. Recently, our school opened a salad bar to encourage healthy eating. However, sometimes it is hard to be convinced that the school lunch is made with the best quality meats and other things. The school gives us enough time to eat and more. Everyday we can have something different. The school also offers free lunches to people who cannot afford to buy their own. I think that the quality of the food can be much improved though.', "I think the school administration is very fair on how they treat students and how they choose to discipline them. The prinicipal, guidance counselors and office staff are more than willing to give students who feel remorseful about their actions a second chance. The school does not make students feel like a criminal, but make use of the situation to learn from their mistakes, the students as well as the schools (how they could have kept a problem from occurring). The school also takes into account the students side of the story, they do not automatically assume one is guilty. One thing I think the school can have more rules about is the dress code. Although I respect the school's want for us all to be able to express ourselves through clothes, I think there should be more rules on how much we dress. I also think at times that the school may be bias towards some students, giving some less severe punishments to students simply because they are friendly with them.", 'The school offers students an opportunity to participate in many sports. The school teams have won notable awards. Our school tries lead us to live a good and healthy lifestyle by encouraging sports and healthy eating. The teams at my school are very serious about their particular sport and work to the best of their ability. Many students go the the home and away games.', 'The teachers at my school truly care if students are understanding they material and reach out to students when they are struggling. The teachers hold reasonable after school time for students who need extra help. The teachers also have great ways of getting the students engaged with the topic of discussion by making us do different lab/activities watch videos or doing group work. Also, they are very open to listening to students ideas and look to teach us at a pace in which most or all of us understand what is being taught. The teachers do not always grade us consistently, it is based on the time spent on a topic, the amount and depth of that topic and also the behavior of the students. Overall, I think the teachers at my school are great and are a major reason I am able to go to the college of my choice.', "There are many activities at school. However, they are often disorganized and field trips and activities planned within these clubs are not always followed through. Also, many goals set for clubs, such as Honors Societies do not have members that take the responsibilities of being in that club. Most of the time, a few people end up doing all the work. However, in these clubs, students bond together and get to spend time with people that are not in their classes or they don't have time to see outside of school. Also, although the clubs are not always the most active, they have good intention and do donate money to charity and bring people closer together.", "I'm not a technology oriented person so it's always been difficult for me, but besides the occasional temperamental projector and unresponsive smart board, the technology is very good. The guidance counselors are great, one is always hard to find but I've never had an overly unpleasant experience. The college prep resources are alright, the application process is very easy with the counselors but the rest is up to the student. The tutoring is very accessible and the students are very helpful. I think the student tutoring gets a better response than the teachers.", 'The teachers are really great for the most part, the curriculum is pretty easy, give or take a few classes, the scheduling process is pretty good except some people have lunch at ten in the morning. The workload can be incredibly overwhelming at times, and there are many student tutors, I am one and have been tutored by one.', "The students are all very involved in either drugs or sports, if not both. Peer pressure isn't aggressive but prominent, acceptance is common, very few people have no friends and there are no challenges when it comes to race or sexuality."]

column2: ['Great teachers, I always felt like I had help when I truly needed it. I made great friends and never felt like my safety was ever in jeopardy. Overall I had an excellent experience at this school.', 'Good School with great teachers. The students are friendly as well! The faculty and staff do their best to keep the school running and help kids learn in a safe environment.', 'Hicksville High School is a place that has a very diverse and welcoming environment in which students can truly prosper. This is a school that supports one another especially in times of need. I am proud to say I am a student at Hicksville High School as it is truly a great school to learn and grow in. The teachers here are very passionate, caring and driven to see students prosper and achieve success! There are a variety of classes this school offers and many field trips to attend as well. This also offers a variety of AP classes and I can truly say they prepare you well for the exams given. This school offers a variety of options for clubs and activities so there is a place for every student to get involved if they truly want to. Hicksville High School creates and fosters an environment that enables students to grow not only as students but also as individuals.', 'Hicksville High School does somethings extremely well. The AP classes are as  good as anything on Long Island. The Teachers are fantastic and the students are motivated. The music program is absolutely wonderful. The performances from Tri-M are  outstanding. Were Hicksville High school is really lacking is college readiness. The resources for SAT-ACT preparation is minimal. Its best to invest in an outside source for college and career guidance.', 'There are many kind-hearted teachers who are willing to help students achieve their personal best. As I begin my senior year at Hicksville, I realized how lucky I am to have been taught by so many knowledgeable teachers. I am very grateful and proud to be a senior at Hicksville High School.', 'It’s a great high school, I made many lasting friendships and my teachers are amazing. Some of the staff though can be difficult, i.e. bathroom monitors. I also find that there are many people working in the highschool but it feels as if they do nothing, book room lady lost my textbooks and cost me $45. Attendance lady frequently calls home to report my “missing” attendance when I attended band lessons. The school nurses just recently messed up my medical forms, saying I did not receive a vaccine and almost caused me to stop attending school.', 'This school\'s bathroom policy is ridiculous. The bathrooms are closed the first and last 10 minutes of each period meaning you have to wait to go to the bathroom. A pass is also mandatory. At the entrance of each bathroom there are "bathroom monitors" and most of them are rude. They\'re all old ladies who most likely don\'t get payed so i wonder why they even bother volunteering. Also the lunch is horrible. But that\'s Michelle Obama\'s fault. l', "Hicksville has a lot of diversity in it's students and there are many clubs available to become a part of.", 'All of my children received an excellent education in the Hicksville schools.  Great teachers and principal.', 'Some good teachers, some bad.  While they do have security, sometimes the school will feel not safe. I would not go to this school if there is an alternative. you have been warned. A lot of corruption to say the least', 'Three of my children have graduated with high honors.   Full scholarships. Really great experience. Teachers helpful. Overall excellent experience.', "The teachers care about you and the kids are friendly, but this school has a bunch of useless rules. There is no going to the bathroom in the first 10 or last minutes of class and there are people outside the bathrooms to make sure of that. Some of those people are nice, but others are extremely rude. The nurses don't allow you to use the bathroom, you have to wait 10 minutes. All bathrooms are locked except one, so if you somehow manage to get to a bathroom it will take a long time and you'll lose a lot of classroom time. You can't go to lunch if it's not your lunch period even if you have the teacher's permission because you are hungry. I would give it 5 stars if not for this. When it's summer and your bladder feels like it's about to burst but can't go to the bathroom is both a pain and annoying. Kids are smart though and there are a lot of AP classes.", "Like all high school experiences, I had my good experiences here but I also had my bad experiences. The teachers here were, for the most part, helpful and wanted their students to learn. However, some just want to teach the bare minimum for their students to pass so that they can get a good rating and you can tell the difference what teacher belongs in what category. Unfortunately, the school has been having some issues with the administration lately and I hope that they fix whatever problems they have because it didn't used to be the kind of place that I've been hearing about from people.", "The teachers and principal are strict because they want and expect the best, but aren't machines, as many of the teachers are nice people and easy to joke with or talk to normally. The variety of classes you can take too are amazing.", 'I like how some of the teachers care and are focused on helping students. Others aren’t so great and make learning that much harder.', 'Overall I felt like I got a quality well-rounded education. However, it was hard to have your voice heard.', 'The facility is old and can use some renovating inside. The new athletic facilities are amazing. Some teachers have been fantastic helping in any way npossible, especially with the college process....others need to retire.', 'My experience at Hicksville High School was alright. I’ve definitely had some outstanding teachers who really love their job and care about their students. However, they are reluctant to help you regarding errors in the gradebook, as this was a major problem for me which I fought for for 5-6 months and they did not fix it when it should’ve been. This of course messed up my class rank and overall GPA. Aside from this issue I have had interactions with such supportive staff who helped me through difficult times throughout my high school years. Hicksville High school definitely has its highs and lows.', "Hicksville High School has a lot to offer it's students from great academics to intriguing activities. Besides a select few, all the teachers and administrators in Hicksville truly care about their students and their success. The school is also extremely diverse, located in the melting pot of Long Island. Supports not just it's sports but also it's Fine Arts: Music, Art, and Theatre.", 'My school is very good having four storey building. It is like a temple where we go daily to study. First of all in the early morning, we pray to God for our better study and say good morning to our class teacher. Then we start study according to our syllabus. I like to go school daily. My school has very strict discipline which we need to follow on regular basis. I like my school dress very much. It is situated around 2 km away from my sweet home. I go to school by yellow school bus. My school is located at very peaceful place and away from the pollution, noise, dust, noise and smoke of the city.']
column4: ['Great teachers, I always felt like I had help when I truly needed it. I made great friends and never felt like my safety was ever in jeopardy. Overall I had an excellent experience at this school.', 'Good School with great teachers. The students are friendly as well! The faculty and staff do their best to keep the school running and help kids learn in a safe environment.', 'Hicksville High School is a place that has a very diverse and welcoming environment in which students can truly prosper. This is a school that supports one another especially in times of need. I am proud to say I am a student at Hicksville High School as it is truly a great school to learn and grow in. The teachers here are very passionate, caring and driven to see students prosper and achieve success! There are a variety of classes this school offers and many field trips to attend as well. This also offers a variety of AP classes and I can truly say they prepare you well for the exams given. This school offers a variety of options for clubs and activities so there is a place for every student to get involved if they truly want to. Hicksville High School creates and fosters an environment that enables students to grow not only as students but also as individuals.', 'Hicksville High School does somethings extremely well. The AP classes are as  good as anything on Long Island. The Teachers are fantastic and the students are motivated. The music program is absolutely wonderful. The performances from Tri-M are  outstanding. Were Hicksville High school is really lacking is college readiness. The resources for SAT-ACT preparation is minimal. Its best to invest in an outside source for college and career guidance.', 'There are many kind-hearted teachers who are willing to help students achieve their personal best. As I begin my senior year at Hicksville, I realized how lucky I am to have been taught by so many knowledgeable teachers. I am very grateful and proud to be a senior at Hicksville High School.', 'It’s a great high school, I made many lasting friendships and my teachers are amazing. Some of the staff though can be difficult, i.e. bathroom monitors. I also find that there are many people working in the highschool but it feels as if they do nothing, book room lady lost my textbooks and cost me $45. Attendance lady frequently calls home to report my “missing” attendance when I attended band lessons. The school nurses just recently messed up my medical forms, saying I did not receive a vaccine and almost caused me to stop attending school.', 'This school\'s bathroom policy is ridiculous. The bathrooms are closed the first and last 10 minutes of each period meaning you have to wait to go to the bathroom. A pass is also mandatory. At the entrance of each bathroom there are "bathroom monitors" and most of them are rude. They\'re all old ladies who most likely don\'t get payed so i wonder why they even bother volunteering. Also the lunch is horrible. But that\'s Michelle Obama\'s fault. l', "Hicksville has a lot of diversity in it's students and there are many clubs available to become a part of.", 'All of my children received an excellent education in the Hicksville schools.  Great teachers and principal.', 'Some good teachers, some bad.  While they do have security, sometimes the school will feel not safe. I would not go to this school if there is an alternative. you have been warned. A lot of corruption to say the least', 'Three of my children have graduated with high honors.   Full scholarships. Really great experience. Teachers helpful. Overall excellent experience.', "The teachers care about you and the kids are friendly, but this school has a bunch of useless rules. There is no going to the bathroom in the first 10 or last minutes of class and there are people outside the bathrooms to make sure of that. Some of those people are nice, but others are extremely rude. The nurses don't allow you to use the bathroom, you have to wait 10 minutes. All bathrooms are locked except one, so if you somehow manage to get to a bathroom it will take a long time and you'll lose a lot of classroom time. You can't go to lunch if it's not your lunch period even if you have the teacher's permission because you are hungry. I would give it 5 stars if not for this. When it's summer and your bladder feels like it's about to burst but can't go to the bathroom is both a pain and annoying. Kids are smart though and there are a lot of AP classes.", "Like all high school experiences, I had my good experiences here but I also had my bad experiences. The teachers here were, for the most part, helpful and wanted their students to learn. However, some just want to teach the bare minimum for their students to pass so that they can get a good rating and you can tell the difference what teacher belongs in what category. Unfortunately, the school has been having some issues with the administration lately and I hope that they fix whatever problems they have because it didn't used to be the kind of place that I've been hearing about from people.", "The teachers and principal are strict because they want and expect the best, but aren't machines, as many of the teachers are nice people and easy to joke with or talk to normally. The variety of classes you can take too are amazing.", 'I like how some of the teachers care and are focused on helping students. Others aren’t so great and make learning that much harder.', 'Overall I felt like I got a quality well-rounded education. However, it was hard to have your voice heard.', 'The facility is old and can use some renovating inside. The new athletic facilities are amazing. Some teachers have been fantastic helping in any way npossible, especially with the college process....others need to retire.', 'My experience at Hicksville High School was alright. I’ve definitely had some outstanding teachers who really love their job and care about their students. However, they are reluctant to help you regarding errors in the gradebook, as this was a major problem for me which I fought for for 5-6 months and they did not fix it when it should’ve been. This of course messed up my class rank and overall GPA. Aside from this issue I have had interactions with such supportive staff who helped me through difficult times throughout my high school years. Hicksville High school definitely has its highs and lows.', "Hicksville High School has a lot to offer it's students from great academics to intriguing activities. Besides a select few, all the teachers and administrators in Hicksville truly care about their students and their success. The school is also extremely diverse, located in the melting pot of Long Island. Supports not just it's sports but also it's Fine Arts: Music, Art, and Theatre.", 'My school is very good having four storey building. It is like a temple where we go daily to study. First of all in the early morning, we pray to God for our better study and say good morning to our class teacher. Then we start study according to our syllabus. I like to go school daily. My school has very strict discipline which we need to follow on regular basis. I like my school dress very much. It is situated around 2 km away from my sweet home. I go to school by yellow school bus. My school is located at very peaceful place and away from the pollution, noise, dust, noise and smoke of the city.']
column6: ['My experience at Hicksville High School was overall amazing, I believe that if I went to any other school my education would be so different. The only matter I would change is more help for the middle of the way students who are silently struggling.', "I like a handful of teachers. Some of them really do care. I hated that we couldn't go to the bathroom whenever we needed too and they were locked for the first and last ten minutes of class. My guidance counselor was not very helpful at all.", "I would love to see administration care more for the students and not be biased. College classes aren't emphasized as much as it should be", 'Hicksville High School is an average school. The work is not too much to handle, nor is it really little. There are various clubs and great teachers at this school.', 'The things that I like most about Hicksville high school is the fact that you get to choose to do the things that you might enjoy or love. There are multiple sports and clubs to choose from. And If you’ve never done something and want to try it, you have the opportunity to do that. The counselors are with you every step of the way. The teachers make sures you understand everything that they teach and if you don’t they are willing to stay after school and help you understand. The staff are really nice. The students are really talkative. HHS gets you ready for the real life.', 'The kind of education you get from here is no better or worse compared to other Nassau schools. The teachers here are well qualified and generous. There are many honor societies to join and a wide variety of AP courses are offered. The student population here is very diverse in terms of race, interests and motivation. There is acceptance and support of LGBTQ students, and there is a lot of discussion among staff and students alike, about kids who have problems at home or who suffer from depression, anxiety, ADHD or other conditions/issues which can affect happiness and performance in school. The school building itself is old and a lot of the rooms do not have air conditioning. Recently, the football field was renovated and a new pool is being built inside.', 'Staff is friendly and knowledgeable on courses they are teaching, and offer multiple courses that can fit your student interests.', "Many of the teachers here could not care less about their students, but there is the occasional passionate teacher that strives to see their students succeed. Many of its students are racist and the administration does not do anything to stop them. Several times the staff and faculty attempt to restrict students' rights when students refuse to stand for the pledge of allegiance.", 'Great school with plenty of helpful resources, diversity, programs, and activities to get involved in. Everyone is very friendly and a welcoming environment.', "Hicksville High School had a great sense of community, and it was one that I genuniely think I wouldn't be the same person without being exposed to.", 'I liked that Hicksville High School had an internship program for seniors or permission to leave early if you had multiple study halls and you were employed. However, I wish they were more encouraging about BOCES. I regret it now. I should have went into the Medical Assistant program. For I would of gotten experience for what I want to get into in the future. Hicksville High School was decent.', 'Very small school. The teachers are overall nice. I would like to see some change in the guidance office as they dont take in students opinions. I also would like them to change the cafeteria food as it is very unhealthy. but otherwise good learning school', "As Hicksville High School student, i'm so happy. The school is very good, teachers are very good, and teaching is good.The teacher gave me a lot of help.", "Hicksville High School is objectively unlike any other school on long island. It dedicates itself towards creating and fostering an environment that facilitates learning for each individual. Although there are drawback with administration, the school ultimately enriches students with a perspective that can't be found anywhere else.", 'Hicksville High School has been the place where I have grown over the past four years. I have been lucky enough to meet some wonderful people and form beautiful friendships that will last a lifetime. Hicksville has taught me to love and accept everyone we encounter. Due to my experiences at Hicksville I am now prepared for college and the future. The many academic and life lessons I have learned over the past four years will be pivotal in all the decisions I make in the future. It is here that I was exposed to many different situations that will only prepare me for what the future holds.', "Hicksville is an ok school but definitely not great. Some teachers are great. Others dont teach and you'll have to teach yourself. In my opinion, i would not send my future kids here. If you take ap and honors classes it will deff prep you more for college vs. taking regents classes", 'Great School  with dedicated teachers and wonderful administrators; especially  Principal Williams !', 'I liked seeing a diverse environment but there were very few events that brought the school together.', 'It was very welcoming when I came into the schools. There are numerous amount of clubs and sports you can join. The teachers were able to connect with the students and create time for them for one on one help.', 'I’ve been in this school from last year. Junior year was my first year in Hicksville high school and ever since then, it’s been a great everything. The coaches are great m, very inspiring and motivating. You can get help with anything from anyone in the high school. Teachers are very friendly, the environment of the building is full of respect, responsibilities, excellence, and loving. This school is like a family. I’ve gotten anything and everything I needed in the past and it’s been very happy year for me.']

column2: ["Can anyone share what's the math test like? What does it concentrate on and grade-level you need to pass? Trying to help my kids get in. Not looking for an answer key, just a general feel.", 'My experience in All City Leadership Secondary School has been overall great. It is a small school and very easy to go around. The students are not problematic and the teachers are of so much help. The counselors provide great resources and the classes are good. All thourghout the year the school offers a variety of events that involves everyone as well as ocasional fundraisers.', "Being a small school worked to it's advantage because everyone in the school knows each other. The school also keeps itself strict in both behavioral and academic senses. In terms of academics, the school works at a faster pace than other high schools and already has the students prepared for college and attaining the advanced degree.", 'Over the years of going to ACLA I learned many things, for example I learned leadership. Leadership is something that not all middle school and high school would teach. ACLA also has a small class size, which would be easier to get in contact with the teacher. Acla also has taught me the sense of a school family the students get really close like siblings and the teachers care about your education like your parents, and I feel like the staff is amazing you can go to anyone.', 'I have been looking forward to this school ever since I’ve been here the first time I came. I think the teachers for my upcoming year are going to be very good and I will have a very good 7 years in Acla.', "Being a middle school and a high school, i find that the family and friends you make here really last a life time. I've grown with my peers in hundreds of ways, and i could not be more proud to call them family.", "It's an amazing experience being in this school because the teachers explain so well the subject and they support you if you don't understand something.", "I generally like the school, the environment is great and it feels like a second family due to the fact that the school is partly small. The only thing will be the clubs/ activities , there aren't many of them that spark my attention and that inspired me to apply for them. But other than that everything is good and the school runs well and smooth.", 'All City Leadership Is like a home you didn’t know you never had. As you walk in you are greeting with the familiar and warm faces of the guards who are more like Aunts than anything else. Teachers are warm even when you’re no longer their student, and the halls radiate something that just makes you feel safe. On top of all this, it’s a place to learn- where lunchrooms are filled with students studying for a test or finishing some homework. Life is buzzing at ACLA, kept alive by the frequent school events and the lively students.', 'The academics and staff at this school are amazing, but more can be done in regards of student life and events.', 'As a student whose a sophomore and started off in the school in 6th grade,  the school does challenge their scholars which is what I appreciate it. I do wish they focused more in our education than in our uniforms. I understand that disciplinary actions have to occur when I student doesn’t wear the proper uniform, but taking them out of class for the whole day isn’t the best way  to do it. I do love the connections and bonds that are form between students and teachers. It makes it easier to receive help that we need. Overall, ACLA is a great school where it is a safe environment to gain an education. This year, the current seniors gained over 10 million dollars in scholarships and have been accepted in top tier schools such as Harvard, Stanford, MIT, UPENN, and a lot more. This school builds up their students not only for success, but for life in general. That’s not something that most high school institutions teach their students.', 'ACLA is a small school, allowing students to be much familiar with each other and build strong relationships with staff. The administrators are always looking after the study body, making sure everything runs smoothly.', "All City Leadership Academy provides an amazing academic and social environment for students to excel in. For a school located in Bushwick, many of the students are minority, low-income, and first-generation. Despite this, students get accepted into the world's most prestigious universities. I for one will be attending the Massachusetts Institute of Technology next year and my classmates have already been accepted to schools like Stanford, UPenn, and UVA.What sets us apart from other public schools is the overwhelmingly loving community that the school provides. We don't have to worry about violence, bullying, or petty gossip that most High Schools are accustomed to. From day one we treat each other like a family and grow to push one another to achieve their goals. With the loving community, supportive staff, and overall academic drive, anyone can succeed here. ACLA is just that small school in Bushwick that helps students strive to make a big difference.", 'I chose All City Leadership Secondary School (ACLA) for my first choice in middle school because academically: the small classes, excellent teachers, and the drive and passion for a higher commitment to college. Additionally, their motto for Discipline, Integrity, Motivation, and Enthusiasm (DIME) is powerful and influences my decisions. Their attachment with the military is the embodiment of respect, and humbleness. However, with ACLA being a small school, their activities and classes are limiting. The limited access of diversity and clubs and activities is dragging their potential down into becoming one of the top schools in the city. Thus, their pride and commitment to DIME will be their own definition of success.', 'The school allows students and the staff to grow. There are various activities to participate in and get to know everyone.', 'The school is always available for people to come in.  I would like to see for more activities and events.', "All City is unique in the way that students are always welcomed inside the building. I recall instances where my classmates and I would stay as late up to 8 pm just to work on certain things. Help is always available and that's my favorite thing about the school. What I like to see change is the amount of school activites and events.", 'i wasnt offer as much challenging classes as i wish i had and there was some issues with some of my teachers poor communication', 'ACLA is a great school the staff is amazing, they are truly involved with all the students at the school and become family across the years', 'This is a great school, very family oriented and if you ever have a problem there is always someone there to help guide you through the situation.']
