column6: ['Focus is strictly to prepare for college and progress each year before graduation. There’s no time for anything that isn’t classwork or projects and if work isn’t being done, students are participating in community service events to build their resume and improve their transcript with volunteer work.', "All City Leadership Secondary school is a unique school as it is very small but holds the spirit of a school that holds 1000+ students. Though located in a neighborhood with a dangerous reputation, this school contradicts the stereotypes about Bushwick, Brooklyn as it is known for preparing and sending low-income minorities into top 10 national universities. This is all because of the personal investment of the faculty in the student's lives. Each teacher goes the extra mile for their students and feels obligated to have each student succeed. One thing that I wish would change is the variety of sports. Since this is a relatively small school, I do not see as many sports programs as I would in other schools.", 'ACLA is an amazing school. Its small size creates a family oriented community. Their motto of sports, service, And academics is a staple within every student. ACLA is dedicated in creating the worlds future leaders in all fields.', "I liked the way teachers and staff are so helpful inside and out of class, being in Acla for 6 years has been an amazing experience and I wouldn't change it for the world. From the time you walk in many skills are taught such as discipline and leadership, in which the cadet program at this school offers. We were taught early on how to respect the teachers and staff around us, and our peers most of all. The course work at this school challenges you to work at your highest ability for our benefit. This school has taught me life skills i will carry out to my next 4 years in college so for that I am forever grateful.", 'ACLA has been part of the most significant parts of my life. Through everything I have gone through ACLA was always there; the teachers and staff have always been there to help me when I needed it the most and support me.', 'My experience at ACLA throughout my middle school and high school career has been very empowering of who I am today. Not only does the ACLA teachers and staff teach students about their topics in their classes, they also guide us in real life situations. I find that all my teachers are very supportive and helpful towards every student in the school. The leadership program which is also known as cadets has shaped me to become more respectful and build character. I feel that the leadership program was very essential to me because it really aided on how to carry myself and talk to adults in a respectful manner. I believe that ACLA goes above and beyond with going outside the box for students and actually teaching us about real life not only classroom topics and that is why ACLA is so unique to other public middle schools and high schools out there.', 'my experience was great. There great teacher and everyone their want you to succeed. They want you to be the best version of yourself. They believe you can do whatever you want as long you put your mind to it. I wish their were more clubs and sports.', 'great school , lots of fun activities , great environment, the  school food is ok I guess just regular school food, teachers are super into your life there and will help in any way they can.', 'The school is great! my experience in this school was really life-changing and im certainly going to miss acla', 'Love my school it provided me with such a close tight knit environment where I knew and was freinds with everybody. The administration is amazing and the classrooms are run very well', 'AMAZING SCHOOL! I got into Duke, Cornell, Georgetown, Colgate, New York, Columbia, and Drexel University. Along with Boston, Middlebury college and much more! prepared me immensely.', "ACLA is one of the top schools in the city. Though there isn't much activities that get done there are still tons of events that take place that make the school what it is. From its Cadets program to its saturday programs its great. Being there for both middle school and High school is always a gift because you grow up with the same group of students and teachers that you have for the last 7 years.", "What I like about this school is the tremendous amount of opportunities that I now have. Thanks to this school and the staff, many doors that I previously hadn't even known existed, suddenly opened up for me. As a result of that, I will forever be greatful for this school.", 'My daughter has attended this school since the 6th grade until 12th grade. The teachers are awesome they really want their students to learn and if they need help they are always available to take time with your child. The schools environment is great, the school is very clean and they also give the students healthy breakfast and lunch. The cadets program is great the children treat eachother with respect and discipline. Fighting and cursing is not allowed ever in the school. I would recommend this school to any child who wishes to attend. Parents will not have to worry about anything..', 'I felt that I can impact my community and society as a whole. I am specifically interested in the biological field of science due to the fact that I am intrigued with human life and with every living thing. I think that the key to a brighter STEM future would start with many improvements in biology. Being that I would like to be a future biomedical engineer,  I feel that All City can be my next major milestone in this rigorous and lucrative journey.All City offers a plethora of opportunities such as study abroad programs, with a hands on style of learning. The fact that this campus has a research study area excites me because I will be able to take full advantage of all learning resources offered to me.', "All City is the type of school that does not look appealing to the naked eye. Covered with strict rules, uniforms, and a military program, it gives the impression of a boring old school that limits the creative minds of individuals and focuses on rules and regulations. However, All City is the type of school that gives you the opportunity to express your creativity and even shows it off in the school's walls and trophy cases for all to see. It has rules and regulations set to allow for the focus on education and creativity, and not only leads you into the path but basically pushes you off the ledge and lets you fall into the world of knowledge and creativity. Those who make it past the strict rules and regulations, move on to achieve great, great things. Acla is the 'test of fire', you ready to succeed?", 'All city leadership secondary school has a lot of opportunities that makes you succeed in your education and receiving those that deserve.', 'My experience at ALL CITY SECONDARY SCHOOL has been one of the greatest . The difference from this school is the amount of respect that everybody has for each other and how we learned everything from 9th grade . From going from little kids to strong young individual built and knowing that it is a tough world out there', "My experience at All City Leadership Secondary School has been a very memorable one. I was enrolled as a sixth grader in in 2010-2011 school year in a group of 30 students. I am currently a senior in high school with the majority of the original 30 students. ACLA has opened a vast amount of doors for me as a student with advanced classes, special programs, scholarships, and much more. Not only do I feel prepared academically for my future, but socially as well. ACLA's staff helps teach and develop leadership skills and qualities in all students that attend the school.", 'i like this school because everyone is friendly and you get to know whats going on and even though is a small school you really get a little bit more attention when you need help. What i wan to change is that they need more programs and more elective classes to help us get into a good collage.']
column8: ['Focus is strictly to prepare for college and progress each year before graduation. There’s no time for anything that isn’t classwork or projects and if work isn’t being done, students are participating in community service events to build their resume and improve their transcript with volunteer work.', "All City Leadership Secondary school is a unique school as it is very small but holds the spirit of a school that holds 1000+ students. Though located in a neighborhood with a dangerous reputation, this school contradicts the stereotypes about Bushwick, Brooklyn as it is known for preparing and sending low-income minorities into top 10 national universities. This is all because of the personal investment of the faculty in the student's lives. Each teacher goes the extra mile for their students and feels obligated to have each student succeed. One thing that I wish would change is the variety of sports. Since this is a relatively small school, I do not see as many sports programs as I would in other schools.", 'ACLA is an amazing school. column2: ['The teachers here were amazing, and took care of their students. They pushed you to do better and to show your potential in your academics. They made sure that their students understand the topics of the subjects.', "I visited this school with my son recently who is applying to high schools.  The only word that can be applied to the physical space is bleak -- no color, institutional walls.  The school does not appear to incorporate any meaningful technology into their classrooms.  And the whole approach came across as very militaristic and hyper-controlling.  Finally, there is an enormous emphasis on pure test prep course (SAT English, SAT Math) instead of on the underlying subjects themselves which I found astonishing as a parent.  The school has come off our list as a result of this visit and other parents in our tour group had exactly the same reaction.  So if you're considering this for your high school list, please visit and don't just rely on the written materials.", 'this school is head-on about Academics. which is very good because it set students for a brighter and better future in college. They offer a lot of APs and push students to excel in their school work. They offer a lot of school aid with afterschool support from teachers and sometime the students would be able to come to school on Saturdays to receive the extra help they need for upcoming exams and state exams.', "Just like an average high school ranking website says, MVA is generally a pretty good school. The teachers and other staff put a lot of effort into student improvement in Regents and AP scores, and most often succeed at doing so. Since it's a small school, you rarely ever have to worry about not being given the extra attention you need from any staff member. Recently, teachers began offering one-on-one time with the students before the Regents exams themselves. The one thing this school definitely needs to improve on, though, is the extracurricular activities. All the clubs are either sports-related (and the gym isn't even that good) or inactive. It's hard to find an extra activity to do at this school unless you're into athletics or just doing academic work. Otherwise, my experience here has been pretty good.", 'MVA is small high school that focuses on the college readiness of their students. The workload can be perceived as excessive. However, with the 9th grade team leaders, the transition from 8th to 9th will be facilitated. Freshmen will be acclimated to the new environment with ease.', 'Coming out of this school is different for everyone. The best thing this school offers is college readiness. They offer up to more than 10 AP classes for all grades. We are also required to achieve an advanced regents diploma to be able to be above than average. This is one of the top high schools in the country competing with specialized high schools like Bronx Science. If you want your child to be successful academically, send them here. One of the drawbacks of this school is that there are no extra-curricular or any clubs after school.', 'I love the academics of Manhattan Village Academy it made me very prepared for my college experience. However I would like to see more clubs and organizations implemented within the school that catered to the students interests academic and social alike.', 'Manhattan Village Academy works you pass your limits and work you very hard no matter what. They specialize in critical thinking and making you the hardest worker in the room ever.', 'Manhattan Village Academy is a good school and when it comes to academics is one of the best schools. The school is small and lacks a wide range of clubs.', "I made one of the best decisions of my life going to MVA. I learned life lessons that I wouldn't have learned at any other school, and made friends that I would take with me through life. I only wished that there were more clubs in the school because it was hard for me to find something to do on my spare time. Other than that I could say without a doubt that I am ready for college.", 'I’ve had a rocky experience in this school but I have learned a lot. I know that I am very prepared for college because the basis of this school is Critical Thinking which is used a lot in the college atmosphere and in life in general. The workload of this school is intensive but it really will get me ready for the future of college. We work really hard in this school to get the best scores possible which is what I like. The diversity in this school is very well here, there is even a transgender teacher which exposes us to the real world. This school will prepare us enough to finally go off to college.', 'The teachers are very supportive and academic achievement is highly encouraged. The school has both portfolios and regents. Students can come after school or to Saturday school to get extra help. It is a very nurturing environment, even if the 12 non-negotiable rules are very strict. If you go to MVA, you will develop critical thinking skills and the 3 R’s will be your motto (Reason, Respect, and Responsibility).', 'Work Load is a lot but it all pays off in the end. I’ve had so many sleepless nights but that has helped me be prepared for what college is like. MVA is a college readiness school they push is to do better because they know the potential that each of us as students have', 'Although the work load is exhausting, I feel as I grew as a person and my capability has increased being in this school. By being in a small school my voice was able to grow and my confidence in myself has also increased.', "Manhattan Village Academy is one of the best school's in the city. It is a public school that outshines some of the best specialized high schools in New York. The staff is excellent and seems to care about the students. The coursework is rigorous and will surely push any student to their limits. As time goes on, the school adds on to it's list of AP courses. These courses are not only difficult, but truly improve college readiness in students. Overall, this is an institution that I recommend to any student looking to improve their chances of not only getting into a great college, but actually being prepared for college itself!", 'Great college to help prepare you with the work you will recieve in college. Great education but the school lacks acvtivities and clubs', "One aspect that I like about Manhattan Village Academy is that the teachers encourage students to take advanced classes such as AP classes and honor classes. Teachers do their best to prepare their students for college. Another aspect that I liked was that most teachers give the option of staying after-school, after class, or during lunch in order to help students understand concepts that were not understood during class. They make an effort of communicating with students. One aspect that I don't enjoy is that one of the teachers, is always unprepared and yells at students when a student is confused.", 'Manhattan Village Academy is a college readiness high school because the amount of work we put into is nothing compare to the other high schools. The teachers are always willing to help us succeed. The principal is always saying good morning to us when we first enter the building. Throughout my whole 4 years in this high school, we learned about the critical thinking chart which is very helpful.', 'The teachers are truly amazing— putting in extra time to help students everyday after school. They not only teach the curriculum need, but methodology and critical reasoning for doing things a certain way. Teachers openly share life stories and make class fun and worthwhile. The staff is very enduring and helps the students with anything (including giving supplies like posters and markers for project...for free). The only things that make MVA displeasing is the overly judgmental and overbearing principal and the high pressure placed on students to perform well. Although, the teachers really help with relieving stress.', 'Demands the best of the student all the time. Gets students prepared for the work they will face in college.']

Great education but the school lacks acvtivities and clubs', "One aspect that I like about Manhattan Village Academy is that the teachers encourage students to take advanced classes such as AP classes and honor classes. Teachers do their best to prepare their students for college. Another aspect that I liked was that most teachers give the option of staying after-school, after class, or during lunch in order to help students understand concepts that were not understood during class. They make an effort of communicating with students. One aspect that I don't enjoy is that one of the teachers, is always unprepared and yells at students when a student is confused.", 'Manhattan Village Academy is a college readiness high school because the amount of work we put into is nothing compare to the other high schools. The teachers are always willing to help us succeed. The principal is always saying good morning to us when we first enter the building. Throughout my whole 4 years in this high school, we learned about the critical thinking chart which is very helpful.', 'The teachers are truly amazing— putting in extra time to help students everyday after school. They not only teach the curriculum need, but methodology and critical reasoning for doing things a certain way. Teachers openly share life stories and make class fun and worthwhile. The staff is very enduring and helps the students with anything (including giving supplies like posters and markers for project...for free). The only things that make MVA displeasing is the overly judgmental and overbearing principal and the high pressure placed on students to perform well. Although, the teachers really help with relieving stress.', 'Demands the best of the student all the time. Gets students prepared for the work they will face in college.']
column8: ['The teachers and students at my school respect each other', 'The security guards in my school are very friendly with the students. We get along with them very well. They make us feel safe. They are stationed in the entrance of the school. If you are not a student or a staff member, you are required to sign in and show an ID. My school has never experienced an incident that makes the students feel unsafe.\r The school nurse is also very friendly and she is always available.', "We do not have access to too many extracurricular activities. My school emphasizes academics over extracurricular activities. We have a softball team, a baseball team, a male's soccer team, a female and male basketball team, an art club, a newspaper club, an acapella club, student council, and National Honor Society.", "Manhattan Village Academy does not have many extracurricular activities. However, it strongly emphasizes the concept of academics. Our principal heavily emphasizes the ideas of reason, respect, and responsibility. We are being pushed to be effective and successful citizens in our society. I wish we had more activities going on, but this school's drive for success is more important than extracurricular activities. It is a very small school, with only around 400 students, but we are a tight-knit school. I do consider my senior peers to be a second family. We support each other and stand by each other. I really have enjoyed being in MVA and meeting the people who I attend school with.", 'My teachers can only be described as amazing. They truly show their dedication to their students. They make sure to always be available after school if we need help. They are very open and friendly with us, which makes it easy for us to speak to them and confide in them. For example, a week ago a student in my grade passed away and my senior teachers are being extremely supportive of us. I attended a Catholic school my freshman year of high school and even though I paid to be in that school, I did not receive the amount of attention I receive from my teachers in my public school. I feel comfortable with my teachers and sincerely believe that they are high effective teachers. I have no complains about any of the teachers I have encountered in Manhattan Village Academy.', 'the nurse only gives tea or calls the ambulance', "There's National Honor Society, few sports, academic help", "Sometimes it's hard but everyone wants the students to succeed.", 'I wish this school has more clubs and organizations that students can partake in. And we need more funding on that.', "This school's uniqueness came from its small class size and how close students are with each other.", 'Our teachers are at the middle of great, going to best. Some of course have flaws in their teaching method but overall are a great influence.', 'The school has multiple extracurricular opportunities at school and they allow for the students to create their own as well. Just last year a group of girls created a step team.', 'There are very few public schools that are truly going to prepare anyone for college in the manner that my school does.', 'I am in 12th grade now and overall every single year at MVA, all the teachers were good ones. They also make sure that were not spoon fed and although at sometimes it feels like it way too much work and responsibility that they expect from us, these struggles are helping us to be prepared for a college education.', 'I always feel safe at school and I have not seen any issues with bullying, peer health is also required for a year but I wish there was more health programs or courses.', 'There are not a lot of extracurricular activities because it is up to the students to start and run them, they also take a lot of time and there is a lot of work to be done. Most students stay after school for academic help.', 'If I could do this over, I would still choose this school. They give us a lot of work compared to other schools but with the goal and purpose of improving our time management skills. I am very involved but not all students are, my favorite experience is spirit week because there is something different and fun everyday.', 'Teaching styles vary depending on the subject and teacher but it is very good. Overall, most of them use different techniques like visual and note taking. They are all knowledgeable and will try to find more information if they do not know something.', 'Most students feel safe and secure in this school.', 'The most fun options include, step team and art.']

column2: ["It's a great school. It provides you with all opportunities, such as AP classes e.t.c. It makes the student an overall student, also allowing students to mainly focus on his/her main area of study. A lot of famous people are connected to this school. Such as George Tenet(former director of CIA) and Rafer Alston(NBA player with Miami Heat). The students can achieve what they want as they get the best environment which is necessary for getting success. So, I will prefer this school as this can be the first step in your successful life.", "Allow students to have a bit more freedom, don't focus only on the bad kids, there are many other kids in the school that don't want to be put through hall sweeps, not be allowed to go outside during their free periods or other fun activities just because a few have no respect for the rules. Not everybody should pay for that.", 'Through my high school experience at Cardozo i learned a lot about myself and my interests, and made life long friends.', 'I recommend the school highly for the academics and what it offers as far as programs. A great selection of powerful programs that are advanced and college forward.  You can earn college credits with the many AP courses offered. It is a diverse and fair establishment and respects all. The clubs offered are numerous and covers a great spectrum. The faculty and educators are wonderful and knowledgeable. The only negative comment is that at times there are frivolous threats by teens that alarm you temporarily but the school staff handle it immediately and effectively.', 'do NOT go to this school. I went to this school for one year and everything around me in it made me hate it. It’s disgusting and not clean. worse with no AC during the summer. You can tell that some teachers care, others do not give a single care about you and will just complain the whole period instead of teaching you. I had to teach myself Spanish because my teachers were so low that I couldn’t learn anything before their hard tests. Also, my journalism class was hardly journalism. It was just advanced English. The only time we did journalism was with a teacher helper that was there for college credits.  None of the teachers or students cared when I had anxiety attacks in the middle of class either. I felt very left out as the type of person I am and you can feel judgement in the air wherever you walk. Not to mention there was about 3 lockdowns because of fights and threats.', 'Cardozo High School is one of the most diverse schools, and I appreciate getting to work with, and making friends, with everyone. The student body is very large with about 5,000 students In total. You really have to learn how to get around. However, at Cardozo, you will be able to thrive academically with a great variety of academic programs to choose from. You may also enjoy yourself by participating in 20+ clubs offered. Since there are so many students, It’s really hard for college and guidance counselors to give you the time you need. Thus, I wish each student were able to receive an equal amount of time with their counselors to receive the best assistance, when needed. Otherwise, Cardozo will provide you with that real high school experience. One like no other.', 'Cardozo is a school with a diverse population. Each individual is different in learning capabilities, however, I feel as though this school allows the opportunity for the students to excel further than their current capabilities. The sports in this school are also very well rounded. Personally, I feel as though every teacher is different and I will say some should have a better etiquette when teaching. Though, this is only a select few because most of my teachers allowed me to surpass my initial thoughts of what I could and could not do. Cardozo is a great school, even if it has had several safety concerns (violence, police inclusion). Also due to budget cuts, there can sometimes not be enough textbooks for each student. This does not bother me as this era is progressing and the teacher links us with the pdf versions of the textbooks. (Though can be annoying for others)', 'Cardozo was a great school to attend. They offered many accelerated classes to keep me challenged and college ready. They had so many extracurricular activities and teams to keep students engages and well rounded.', 'My experience with my highschool was good! I met a lot of welcoming people and the teachers were good in a way... they cared about the education kind of... overall this school taught me a valuable lesson through out my highschool years, and that’s is to never give up on what you want to achieve.', 'I loved how the years go by so fast which means i have had a great time in Cardozo. The activities given are very fun and it helped me learn a lot about my subject which got me good grades. I just wish the safety was much better and more teacher to student involvement so that more students can prosper.', "Though this school isn't bad with education, there are some things that I would love to change. For instance, the open campus should be allowed because I strongly agree on allowing students to go out and get some fresh air for lunch instead of being stuck indoors. They may also buy some other food other than school lunch because the school lunch line is long and it is hot in the cafeteria. Also,  more safety for students should be required. There had been many terrible incidents that had happened and I would love it if these events would stop happening. Other than that, the teachers and the education I recieve is amazing.", "There is a ton of fun courses you can take. Overall, there are great teachers and not so great ones, the same goes for the students. I had great experiences so far and my best advice is to carefully choose your crowd. If you want good teachers, take honors and ap classes. I learned a lot so far and I am really pleased with my high school experience. There is a variety of sports and extracurricular that are open to everyone, which makes the after school hours really fun. Safety could definitely be improved, but if you choose the right people to surrounded yourself, you'll be fine. Personally, I never felt threatened in school even though there have been a few accidents. If you are open minded and willing to work and study in school, you will meet some great people that are more than willing to help you. In conclusion, Cardozo is what you make out of it, so do your best to get involved in everything, use your full potential, and make some great friends!", "In general, my experience at this school was largely positive. Everyone is usually pretty cool and easy to get along with, except for the regular classes. Although teachers try to teach, it's not always quality education in these classes because of the students. Not all of them want to learn. On the other hand, I had a lot of fun in my honors and ap classes. Everyone wants to learn, and we have fun doing it. Class is quite chill as well. It is a rather large school. Faculty to student ratio is not that great especially when it comes to applying for colleges.", 'Some of the teachers in this school were excellent and did a good job of ensuring that students understood the curriculum. On the other hand, some teachers lacked any form of teaching abilities and failed to create a safe and comfortable environment for the students. These teachers would carelessly misplace homeworks, not learn who their students are, and had sloppy handwriting and refused to try to help kids understand it. The students in this school are also let loose and I feel that sometimes I don’t think I’m safe because of the weapons and fights that have occurred in my school. I hope to see the school do something to improve the environment of the school. I also hope to see the school provide better academic opportunities for the kids who actually want to try to learn.', "Majority of the staff are amazing and will make your high school experience great. However, there is a handful of staff who don't care about your experience and only care about making sure your grade doesn't dip below 65%. Having dealt with a few of these, trying to keep a 3.5+ GPA has been nearly impossible. There are huge numbers of extracurricular activities to choose from, but funding for each is limited.", "Im telling you if you reading this do not go here this is your sign...it should be shut down, I went there for 4 years no homecoming dances, we didn't even get a senior trip its so unorganized definitely regret spending 4 years here. Im not going to even start talking about all the bad things that happened while I was there just google it...", 'Benjamin N.Cardozo is an great public high school in NYC located in Queens. At Cardozo you can experience a well rounded high school experience through academics, extracurriculars and school spirit. Cardozo is a very diverse school with students and teachers with many different backgrounds, races and ethnicities. I love the school I attend and wouldn’t change my decision to come here.', "My experience at Benjamin N. Cardozo was not at all what I expected. I applied to this school thinking that I would get an excellent education from the science and math department but unfortunately, that was not the case. A fair amount of the teachers that 'taught' me believed that the best way to teach was to assign a lot of work outside of class without actually having lessons prepared. If you're a hard worker you'll survive in high school. If you're an excellent cheater you'll thrive. High school is what you make of it however so attempt to foster relationships and moments that you'll happily remember.", 'Coming into high school I was very nervous about how I would fit in as most middle schoolers are. Even though on the first day I was very nervous by the second week I was already finding my footing. My teachers helped me do great in class and also introduced me to clubs and teams after school. I would have regretted going anywhere else.', "The thing I like about Benjamin N. Cardozo are the A.P. course they provide me. The thing I would like to change the most is the school safety; we had too many accidents that concerned the safety of the school. I would like for all the classes to have air conditioning. The teachers weren't bad but some had accents that were hard to understand or teachers who taught but the students weren't able to understand the material."]

column6: ["Cardozo's academic programs are A+.  My son went to private school up until 8th grade, he didnt hesitate to apply to Cardozo. Academics are equivalent to private schools.", "My experiences in Cardozo so far have been good so far. I have good friends, my grades are really good and many of the teachers are good at what they do. Plus there is a lot of activities and clubs to do in and after school so it is never boring. Although the security in the school isn't the best they try.", 'My experience with Cardozo was a pretty good one overall. The High School has a lot of  AP and Honors classes that I was able to take part in and these classes were challenging which I enjoyed. The faculty is very caring and helpful for the most part. Cardozo was a great experience from beginning to end.', 'When I attended Cardozo, I thoroughly enjoyed myself there and all the teachers were nice to me.  The safety of the school did start to go down in my later years of attending but with the friends and connections I made will always be one of the reasons why I love the school.', 'Hidden secret are the amazing programs like DaVinci, Journalism, Dance and Law. Fantastic educational opportunities abound and the teaching staff are excellent! Do not listen to the media attention that has been blown out of proportion and enjoy this genuine high school experience.', 'I really miss this high school because of the close relationships i had with friends and professors, in general. I poured in tears when i went to this school, at the last day of my senior year, knowing i would be missing this high school so very much. As for the school overall, its science/math incentive is the core, followed by history. Safety is average, but i definitely recommend this high school for anyone interested in science and math.', 'My experience in this high school was overall between poor and average. I have seen many negative encounters with drama in this school. On the other hand, this high school’s academics and teachers are on par in my opinion as I have learned so much and I believe many of the teachers did an awesome job to their best to make the student college ready. One problem is they do lag behind when it comes to implementing STEM, but they have been improving. They do have a FIRST Robotics Competition, Team 5599 The Sentinels, which I had joined in my senior year and since I graduated, I mentor them too. This team made me the person I am today. The team is a work of art that spreads the message of STEM and professionalism, but unfortunately some of the administration does not truly recognize it. Moving on to safety, from my freshman year to my senior year and continuing, safety has been become a huge issue in this school. Many students and staff do not feel safe in this school.', 'Cardozo was alright. Some of the teachers made the school memorable for me and really shaped me into who I am today. They made me work hard, so that I could graduate in my senior year. I was grateful for those handful of teachers', "The rules are strict and not affective. Some teachers can't control their classes and it affects both students and teachers.", "Benjamin N cardozo is a large diverse school where I was presented with many opportunities of taking a large variety of different classes like Da Vinci Math/Science Institute in which students take of challenging advanced and college level courses and foreign language. Besides this the social experience was great due to the diversity and numerous amounts of extracurricular activities of clubs and sports. There's also many parent voulnteers helping out with the college application process and the counselors are always there to help. What i would like changed is more strict safety regulations throughout the hallways and bathrooms.", 'I am a sophomore. Dozo is very nice . It’s diverse, there are lots of programs and sports. The classes and opportunities are good', 'I somewhat enjoyed my high school experience here. It was nothing amazing, just normal. The food, sports, clubs were all okay. There were some very passionate teachers who were great but also some who looked like they hated being there. Overall the school is just okay.', 'It is a great school with great students the teachers really care about their students. Another thing I reallly like about Cordoza is that teachers are really involved with the students', 'I loved every moment of my 4 years at Cardozo, also known as "dozo". I was able to develop my passion in dance while excelling in the law program. There were soo many different types of students that you were introduced to sooo many cultures. It was an awesome time.', "While the DaVinci program is an outstanding program that allows students to engage in either biomedical activities or engineering. Most of the students in this program are very intelligent and don't hesitate when faced with academical challenges. However, I cannot say the same for the rest of the school and their programs. Many of the students seem uninterested and complain about faulty teachers all throughout their journey from one class to another. The worst part about this school is how disgustingly overcrowded it is.", 'I’ve had an average experience at Benjamin N Cardozo High School. Teachers vary by some being extremely good and knowing how to teach and others that can’t teach at all. The school can improve by getting better teachers and removing their library system where kids have to wait for a pass in the cafeteria and then enter the library because it takes too much time and is useless. The school has a lot of talent and students perform very well in each school show. There are also a lot of books and help in getting ready for the SAT.', "I feel as if I have a love-hate relationship with my high school. As adolescents, experiencing new things everyday we tend to have a negative stigma towards school. School is something people dread attending, becoming involved in, or discussing with their family. However, it is the friendships I've formed, the vocal or musical theatre opportunities I have come by, the lessons learned and memories made that have made me want to come back every day, eager even! Yes, there are certain things such as safety, or cafeteria food that seek reform but every high school faces issues as well as positives. Then again, we dread school until we realize years after when it's too late, that it was the best years of our life.", 'I like going to Cardozo, some of the things are just hit and miss. Of course high school is what you make of it, but I would like to see a few things change. There should be more parent involvement and more school spirit. However, I love the shows that are put on, for example the musicals, the talent and fashion shows, etc.', 'I loved high school. Yes, my high school was overcrowded and the halls were filled with too many people when moving around to get to class but I miss that busyness of school. I loved my teachers and peers and the workload was challenging but easy to manage. There were many clubs that were offered, which was the best part about this school. I feel like everyone knew each other despite the large population and we were all somewhat friends. There were many events too, which I enjoyed. I remember I would want to come to school because it was enjoyable.', 'The school has drastically changed since my mother actually attended. I feel very unsafe in the environment, and the staff members clearly do not show their care or support for the students']

On the other hand, this high school’s academics and teachers are on par in my opinion as I have learned so much and I believe many of the teachers did an awesome job to their best to make the student college ready. One problem is they do lag behind when it comes to implementing STEM, but they have been improving. They do have a FIRST Robotics Competition, Team 5599 The Sentinels, which I had joined in my senior year and since I graduated, I mentor them too. This team made me the person I am today. The team is a work of art that spreads the message of STEM and professionalism, but unfortunately some of the administration does not truly recognize it. Moving on to safety, from my freshman year to my senior year and continuing, safety has been become a huge issue in this school. Many students and staff do not feel safe in this school.', 'Cardozo was alright. Some of the teachers made the school memorable for me and really shaped me into who I am today. They made me work hard, so that I could graduate in my senior year. I was grateful for those handful of teachers', "The rules are strict and not affective. Some teachers can't control their classes and it affects both students and teachers.", "Benjamin N cardozo is a large diverse school where I was presented with many opportunities of taking a large variety of different classes like Da Vinci Math/Science Institute in which students take of challenging advanced and college level courses and foreign language. Besides this the social experience was great due to the diversity and numerous amounts of extracurricular activities of clubs and sports. There's also many parent voulnteers helping out with the college application process and the counselors are always there to help. What i would like changed is more strict safety regulations throughout the hallways and bathrooms.", 'I am a sophomore. Dozo is very nice . It’s diverse, there are lots of programs and sports. The classes and opportunities are good', 'I somewhat enjoyed my high school experience here. It was nothing amazing, just normal. The food, sports, clubs were all okay. There were some very passionate teachers who were great but also some who looked like they hated being there. Overall the school is just okay.', 'It is a great school with great students the teachers really care about their students. Another thing I reallly like about Cordoza is that teachers are really involved with the students', 'I loved every moment of my 4 years at Cardozo, also known as "dozo". I was able to develop my passion in dance while excelling in the law program. There were soo many different types of students that you were introduced to sooo many cultures. It was an awesome time.', "While the DaVinci program is an outstanding program that allows students to engage in either biomedical activities or engineering. Most of the students in this program are very intelligent and don't hesitate when faced with academical challenges. However, I cannot say the same for the rest of the school and their programs. Many of the students seem uninterested and complain about faulty teachers all throughout their journey from one class to another. The worst part about this school is how disgustingly overcrowded it is.", 'I’ve had an average experience at Benjamin N Cardozo High School. Teachers vary by some being extremely good and knowing how to teach and others that can’t teach at all. The school can improve by getting better teachers and removing their library system where kids have to wait for a pass in the cafeteria and then enter the library because it takes too much time and is useless. The school has a lot of talent and students perform very well in each school show. There are also a lot of books and help in getting ready for the SAT.', "I feel as if I have a love-hate relationship with my high school. As adolescents, experiencing new things everyday we tend to have a negative stigma towards school. School is something people dread attending, becoming involved in, or discussing with their family. However, it is the friendships I've formed, the vocal or musical theatre opportunities I have come by, the lessons learned and memories made that have made me want to come back every day, eager even! Yes, there are certain things such as safety, or cafeteria food that seek reform but every high school faces issues as well as positives. Then again, we dread school until we realize years after when it's too late, that it was the best years of our life.", 'I like going to Cardozo, some of the things are just hit and miss. Of course high school is what you make of it, but I would like to see a few things change. There should be more parent involvement and more school spirit. However, I love the shows that are put on, for example the musicals, the talent and fashion shows, etc.', 'I loved high school. Yes, my high school was overcrowded and the halls were filled with too many people when moving around to get to class but I miss that busyness of school. I loved my teachers and peers and the workload was challenging but easy to manage. There were many clubs that were offered, which was the best part about this school. I feel like everyone knew each other despite the large population and we were all somewhat friends. There were many events too, which I enjoyed. I remember I would want to come to school because it was enjoyable.', 'The school has drastically changed since my mother actually attended. I feel very unsafe in the environment, and the staff members clearly do not show their care or support for the students']

column2: ["I totally hated my whole experience with the entire Plainedge school district. I never felt welcomed and included. (btw im hispanic) which really explains why. I had no school spirit the whole time here and there's definitely favortism. Dont come to this school.", 'The administration tries their best to provide a safe, healthy, nurtoring environment for its students. Students are held to high expectations.', 'Great academics and sports. Only drawback is there is not much diversity in the student t body, teachers or administration.', 'I had a pretty good experience there. I was involved in most things the school had to offer. Science and National Honors Society, the winter and spring track team, the drama club, the yearbook club. The teachers were always friendly and helpful, many of which I became very friendly with and had great relationships with.', 'I liked the security that the school provided.  They were always working on upgrades to the security system.  I feel that they take security very seriously    The overall experience has been very good.  Always a positive experience', "Attending Plainedge was not as great as it could have been, there's a social hierarchy between the students and the food is kind of horrible, but if you have your group of friends then the 4 years will fly by. Majority of the teachers are wonderful, some strict, but they just want whats best.", 'Plainedge High School has great academics, sports, clubs and activities. They always have an event or activity to keep students busy. They also help out finding a college perfect for your child based of their academic grades and achievements.', "Plainedge is a very sports-oriented school and doesn't hold as many opportunities for students interested in arts and music. The teachers, for the most part, are very helpful and supportive. The lunches have improved in the last four years after adding a deli section from Boar's Head. The guidance department was helpful with the college application process.", 'Great school. Teachers care and spend their time offering extra help. Sports are average to above average and theater is good.', 'I loved the small school feel.  The teachers were terrific.  Lessons were always thought out.  Classes are so small that you get a lot of attention from teachers.  They treat students like adults.  The principal is very involved. He attends most school events.  He is also an amazing English teacher.  Sports were fun.  Our teams are always very successful.  We have had many all county athletes.  Most of the coaches were caring and inspiring.  The music department was my favorite.  The choir teacher is amazing.  Choir tour is the highlight every year for us.  Our concerts are broadcast on the internet for the family to see if they cannot be there.  The security system is so good.  You always feel safe to be there.  When something happens at the school, they make everyone aware of the facts.  Many families stay in Plainedge, mostly for the schools.  Most parents are graduates of the school district.', 'They have some of the best teachers. They go above and beyond to make sure you meet all graduation requirements and help a lot with the college applications. Teachers really support their students and will help them reach their full potential.', 'While it\'s sweet that its a small community and I found great people who went here, overall there is a warped sense of reality. It\'s hard to see life outside of Plainedge and almost everyone here cannot see through this haze. I feel as an alumni I had poor prep for when I had to go to the "real world". Some of the teachers are amazing but it is incredibly close-minded and you\'ll have to do some work to break from this mold.', 'Plainedge really was very supportive in my readiness to go to college and any help I needed I always had somewhere to find it there. I was never sent away and if I still needed anything after graduating my teachers or any faculty there would still be happy to help.', 'School is extremely cliquey and this pushes some students to the outside rather than having their moments to shine.  Athletics is favored sometimes over academics.  I feel the school has the resources, if only they would use them more efficiently.', 'Attending the #1 business school right now I could attest that Plainedge prepared me academically with rigorous AP courses and honors courses as well. besides from academics  must mention the lack of knowledge the guidance counselors collectively share of schools outside the SUNY system. They seem fixed on sending kids to a SUNY school. Attending a school outside of New York exposed me to things I cannot put into words. In a sense I.T made me more cultured.', "Plainedge is very sport-centered. This means that people with academic or artistic inclinations do not get the sufficient attention needed to prepare them for their future. The research program cannot compete at a local level, clubs are not active (just used as a resume booster), the arts department is on a tight budget and always scrambling for supplies, teachers aren't comfortable with their material, and our sports teams aren't even successful. While Plainedge is a tight-knit community, overall, it is a community that does not value the arts or academics, and it lacks in diversity.", "Very loving community, but small school. Unfortunately, some AP classes were unable to run because there weren't  enough kids to take it. This probably wouldn't happen in a bigger school district.", 'My experiences at Plainedge were definitely unforgettable. I loved all my teachers because they were always there for me when I needed them. Since it is a small district it felt more like a family than a school.', 'I really enjoy how involved the teachers are. How they are involved with their students and want them to succeed', 'The teachers are amazing, school safety is definitely not something to worry about in this high school. The ethicity in this school are mostly Caucasian but they are all very friendly. The school is old but it is decent for learning, there are plenty of clubs to join and sports as well and I would say many students has a great friend group so they are not worried about depression or any issue like that.']

column6: ['Plainedge Senior High School is a well kept, respectful school where all of the kids are ambitious and energetic. The school does a good job of getting every kid involved in something that they work hard at and enjoy for the rest of their school tenure. They only have one bathroom which is in very poor condition and there is no AC in any part of the building but had enough money to pay for a new football and baseball field.', 'Plainedge High School exposes their students to so many different kinds of classes for all different interests.  The teachers are always willing to go above and beyond for their students.  Being able to take college courses and getting the credit for it during your Junior and Senior year is a wonderful benefit.  My son has taken their internship classes which has been a positive experience too.', "I'm currently a senior and I love my school. Though it lacks diversity and the building is a little old, I have had my best memories in this school.  The music program is excellent, and there are many opportunities for students to participate in clubs, societies and a variety of classes.  I've personally enjoyed the international trips, drama club, orchestra and many of the school's AP classes.  The teachers are generally funny, kind and knowledgeable about their subject of choice. I have enjoyed my time here and will look back on high school fondly because of Plainedge.", "It's a semi small school which keeps class sizes small and ensures everyone knows each other. Sports are very good but the school seems to prioritize them over academics at points. Offers honors and AP courses but only 1-2 AP classes are offered per course which means you might not even be able to take them if they don't fit perfectly into your schedule. Guidance doesn't help at all and is never around. Most of the teachers are amazing though and will help you out. Also the music programs are excellent! Orchestra gets gold or gold with distinction every year at NYSSMA.", 'It was a very thriving environment that helped me prepare for college. My teachers helped show me my potential and pushed me to excel. The music department is well above average for the area and was one of my favorite parts of high school.', "I loved moving here from Brooklyn to attend High School here. This school was and still is the best school my parents could have chosen. The faculty we're so helpful throughout my college process. I have become so close to some of the teachers there and I would not change that for the world.", 'As a high school senior student in the Plainedge  Senior High School District I had a great experience.  I felt the faculty prepared me for my next step towards college education.  I was involved in the High School  marching band for 4 years and the High School Varsity Volleyball team for my senior which  I  learned teamwork, leadership skills, and how to work together with my classmates.', "Plainedge High School is a nice community school. Most of the student get along because it's small so you know everyone. Most of the teachers are nice and help you not only with school work but real world issues. I've gotten to know many people and I'm going to be a little sad when I graduate and it all comes to an end. I'm excited to get out of the plainedge district though and meet many new people.", "If you're into whiet suburban high schools, welcome to Plainedge. Rarely are there teachers who actually want to see you learn and care about your education. Some just want to teach and go home", 'The school has some great teachers who really know what they are doing in the classroom. The academics here are excellent if you are in honors or AP classes. Not so good for just the average student, however. The student population is very divided and Plainedge is not such a good school for school pride or culture.', 'The past four years of my life I spent at Plainedge High School have been great. The teachers are so helpful and care about your well being.', 'The academics are overall great, it is easy to choose the correct path for you without having to struggle academically and mid year schedule changes are very easy', 'Plainedge is barely considered ethnically diverse, it is mostly white italian roman catholics', 'The health and security measures at Plainedge are fairly good. We have unarmed security, cameras, locked doors at all times as well as visitor sign ins.', 'Great extracurricular activities at Plainedge. These include but are not limited to Jazz choir, Jazz band, Chamber Orchestra, Drama Club, Student Government, Robotics, Mathletes, Key Club, Tri-M, ect. There are a great variety for those of different intrests and most are easy to join and maintain membership.', 'If given the opportunity I would 100% attend Plainedge High School again. I have had many great in school experiences due to the fact that the school is full of many different activities. Plainedge has a wonderful music department and music is one of my favorite hobbies. There are many clubs and classes of music such as choir class or jazz choir club but also Plainedge runs AP music theory every other year. The school also has many other clubs and sports teams. The community of Plainedge often comes together for sport games. Also, the school does many district wide activities such as Relay for Life and the heart of Plainedge 5K as well as many other opportunities to give back to good causes. It is extremely easy to become involved in school and the education is top notch due to the fact that there are a variety of classes and levels offered. It is easy to make a schedule that will make each student succeed due to the fact that you can take advanced, intermediate and easier leveled classes depending on your comfort level with each subject. Tutoring is offered through many honor societies and nearly every teacher stays after school for extra help. Plainege is a great school and a great community.', 'The teachers in plainedge all have an extremely unique teaching style and no two teachers are the same. However the teachers genuinely care about students education as well as personl lives and try not to make students lives any more difficult than they need to be. They are always expressing the need for the many available resources in our school as well as making sure that all students stay on the track to graduation as best as possible.', 'there is a no tolerance for bullying. We have id cards and cannot get into the buliding without them. we have many sequirty guards walking around', 'Everyone who is commited to the clubs or orgninaziaitions at the school, are very involevd and put in 100% of their effort.', 'High school was fun. Cheerleading was the best expeirence for me. It helped me make new friends,and  get involved with the schools activities. My school is different because everyone gets along, we are all friends in some type of way and we are all so close.']

column1: High School for Dual Language & Asian Studies
column2: ["All the teachers are nice and they are willing to help. It's a small school that we knew most of the people in our school, but this can be problem that our community is small, which means we couldn't expand our social like other big schools. Moreover, our school provide great resources to different programs, classes, scholarships, etc. In our school, we have chance to have closer relationships with certain teachers we like. This is good because it gave us a chance to let our teacher know us well, and it make us easier to ask for recommendation letters, which means they can write good things about us instead of knowing nothing. This school also provide chances to demonstrate our talents.", "I'm a senior at this school. Overall, this school is a good fit for me. Teachers and staffs of this school are very supportive and encouraging. They always support and help students at any time. Also, this school provides so many different courses for students to choose from, so every student here can find their favorite classes.", 'The people there are very nice, even the teachers themselves are willing to teach students everyday. Students help each other accomplish tasks that can be hard.', "It's overall a great school. I feel extremly luckly to be in this place! People overthere are mostly nice and helpful. Most of the teachers are nice, and willing to communicate with you regarding to any question and concern. Even though the majority of the population is Asian, but most grown up in America; therefore, it's actucally easy to find a sense of belonging in this school. On the other hand, I do have to say sometimes works might be a bit overwhelming if you don't manage your time correctly. However, it provides a great preparation academic wise as well as for college.", "Overall the experience is pretty good. The courses can be pretty challenging. Most people here are really competitive and the workload is heavy. But the students are supportive of each other. Beware of saturday gym and morning gym. Morning gym starts at 7:14 in the morning. Also, there is a severe lack of funding in this school so don't expect trips or extra resources.", "High School for Dual Language and Asian Studies may be a small high school compared to other school, but its also the best part about it because everyone there are really close, like a closely knitted family. There's wide variety of clubs and sports teams to choose from, and the school also provides all kinds of after school programs. However though, this school does have some pretty high academic pressure, so student may feel stressed out with the huge amount of workload that teachers give out.", "It is a pretty good school for high school students learning in a safety area.  They have a lot of activities for students to attend and also people are friendly.  BUT! They are very focus on student's academics and a lot of homework.", 'My favorite thing about dlas is the people that are there. The staff and teachers are very friendly and are always willing to help students. Dlas, however, is very limited in the classes they offer. They have a few AP classes, which are pretty hard to get into. They do offer a lot of outside college classes, college now.', 'A majority of teachers do care, and it is easy to talk to your teachers. Since the school is relatively small in population, you are able to form bonds with your teachers if you please. The staff does want you to fully understand the content and will help if necessary. Although the workload is rigorous, you will get used to it.', 'The school is on the 5th floor and is above some other lower ranking schools. It lacks in sports selections but makes up for it in academics.', 'I’m a sophomore at Dual, and I have mixed feelings about this school. The three stars is mainly given to the generally supportive and awesome teachers here at dual. The quality of teachers are 👍. However, the student body is not as motivated as I’m used to. The bars are  high, but many students lack behind it. Another thing, is the lack of extracurricular opportunities. This school is really lacking in funding. But counselors and teachers are extremely helpful.', 'I liked High School for Dual Language and Asian Studies for its rigorous curriculum  and its helpful environment. If you struggled, you could ask the teacher for help. Especially, Chinese which I have to take for four years at the nd books.', 'The students are all really nice and willingly to help each other. Some teachers are helpful, but some give up so easily on students that don’t get it the first tim. The staff is very strict, and dress code is very strict as well. I think the school is too small because every year more students come and the one floor is not enough. In addition, the staff should work with the students instead of ignoring their ideas. For example, students are not allowed outside for lunch, but the other schools can. Remember if you come to this school, chinese is a priority. About 90% of the school speaks Chinese. So if you don’t know how to, the first feels a little isolating. In addition, everyone has their own cliques.', 'I am currently a senior at this school, I personally feel like this school has help me grown academically. This school  push you to do better and so the workload can be a lot depending on the classes , but at the same time, most of the teachers are really passionate in what they do and they are willing to help if you have any problem. The courses are challenging and the workload is a lot , but they ultimately  increase your college readiness.  Since this school is pretty small, everyone knows one-another and you would be able to meet your friend multiple time throughout the day. This school requires everyone to take Chinese language course, which can be challenging  if Chinese is not your first language.', "It's a good choice for students to pick. Learn a lot from teachers and classmates. However, the food is tasteless.", 'I liked that most of the classes were very challenging and it made me think of the world in a different perspective.', 'I revered High School For Dual Language & Asian Studies for its tight knit community and rigorous academic curriculum. As a senior in this school, I feel a sense of calamity for being in a friendly environment of a small school. I was truly noticed by every teacher. The teachers are fun loving and always open to helping you. They are all from well rounded institutions. Personally I looked for a liberal arts curriculum school, and HSDLAS has a rigid liberal foundation for students still exploring their interests. The food is high quality! HSDLAS contains essential clubs and activities such as philosophy, photography, and the list is endless! It would be important to change the diversity of HSDLAS, as the majority there are of Asian descent. I would also incorporate more clubs and activities of social justice and activism as it is a very traditional high school.', 'I was able to study mandarin for 4yrs learn the difference in our  culture and I would not change a thing about there learning  facilities  We’re listed #2 in citywide and #14 in state', "This is a truly horrible school, they don't care about you growing as an individual. As long as their stats are high they couldn't care less about how you're doing as a person. They also favor the asians over any other race in the school.", 'High School For Dual Language and Asian Studies is overall a great school. Especially when it comes to academics and college readiness. Not to mention, meeting great people there. The school overall is naturally disciplined so not a lot of horseplay goes around, or at all. But there is also a healthy competition to be the best student. Every single student at Dual Language works really hard at what they want to do and other things though they may not favor it. But overall, despite the school may have flaws (like all schools do) High School for dual language is a great place to push your limits to the highest.']
column4: ["All the teachers are nice and they are willing to help. It's a small school that we knew most of the people in our school, but this can be problem that our community is small, which means we couldn't expand our social like other big schools. Moreover, our school provide great resources to different programs, classes, scholarships, etc. In our school, we have chance to have closer relationships with certain teachers we like. This is good because it gave us a chance to let our teacher know us well, and it make us easier to ask for recommendation letters, which means they can write good things about us instead of knowing nothing. This school also provide chances to demonstrate our talents.", "I'm a senior at this school. Overall, this school is a good fit for me. Teachers and staffs of this school are very supportive and encouraging. They always support and help students at any time. Also, this school provides so many different courses for students to choose from, so every student here can find their favorite classes.", 'The people there are very nice, even the teachers themselves are willing to teach students everyday. Students help each other accomplish tasks that can be hard.', "It's overall a great school. I feel extremly luckly to be in this place! People overthere are mostly nice and helpful. Most of the teachers are nice, and willing to communicate with you regarding to any question and concern. Even though the majority of the population is Asian, but most grown up in America; therefore, it's actucally easy to find a sense of belonging in this school. On the other hand, I do have to say sometimes works might be a bit overwhelming if you don't manage your time correctly. However, it provides a great preparation academic wise as well as for college.", "Overall the experience is pretty good. The courses can be pretty challenging. Most people here are really competitive and the workload is heavy. But the students are supportive of each other. Beware of saturday gym and morning gym. Morning gym starts at 7:14 in the morning. Also, there is a severe lack of funding in this school so don't expect trips or extra resources.", "High School for Dual Language and Asian Studies may be a small high school compared to other school, but its also the best part about it because everyone there are really close, like a closely knitted family. There's wide variety of clubs and sports teams to choose from, and the school also provides all kinds of after school programs. However though, this school does have some pretty high academic pressure, so student may feel stressed out with the huge amount of workload that teachers give out.", "It is a pretty good school for high school students learning in a safety area.  They have a lot of activities for students to attend and also people are friendly.  BUT! They are very focus on student's academics and a lot of homework.", 'My favorite thing about dlas is the people that are there. The staff and teachers are very friendly and are always willing to help students. Dlas, however, is very limited in the classes they offer. They have a few AP classes, which are pretty hard to get into. They do offer a lot of outside college classes, college now.', 'A majority of teachers do care, and it is easy to talk to your teachers. Since the school is relatively small in population, you are able to form bonds with your teachers if you please. The staff does want you to fully understand the content and will help if necessary. Although the workload is rigorous, you will get used to it.', 'The school is on the 5th floor and is above some other lower ranking schools. It lacks in sports selections but makes up for it in academics.', 'I’m a sophomore at Dual, and I have mixed feelings about this school. The three stars is mainly given to the generally supportive and awesome teachers here at dual. The quality of teachers are 👍. However, the student body is not as motivated as I’m used to. The bars are  high, but many students lack behind it. Another thing, is the lack of extracurricular opportunities. This school is really lacking in funding. But counselors and teachers are extremely helpful.', 'I liked High School for Dual Language and Asian Studies for its rigorous curriculum  and its helpful environment. If you struggled, you could ask the teacher for help. Especially, Chinese which I have to take for four years at the nd books.', 'The students are all really nice and willingly to help each other. Some teachers are helpful, but some give up so easily on students that don’t get it the first tim. The staff is very strict, and dress code is very strict as well. I think the school is too small because every year more students come and the one floor is not enough. In addition, the staff should work with the students instead of ignoring their ideas. For example, students are not allowed outside for lunch, but the other schools can. Remember if you come to this school, chinese is a priority. About 90% of the school speaks Chinese. So if you don’t know how to, the first feels a little isolating.
