column6: ["It's a very welcoming environment, however there are some challenges when it comes to sharing a building with four different schools, limited space and some annoying students. Moderate pressure, moderate workload. You will not be tolerated for late or missing work. It's a place with the ability to allow you to succeed, you just have to try your best.", "Although lacking diversity, Dual Language is a school built on moral conduct and respect.The goal of the school is to unify English proficient students to better understand Chinese culture and Chinese proficient students to improve their English. What makes Dual language different from other schools is that the Ap Chinese class is mandatory for everyone, regardless of one's level in Chinese.Although limited in Ap classes and course variety compared to bigger schools, but because some of the teachers are well versed in their subjects, students are able to obtain a lot of out of their AP classes. Although teachers are strict with following the school policy, they would try to be understanding of students. Since teachers are approachable, students can engage in a friendly conversation with teachers outside of class to inquire or express their concerns.", "Overall, it's a safe school environment. Everyone is very friendly and there is a lot of activities going on monthly to make our school life more fun. The teachers are very nice and very helpful and chill. However, the hallways aren't wide enough for students to pass through when we have to switch classes. Also the schedules we get are usually messed up, but our guidance counselors try their very best to make a compromise.", 'I personally like our school for several reasons. Most of the teachers treat their students like their friends. The students are not just learn from the class but also after the class. As the new generation comes, our school recruits more students of different races, which increases the diversity of the school. Everyone are polite towards other, and it is pretty safe to stay in the school. Although our school only have art class like art and drama, we enjoyed the classes a lot.  We do have various sport teams and activities, which provides much more fun during the school life. Some teams, such as badminton and volleyball, the training is intense. I like how it feel to be on the team because you can make more friends and learn something besides all those curriculum. I love my high school life in Dual Language, and I appreciated all those teachers who work so hard to help us improve and success.', 'Overall, the school environment is very suitable for study, everyone is nice and friendly. Teachers are really trying to teach. However, the homework is pretty heavy, that is the hugest compliant I want to make!', '"Students who graduated from HSDLAS, the amount of work in college is just a piece of cake." the former students that graduated from the school said. I totally agreed. Since the teacher in our school always give exceed amount of homework, therefore, academic wise HSDLAS could be one of the bests.', 'The school is so small, but I love it.  People are friendly and known each other well.  All students are respectful, teachers are nice/ caring, and there is good teacher-student relationship.The school provided intense study mood which catalyzed student to study hard, as the school always gave sufficient amount of task.Dual Language promotes study of Chinese culture, and Chinese is the require course for every student.The school is strict, we had no gang, drug, smoking, violence activities found.  It makes me feel safe.We also provided great STEM program, however, we are weak in English since most of our student is Chinese immigrants.The school should have improvement in English education.', "Some of the teachers in HSDLAS can not teach. Also, most of the teachers in HSDLAS aren't supportive and understanding. They are not trying to help their students at all.", 'Great School to go in for learning chinese. I am sure that your kid will know how to control their time after go in to it.', "Depends on what point of view you are looking at, the school's performance deserves or doesn't deserve it's current rank. The amount of material the school provided is very limited and outdated, however, the teachers are very fluent with such materials that passed decade ago.  The teachers provide as much help as they can and the faculty provides as much trouble on you as they can. No school uniform but if you wear something like skirt or tank top, they mind chase you and harass you throughout the day. Less than 30 teacher+faculty means when you need recommendation letter, you are on your luck. Couple guards in the building that never prevents trouble but with attitudes. Student group mostly Asian, so they are most likely not going to report events like ceiling fall on lunch table during lunch period.", 'All teacher and students are helpful toward each other.  Also, during my 4 years of school life, I see no drug, fight, or etc.', 'Dual Language definitely does not rank high when it comes to diversity, seeing as how the school population is 95% Asian students. However, it sets the bar pretty high when it comes to academics and student performance. They provide rigorous courses with hardcore curriculum in order to encourage students to strenuously work hard in their classes. This is quite a small, close-knitted school with a staff count of around 30 people and student population of about 400. Therefore, staff and students are able to connect on a closer level because of the benefits of a more intimate environment. But, Dual Language falls short when it comes to extracurricular activities. Many extracurricular activities revolve around the Asian culture such as Kpop Club, Taekwondo, Lion Dance Club, etc. Dual Language could do a better job trying to stretch the ethnic spectrum and encourage new activities that are derived from other cultures as well.', 'High school for Dual Language and Asian Studies will destroy any abilities you may have as a free thinker in society. The school promotes conformity as a value it instills within its students and inspires no free thinking. Students, upon entering this school, find themselves depressed, completely stressed out, but no administrative services that care enough to do anything until it begins to reflect badly on the school. If you love your child, do not send them to this school. Beyond having a very detrimental environment for the wellbeing of students, the academics fail us tremendously. Teachers do not teach in the classrooms, but instead give reading materials and expect students to learn on their own, essentially rendering them useless in the classroom setting. Students who leave the school often feel unprepared and, despite the heavily and painfully intense environment, most students are accepted to mediocre schools as best, if any at all.', "I love how the student body and staff is a close-knit community. I get to know my teachers and classmates really well, and it's a supportive environment. I have the opportunity to meet new students from my classes, and it's comforting to see familiar faces in the hallways.The student diversity has been growing, and it's been amazing to learn new things about different cultures.", "One thing I like about this school is that there are many AP classes I can take.  With these Ap, I don't need to retake the courses in college.  It kind of saving my tuition and time in future.  But there are also the negative sides about having abundant courses, which is a lot pressures are being put onto the students as well.  Many students are stressful.  In addition, another thing that I think my school could improve is try to have more extracurricular activities, so that students can have more places to release their pressures.", "The school environment is very calm so there rarely are any rules being broken. Dress code rules are very strict and heavily enforced. However, a lot of teachers do not show interest about their students' grades and a few even talk about failing students with 65 averages even though 65 is passing. This isn't a bad school but I wish the faculty showed more interest if my grades are worsening and that teachers could be a little more lenient with students that are struggling but are trying their best. Some teachers even threaten their students with failing them when they need to help them, not threaten them. The faculty only talks to me when they need something from me but never because they are interested in how my day is going or simply just a friendly hello. They make it obvious I'm just a statistic to them. I hope someday this could improve. A few teachers are very nice though and they are willing to give their free time to help students.", 'There is a school nurse.', 'There are second to none clubs in this school. We need the NYDOE to supply us with more technological equipment.', 'I made a lot of my best friends at this school and I do not regret coming here.', 'They teach really well except we have too much homework. Expect at least 2-4 hours of homework per day for freshmans  and seniors and 4-6 hours of homework for sophomores and juniors.']

column2: ['Wonderful school if you enjoy playing music and studying in a small community. Very good teachers and a supportive environment.', "Special Music School Is one of the only public High school located in Manhattan that offers core academics such as STEM and also music classes. Offering private lesson's to all students and having resources from Kaufman Music Center. The community is welcoming and supportive of peers, allowing performances every week and concerts throughout the season. Having, choir, Orchestra, Chamber, Composition, and Big Band.", 'Special Music School is life changing. It is a community of incredibly talented and smart musicians who are diverse in perspective and all interesting in their own way. It is a supportive and inclusive community that is constantly trying to better itself and innovate/create new tradition. It has its flaws as does any school, but on the whole if you seek to work on yourself, learn, and find good people, it will be possible here and it will teach you a level of music rarely seen elsewhere.', 'The academic teachers at Special Music School are amazing but the school is very small. The school is located on the lowest level of the MLK campus. Every morning over 3,000 students are forced to go through metal detectors.', 'Special Music School has been a great place for me to grow as a student and a musician. There’s amazing and helpful teachers with lots of support from everyone!', 'I loved the community and how the school was able to blend academics and music into an integrated curriculum.']

['Teachers are not the best (in terms of being able to teach/properly convey information). However, it provided me with a good education', 'There are some amazing teachers that care about students and want you to excel. There are a fair amount of student organizations to get involved in.', 'I like that NewMilford High has a good diverse student body, and teachers are leading the way for students in their careers. I would however like to see improvement with better lunch systems, having everyone have lunch at the same time causes long lines waiting for food.', 'Recently graduated in 2018. I enjoyed my experience attending this school as a freshmen up to senior year. Friendly and safe environment and staff', "I have great memories of NMHS! The NMHS Staff are very helpful, very knowledgeable.I played football JV and V, baseball - Freshman year, wrestling - Sophomore year. The coaches were fabulous, very supportive and encouraging.      The teachers were very interesting and made classroom fun and engaging. They were very involved with student activities. They gave students many opportunities to succeed. Also, many opportunities to study different courses such as child development, cooking, and graphic arts made for an interesting and diverse program.     I've made friends at NMHS that I'll keep for life. We have so many shared memories such as prom weekend, parties, graduation that will bind us forever.", 'I did not get a proper education at this school. Most of the teachers either do not care for their work or do not care for the students. The money that this school gets goes to pointless technology and useless extra things that we do not need. The special needs program is terrible for these kids, the preperation for college is non-existent, and the administration does not care for the children, only money.', 'I moved from a different state to this school and it was completely different but a great change. Teachers will very helpful, and cousework was a good amount for high school students.', 'As a entering junior I had many experiences in this schools. There is very little diversity. Some teachers are good at teaching and interacting with kids. Then there are the other teachers that are only there to get paid.', 'During my 4 years at the high school, I learned so much - The teachers taught well and were always willing to help out when needed.  The school is very strict with  attendance and lateness, after so many recurrences they will have after school detention.\xa0The extracurricular opportunities at the High School are great. There is a variety of different clubs such as Video Game Club, Bowling, Cross Country, Swimming, Tennis and Badminton Club.', 'There are a variety of Academic and performing clubs. The Model UN and MockTrial clubs have won State and Regional titles.', 'The variety of activities and courses that are offered allows students to really see what pat they may want to take. The Academies Program allows students to broaden their learning experiences in a safe learning environment with like minded students.', 'The teachers not only care about their students academically, they get to know them and care about them as people.', 'Some are more helpful than others , but I am having a great senior Year !!', 'There has never been a major incident, and generally I feel pretty safe.', "As with all schools, it's here and there in some places, but in some areas New Milford is insanely good. Additionally, it's not hard to start a club; just find a willing teacher and it can happen.", "It's a good experience, it's just not perfect. I have plenty of gripes but I'm sure as far as high schools go, this isn't a bad one to have spent my years at.", "There are great teachers that care, but it's easy to be screwed over and be given a teacher who doesn't.", 'In my time at NMHS, I learned so much - not only in the classroom while sitting at a desk, but in everything I did with my friends, teachers, and classmates. Whether it be cheering on the football team in the stands on Friday nights or spending time in the courtyard with my friends and the family of ducks that decided to lay eggs there, I had an unforgettable time. The faculty and staff at NMHS are dedicated and hard-working, and although I struggled here and there, they always rooted for me to get back on my feet.', 'The food options at New Milford High School are pretty good. We can make our own wraps and sandwiches. They always have salads out for healthy options.', 'New Milford High School is pretty safe. We have a local officer named Officer Wilde at our school. He usually stays all day. Also, the bullying is strict. Nobody can bully.']

The school is very strict with  attendance and lateness, after so many recurrences they will have after school detention.\xa0The extracurricular opportunities at the High School are great. There is a variety of different clubs such as Video Game Club, Bowling, Cross Country, Swimming, Tennis and Badminton Club.', 'There are a variety of Academic and performing clubs. The Model UN and MockTrial clubs have won State and Regional titles.', 'The variety of activities and courses that are offered allows students to really see what pat they may want to take. The Academies Program allows students to broaden their learning experiences in a safe learning environment with like minded students.', 'The teachers not only care about their students academically, they get to know them and care about them as people.', 'Some are more helpful than others , but I am having a great senior Year !!', 'There has never been a major incident, and generally I feel pretty safe.', "As with all schools, it's here and there in some places, but in some areas New Milford is insanely good. Additionally, it's not hard to start a club; just find a willing teacher and it can happen.", "It's a good experience, it's just not perfect. I have plenty of gripes but I'm sure as far as high schools go, this isn't a bad one to have spent my years at.", "There are great teachers that care, but it's easy to be screwed over and be given a teacher who doesn't.", 'In my time at NMHS, I learned so much - not only in the classroom while sitting at a desk, but in everything I did with my friends, teachers, and classmates. Whether it be cheering on the football team in the stands on Friday nights or spending time in the courtyard with my friends and the family of ducks that decided to lay eggs there, I had an unforgettable time. The faculty and staff at NMHS are dedicated and hard-working, and although I struggled here and there, they always rooted for me to get back on my feet.', 'The food options at New Milford High School are pretty good. We can make our own wraps and sandwiches. They always have salads out for healthy options.', 'New Milford High School is pretty safe. We have a local officer named Officer Wilde at our school. He usually stays all day. Also, the bullying is strict. Nobody can bully.']
column6: ['New Milford High School is very strict on bullying. Almost no one bullies each other thanks to the help of Ms. Zacher. She makes sure no body is being bullied and she is a heart warming person.', "New Milford High School has great school spirit. If you ever visit us the week of spirit week in October, you'll be surprised how many students are wearing the school colors. We have our pep rally and my ear drum actually blew out once.", "Most teachers at New Milford High School are nice. There are a few that aren't the friendliest. However, most of them are approachable and do help their students. They always want to make sure their student is being helped.", 'The extracurricular opportunities at New Milford High School are great. There is a bunch of different clubs such as Video Game Club and Badminton Club.', "This school is unique in many ways but one of the main ways that I see is that we don't have many cliques. Everyone is different and not many are labeled as to what they enjoy doing.", "The food they provide is somewhat healthy but the taste isn't that great.", 'none that I know of', "The school provides great athletic facilities, the only problem is that our town floods a lot and our outdoor fields and sports areas get destroyed. Our school can't afford to keep fixing the things that gets destroyed.", 'Each teacher is different. They all have different teaching styles but they all get the point across.', 'The school provides great opportunities for the student to get involved. The student have the choice if they want to get involved thats the only issue.', 'We do not really have a problem regarding to race and like I mentioned before we have two programs to prevent peer pressure. Most the school and students are very open to acceptance.', 'Many of the teachers at this school, have their own unique way of teaching that gets to each student. I have a lot of personal connections and trust most of my teachers in New Milford High School. They treat us like adults and do not baby us for failure. I love the way the teachers connect with me and be there for me if I need it. Also if I am struggling in their class, they will help me to be successful and understand.', 'Soccer (boys and girls) \r Track and Field (indoor and outdoor) \r Bowling \r Cross Country \r Baseball/Softball\r Swimming \r Golf \r Football \r Cheerleadering \r and more\r Our schools, school spirit is fantastic during our spirit week at school, our sports spirit is not bad we just dont cheer as much as we used to but we are working on get the fans back. \r We have an open gym to all students and there are set days if someone would like to follow a training session.', 'Peer Leadership group\r BUDDY program\r computer programs\r math club\r engineering club\r frisbe club\r sports\r Community service club\r and etc', "The school administration is very prone to dress code, attendance and bullying. In our school Mrs.Zachary is the BUDDY organizer, her helpers and herself do what ever it takes to make sure that the place is a safe home for the kids to be at. The administration is very strict with late children, after 3 the class will count as an appeance and they will have an after school detention. \r The principal wishes to eventaully make the school unified, which includes no competetion between grades, it'll all be one. The pricipal and administration also keep our school strong, and motivate students to do their best. \r Our counselors help push us to to apply to college and to make a better future for ourselves.", 'The cafeteria is a very big space with multiple opportunities to sit with someone new or your own friends. In the cafeteria there are three vending machines, one filled with waters, snapples and an ice cream machine. When deciding what you want to eat there are two sides, the hot side and cold side. They offer the meal of the day which can be anything like panacakes, nachos, pasta, chicken & rice and etc. They also offer salad, sandwichs, pb&js, chicken finger with fries, bagels, muffins, baked chips, drinks, and etc. \r Our school using wheat products for the breads, wraps, pasta and all chips are baked amd smart foods.', "The parents are very involved with all aspects of the school. Its very inspiring to see the participation. I wish the academics and athletics better but I guess for a school this size and not being a regional school, its good. If I had it to do again, I would have encouraged my child to go to Bergen Tech or Academies because they're both have more modern equipment and the buildings are upgraded and cleaner. And also I think my child would have had better college opportunities and options with a higher rated school.", "The halls are not very clean. The lockers are small and old in most parts of the school, some have been replaced. The auditorium has just been renovated but its still small and narrow. The cafeteria has been renovated several times due to flooding as it is at the lowest point of the building. Same goes for the football field, which is in the worst part of the towns flood zone and has been underwater more times than we'd care to remember. Our former principal was a Tech-freak and did everything in his power to get the school up to the new century's technology standards and has had the school on television.", 'They have a good amount of extracurriculars for a school of this size', 'A new principal just came in this year so its hard to say so far. But past years our former principal was a no nonsense guy. In spite of the shabbiness and disrepair of the old classrooms and equipment, the enthusiasm of the entire administration give the students a great respect for challenge and learning.']

column2: ['Secaucus High school was an overall good experience, but there is still room for improvement. There was a lot of drama with Administration, and the school wasn’t very honest with us on what happened. Also, I feel like the school hasn’t done the best job with hiring new teachers. Overall though, we do have a safe environment in this school and the majority of students are friendly and there is rarely any major issues in terms of conflict. I’ve had a decent time at Secaucus High School my past few years, and now it is my final year.', "It's a great school where you study in a great environment with great teachers and students. Of course not all schools are perfect but I wouldn't study in another school if I had a choice. The Secaucus High School is a second home to me. That school has a lot of educational and encouraging clubs that you can join. The teachers are really nice and respectful to students. The students participate in a lot of school activities, sports and clubs. The only thing that I would love this school to have is to have trips to other countries to explore other cultures, see the historic places, try food that you have never eaten before and experience responsibility. Other wise this school is big, classes are clean and nice to learn at.", 'SHS is a school with great opportunity, programs and teachers. Like any public school, trouble or bad influences can be found anywhere, but if you are serious about your academics/sports/art talents, you will find a place to grow and be nourished in SHS', 'This is an absolutely school just about everyone is reasonably friendly. Some of the most devoted and great teachers available anywhere. Truly miss being in high school. Also shout out to Tom the Trainer give him a raise.', "It has a great atmosphere. The sports and academics are great. The only issue is they don't have  as much of a preference on arts.", 'The teachers teach with lots of passion and allow me to understand the topic thoroughly. It is a positive environment where I can achieve my full potential.', 'It’s a good school for the sciences and mathematics, but it’s visual arts program leave something to be desired. A majority of the teachers are top notch educators who truly care about their students. The clubs offer a lot of community service opportunities and allow you to get involved in the community. It’s a good educational institution.', 'Good school, very involved, very local to the city, many things to do, great teachers and location. Very diverse community and involvement is great. Many opportunities.', "Secaucus High School gives one of the best educations that I have seen in any other local public high school. They offer classes for more than a dozen AP's & each class is run by teachers with years of experience with the test. The STEM program allows students to take college-level classes with college credit, taught by some of the best teachers I've ever seen by senior year. Not to mention the school itself is extremely diverse, in an extremely safe neighborhood with a top notch music & play program and various other clubs. It really is a great school!", "Overall, Secaucus High School is a very nice school. A lot of the students and teachers are nice. While the food isn't the best, it is certainly better than the food of other schools I have gone to. They also have counselors ready to help you with most of your problems. They have many classes in the STEM field such as AP Computer Science, Computer Programming, AP Statistics, and more.", "Academically it's a mixed bag since if you're in Honors, AP classes or  STEM  you'll be given full priority to the school but if you're not depending on the person he/she might not be ready for college or the real world.  The teachers, for the most part, try their best. The School Culture is sport dominated especially with the new gym and a good amount of the student population participate in one or more sport. There are different clubs from JSA to SAIL etc.  The one thing I despise about this school is that if you have connections with the Board of Ed or Town that student can get away with everything.  ( favoritism ) Also the Google Chromebooks and smart boards can be very frustrating for the teachers and students when they aren't working.  Finally, the Board of Education Administration isn't clear to the school community at all.", 'Secaucus High School has been very good to me. Although some teachers are not the best, I have appreciated every moment. Most are very helpful want nothing more than to see you succeed and do your best. If I could change anything about the school, I would add better cafeteria options.', "It's safety is highly valuable for me because my sister who studies there has been telling me about the security that goes on inside and outside the campus.", 'My school is diverse and has countless opportunities do be involved. I would like to see change in how the board works, listening to more kids rather than just kids who have well known parents in the school, and less on the favoritism.', 'I really enjoyed attending Secaucus High School. Although, many do not say it was a good overall experience for them, it was a great high school experience for me. I played sports all year around and I loved the sports culture. I was also in a lot of clubs and activities. I graduated in 2016 and the one piece of advice I would have gave was to update and renovate the school grounds and they already took care of it!', "I just graduated from this school not even a couple days ago. There is so many things wrong. 1st thing, don't come here if you don't have anyone that works for the town or don't have any privilage. i never felt more left out in my life. 2nd thing, they fired the best thing that happened for SHS, DR.BOB. i hope he comes back and fixes everything. 3rd thing, they really need to be more strict about the juul situation, THERES A FREAKING JUUL LOUNGE. so overall, its an okay school but will not sent my future children here EVER.", 'SHS does not offer as much as they claim.  The school is not as great as it once was.  They do not offer the dual enrollment program that many other high schools in NJ have.  The students can not graduate with an associates like other high schools in NJ offer. The guidance counselors need to have the knowledge to guide students on the correct path for college, in particular the students in the 2 academies the school has to offer.', 'It’s amazing I’ve had a great couple of years here The teachers are great Faculty is goodEnvironment is good', 'I loved the principal, Dr. Bob. Dr. Bob was a principal that made it his mission to know every students name and always greet them everyday. Anytime I needed something, I could count on him to be there for me. Most of the teachers there go out of their way to teach kids and make connections with them to help get the lesson taught to them.', "My experience at Secaucus High was wonderful, I've met and became friends with people who i never thought I'd get along with. The teachers/guidance counselors are amazing and were very helpful when it came to applying for colleges. The students are very enthusiastic especially when it comes to spirit week ."]

The teachers/guidance counselors are amazing and were very helpful when it came to applying for colleges. The students are very enthusiastic especially when it comes to spirit week ."]
column6: ["My experience attending and graduating from Secaucus High School will forever remain special in my eyes and in my heart. I've made so many memories and was provided with an abundance of opportunities to really come out of my shell and become part of something larger. The school is so family and team-oriented, the principal knows almost everyone by first name. Every teacher you greet has your success in their best interest. I couldn't have asked for a more transformative high school experience.", 'I have been in Secaucus High School all four years.  I find it to be an ok school.  The teachers are really nice and the building is beautiful now with the extensions  However the class options are not all that great.  They are very focused on academics which is a good thing but not everyone is a brainiack.  I think that more life skills classes should be offered they would benefit everyone.  Where as the other classes only benefit the smart kids.', 'My experience in this high school was pleasant, and it did well in preparing me and my peers for college.', "Secaucus High School has provided me with ample opportunity to become more involved in the STEM Field by accepting me into the school's STEM Academy. I was able to advance in different math and science classes, including an engineering class, that have allowed me to realize my passion for these fields. ", 'Very diverse. The most  popular club is JSA. It is nationally recognized. We also have a national charter for People to People  international. We have are own community based organization called Wrap with a Smile which works hand in hand with the town for bank. We have literary pieces that are published into its on book. Art club which Creates many of its projects through ceramics and pictures of both the color and black and white variety. We have a concert band as well as a jazz band. Chorus for the songs birds  These are just a few things that will keep you busy for four years.', 'My overall experience has been awesome so far and I look forward to my senior year. We are a very small high school, we have maybe 500 students in grades 9-12. This allows you to know everyone by either name or facial recognition. It allows you to pursue not only your academic interests but also your scholastic interest. For example, I am able to play three sports and still be in chorus and band. Our school is very community oriented. We actually still celebrate Arbor day by planting trees, earth day by building bird houses and performances for our veterans service and our seniors during the holidays season.\r If I had to do it all over again, I would choose Secaucus High School because of its diversity in the classroom, on playing field, its richness in clubs and the support you receive from thru community.', 'All teachers know who you are and have some idea of what your interests are inside and outside of school. They support the student body attending and hosting many after school functions. From sports, to the arts, to academic clubs. There is something for everyone to get involved in and its because the teachers are willing to devote their time and effort.', 'Many teachers go above and beyond. But there are a few that show favoritism towards certain students. Other than that the teachers are very knowledgeable and help us as students achieve our best.', "The security is very good in our school for people the security guard and police officer don't recognize, but students simply could, theoretically, walk in with a lethal weapon,", "There are really only a few extracurricular activities worth mentioning. Our JSA chapter is one of best in the North/Sounthaast and a model for chapters around the country. It's very easy to become absorbed and to interact with many students in our extensive area to discuss regional and national political issues.", 'I really enjoyed my stay at this school for the education and small tight-knit community since the school is very small. The only issue I really had is with the administration. The principal is in his delusional little world, hypocritically preaching god knows what about peacemaking and bullying. There are also very few freedoms in this school as a student', 'The teachers I received being in the STEM Academy were for honors classes and were of the utmost quality. As regards to my non-honor counterparts, they did not receieve the same quality. In fact, I felt as many of the regular teachers gave no effort in their classroom. But I also felt that I had the best education possible through my Academy teachers.', 'Overall decent. The school lacks technology.', 'There are man safe policies at my school, especially with recent stories in the news about school shootings and terrorist attacks. The principal is trying to do everything in his power in order to ensure our safety, which I commend him for. I do like that he is taking the initiative, and is now making the students as well as the faculty wear IDs. Also, we have been having multiple lock down drills to ensure that everyone knows that it can be a very serious thing, and one day it might not be just a drill. Health programs are fine as well. I do not get sick too often, though I know that the nurse is doing her job and that is all that students could ask for.', "There are many extracurricular activities in our school, for many different interests. There is a book club, or book lovers, or a newspaper club, for people who love to write. There are many more, which enable students to become active in school and in the community, opening doors for individuals that may have certain interests. The school does offer many clubs and organizations, though depending on who they are, people just aren't willing to go to the meetings. Unless you are set on joining a certain club, people usually stop going to club meetings within 2 weeks. That is the only issue I see with the clubs that are in Secaucus High School.", 'The reason I like Secaucus High School, is because of how close-knit, not only the school is, but the community as well. The town is so small you may see anyone you know right around the corner. Secaucus High School has become a safe space for my friends and I, ensuring that we get a great education as well as allow us participate in activities that may be of interest. Even though it may be a small town, there is an unlimited amount of sports and extracurricular activities to do for students in the town of Secaucus. The education aspect, may not be the best, though Secaucus High School is a patriotic, loving educational facility that focuses on all aspects of what makes a great school.', 'There are many teachers that are very knowledgeable in a certain topic, though others may not have the best credentials, or knowledge to teach certain classes. For example, my AP Biology course is not being taught, by someone I believe is capable of doing so, so it is mostly self-study in that class. Though for AP Calculus, there may be a heavy workload, however my teacher works to her fullest potential to ensure that everyone stays on top of the work and understands what she is teaching. It depends on certain subjects, and the way certain teachers teach it, however overall the teachers deeply care about the students and always try their best to ensure they are getting a good education.', 'I loved high school and I am glad I graduated from there. I know that not everyone felt this way and some kids who probably felt left out would say it was clique-ish. I must disagree with that, I love my friends and I was friends with everyone , whenever a new student came we would make them feel welcomed.', 'Its okay if you just want to get through High School.', 'The clubs and organizations offered at my school are very supportive. The teachers and administration is always involved, especially the school government organization I participate in, JSA. The administrator their devotes most, if not, all of his time and money to the events we partake in. The sports clubs my school also offers are some of the very best. The students are always motivated and know they have chances at winning their games.']
column8: ['Peer pressure, bullying, etc. are prevalent, but not very prevalent. Teachers usually pretend not to hear a lot of things.', 'Not many students are inclined to participate in clubs, so there are not many.', 'The football team is unjustly glorified and nearly all other sports are neglected.', 'Like I said before, I received average preparation for continuing to college. It was not until mid-college that I finally started to take purposeful and concrete steps toward accomplishing my future career goals.', 'The teachers at this school are average at best. Much can be done to create fun and interactive lesson plans, but many teachers opt decide to stick with reading from powerpoints or a book with little to no class discussion.', 'Most classrooms and common areas are fine, although the student bathrooms and other mostly non-visited areas are deplorable.', 'My experience at Secaucus High was okay, they are very strict and thus take away the fun of being at school with your friends.', 'Most teachers are not very engaging, a select few go above and beyond the needed effort.', "I would rate the school's athletic program average. The health and physical education programs are sub par in my opinion.", "The technological resources are almost completely useless. All computers on the school's network are so restricted via the firewall that it becomes very annoying on a daily basis in COMPUTER based classes. Not to mention the majority of computers and related technology are outdated.", "I don't eat school lunch, I bring my own.", 'Its okay, we should be able to speak our minds more', 'art and music in kind of ignored', "I personally don't attend school sports functions seeing as i have no interest in them. However, since our school is a majority of sports teams, most of the other student show a healthy interest.", "we don't usually have problems with enforcement in the school", "A large majority of after school programs are only sports. If you aren't in sports, the school basically doesn't offer much.", 'regulations are, at times "over-enforeced"', 'Friendly, but the school is completely made up of cliques.', 'Other than the strenuous work load and competition between students, the school offers many oportunities that I am grateful for. ', 'There is a uniform policy which I feel sometimes is a little ridiculous. I feel what does it matter if I wear blue pants or black so long as I behave and respect others. I think taking time away from class to be sent to the office for not wearing the correct color pant is a wast.']

column2: ['The diversity within this school district is the best aspect it offers, as it is the most diverse High School in New Jersey. From conversing with individuals that differ from myself, I was able to gain a vast amount of information about different cultures and points of views. The array of students leads to various clubs offered at the school welcome to all individuals with the purpose of broadening knowledge. Along with clubs, there are many sports teams offered at the school. The spirit that the students have during sporting events shows their love for this community. One of our cheers start off with "It\'s great to be from West Orange" and this cheer gets everyone in the crowd very excited. Besides the catchy words that go along with the cheer, the meaning behind it is the main cause for the excitement. West Orange High School is an amazing place to fulfill your academic and social needs. I am so blessed and proud to be a part of this amazing community.', 'My experience at West Orange High School has overall been pretty good.  This is because of the friends I made, the courses and extracurriculars offered here and that I participated in.   Although I do not want to be a music major, I participated in many clubs such as marching band that not only strengthened my music ability, but my social skills.  So this shows how I am able to participate in any activity that I want to, even if I do not go into that major.  I also learned a foreign language which is helpful for me in the future, which is welcomed in this school.  Finally, the diversity in this school is phenomenal, and unlike any other school.', 'I like the many ethnicities that were present through the school. There are also many different activities to join and participate in school. West Orangeś academics are also very good and there is also extra help for those who need it.', "There are some positives and negatives of going to West Orange High School. There are constant issues such as CO2 levels rising in the building, gas leaks, and water diseases. Yet these issues are mostly solved with ease, and quickly, but they are still there. The teachers in the school are helpful and aware of students' needs. They are able to evaluate the needs of the students and assign homework based on them. Some people are toxic in school, yet they are able to get their job done and put the goals in the hands of the better good.", "We LOVE WOHS, with two kids currently attending. The best principal in the world, with  a new fabulous superintendent. The Cross Country and Track team is phenomenal, as are the music and language programs. The school itself is a bit dated, but environmental quality tests are up to date. We couldn't recommend West Orange as a place to live (taxes are ever increasing, and the township is not keen on environmental/sustainability practices) - feels a bit like a Soprano state! People moving into town are great, though!", "I have had a great experience. People generally get along well with one another, and I have witnessed very few instances of bullying. It is such a huge school that it's easy to avoid people you don't like, anyway. The school is well-equipped with a woodshop, autoshop, a fleet of 3D printers, and a laser cutter. Whatever you like, there is a class or club for it. There are so many opportunities to succeed at WOHS!", 'The teachers and staff are very nice and friendly. The diversity in the school is great, getting a very large mix of different cultures and people.', 'This is honestly a great school and a very nice community where everyone feel safe and excited to learn in order to grow together', "I like the landscape of the school. There is a wide variety of extracurricular activities for students to choose from. Most of the faculty are friendly and approachable. The teachers truly care about their students and it shows through their dedication to their success. The guidance counselors are very hands-on and aim to help students as much as possible. The student population is diverse. The school prides itself on the students' academic and athletic achievements.", "It was just high school. Nothing exciting. We, students go there to learn through the various diverse academic courses. The courses are amazing and the teachers are pretty great for the most part. The school has established different small learning programs that cater to a child's interest or needs. I think one of the parts about the school is the amount of diversity that the school has.", 'I moved to West Orange in 5th grade. At first, I was very nervous as any 5th grader would be because it was a very new environment to me. The town I came from was less fortunate compared to West Orange, where the academics, safety, and diversity couldn’t compare. As I entered the high school, I encountered an experience never felt before. The amount of diversity and success that occurred in the high school was inspiring. I am apart of the arts department, and seeing all the creativity happen in front of my eyes was something that made my experience memorable. Not to mention the fact that the majority of our school was in at least one honors class, showing that we are all very hardworking. There were also many clubs one could express themselves through from journalism to GSA. The fact that we were allowed to be ourselves and express ourselves truly made my high school experience one I can never forget.', 'My experience when I was in West Orange high school was amazing. Starting from freshmen year and graduating was years of lots of experience. They really tried to help you throughout your school year so you know exactly what you want to do and which path to take in order to reach your goal.', 'The diversity at this school is like no other. That is something I will truly miss.  I feel like the religious, racial, and economic diversity among the students and staff is what makes this school so great.', 'The school was ok they knew how to separate everyone based on mental ability. The curriculum was ok. Since I was diagnosed with ADHD I was not allowed to participate in certain classes, because they already assumed they knew my mental capabilities that was not fair. They did not know how to prepare a student with mental disabilities for college and I was recommended to not take the SAT.', 'West Orange isn’t much different than any other high school. But, what I do like about it the most is how much diversity there is in the student body. It’s academics are standard, not being absolutely amazing, but not being poor either. Overall, it’s a nice school and I’ve had a good experience here so far.', "The qualities that are great about West Orange High School are the diversity in the student and teacher populations, the positive environment, the teachers care about their students and even give them words of wisdom about decisions and life. The one thing the school should do to improve is update the building's infrastucture.", 'I have hada very good experience at West Orange High School. I just wish there was more school spirit.', 'Well-rounded high school offering excellence in everything: Academics, Music & the Arts, Sports, Diversity.  Teachers really care.  Amazing Marching Band, and close proximity to NYC is a cultural plus.', "West Orange high school is a very diverse school. In all my 3 years in this high school i never got to a point where i felt like i was being discrimminated from anything due to the color of my skin. When you first go in the highschool, it isn't hard to get comfoirtable because everyone well most of them are nice and welcoming to you.", 'The education given to the students here are excellent. The teachers are very caring and provide the best for their students. Athletics here are strong and accomplish many goals every year. The school is very diverse with many cultures and nationalities.']

column6: ['The people you meet are rememberable because those memories of high school are going to come back in later years. The school spirit as well is high.', 'My experience in high school was average; during my freshman and sophomore year I went to games, participated in clubs, and hung out with the many new friends I made. As the year progressed, I became more private and reserved to improve my skills and focus on school. As I exited the "mix" of things I began to notice things about the school system that was unfair. I began to lose respect for the school and feel unsafe. I was in an incident one day where an alternative school student pushed and punched me, and after defending myself I was punished and blamed. My family was angry at the "solution" they came up with the way the situation was minimized.', 'The thing that I liked most about West Orange High School is that they are aiming to challenge you because they know that college will be more difficult than high school. I think that they are doing a great job with preparing the students, including myself, for the competitive and difficult world of college. The classes such as advanced placement helps us prepare for the rigorous world of college.', 'I love the diversity that is at West Orange. The teachers at the school are always no nice and willing to help with anything you need. I love how the principal always interacts with us students and knows almost all of our names. If I had to change one thing it would be for the school to have more school spirit. Overall it is a wonderful place to be.', 'Great school. Teachers are great. I believe that they are great regarding college readiness, but I may be biased. I am speaking from the perspective of an honors and AP student. I believe that those teachers have effectively prepared me for college and the world.', 'The school is very diverse. Also, our curriculum is rigorous and challenges us as students to work to our full potential.', 'West Orange High School is a very diverse school with ample opportunity for all students with the immense sports programs and clubs as well as academic support. The school is the only public high school in west orange, therefore there are a lot of students which makes bigger classes and not as intimate as an evironment as some may prefer but the school is very supportive in helping the students succeed, post-graduation.', 'My time at West Orange High School is absolutely incredible because I got to meet a bunch of friendly people and got to experience things I might not have been able to at other school districts. One thing I would change is allow for better technology into the curriculum.', "Now that I'm in college it has become evident that the HS doesn't prepare the students for the rigorous college academics. Perhaps it should focus on the entire student body and not just the 5% that it gives it attention. It pretty much failed the remaining 95%.", 'West Orange High School is composed of an extremely diverse population in all senses of the word. The school is extremely large, with close to two thousand five hundred students attending. The school is well run with a good principal and decent teachers depending on the subject area.', "It's a nice school if you have been in West Orange for a while. But students are not welcoming of new students. Also students gossip more than the usual. Otherwise the school is pretty good has great classes etc.", 'I have really enjoyed my time at West Orange High School. I am fortunate to live in a town that has as much diversity as West Orange does. Not only is West Orange High School diverse among its student population, but it is also diverse in the opportunities that it provides for its students. There are extracurricular activities and school course selections for a wide range of interests. For instance, there are health related courses and clubs as well as cooking related courses and clubs. West Orange High School does an excellent job at allowing each student the opportunity to excel.', 'I genuinely enjoy my time at West Orange. I like the wide variety of sports and clubs that are available for the students to join. The students are also very diverse and accepting of different cultures. However, I would like to see more of an effort to have students be kinder to students with disabilities or disorders, such as autism.', 'I have been attending West Orange High School for four years.The administration is very strict and stress the rules for our safety.Our programs after school are phenomenal, students are involved with the sports, theater, music, political, and entertainment programs. Academically there are an abundant amount of classes to take along with multiple advance classes.West Orange is very diverse, the families are very involved in all activities taking place in and outside the school. The safety of our students are a priority, all doors in our school have a ID swipe to get in, along with all doors have alarms from the inside, if opened it will be activated. Within the school are eight security guards and a police officer.At all times students, visitors and facility wear Ids and if not will be guided to security for one or exited from the building.West Orange High School are a family of Mountaineers!', 'Overall the diversity of the school is flourishing. However, there is also a social  divide between students. Students tend to be very exclusive, thus creating an even bigger lack in general school spirit.', "I enjoyed attending West Orange High School for all 4 years. I love how extremely diverse the students are which teaches everyone a lot. It definitely exposes students and staff to a variety of unique and beautiful cultures. I also love how every student has a Chromebook. Chromebooks are extremely beneficial to those who cannot afford a computer. It makes students' lives so much easier as they can easily research and complete assignments at home. There is also a huge library with many computers and printers in which students can use at any time. The administration could be unreasonable at times and the safety in school can and should definitely be improved. There are so many clubs and activities to join at West Orange High School so there is always something to do! Some teachers are absolutely amazing and completely engaged with students while others are boring and seem not to care.", "Great teachers and classes. Wouldn't mind more science related class. Also would prefer more freedom in terms of more doors being unlocked and being able to walk out of school for lunch.", 'The schools is a very nice school. The buildings are nice, big and clean. They keep them up to date for the most part. Teachers are okay, some are out of pocket and try to do a little to much in the sense of like being in students business.', 'WOHS had a lot of resources, they just had to be searched for a little bit more for some kids than others.', 'I like the diversity and the activities they have. The teachers are very kind and helpful. The academics is very good, teachers know how to teach.']

column2: ["Saunders provides many opportunities to it's students however, the disconnection between faculty and students hinder many students.", "I have spent four years in this school and learned a lot from a multitude of experiences. As an incoming freshman, I remember the first day of school jitters and the nervousness I felt. I was alone trying to find my way amongst many others. I battled with social anxiety yet I slowly overcome each obstacle as I grew older. I ended the year on a good note looking forward to the summer. Come sophomore year, I enjoyed it much better than the last year and learned to put myself out there. I made friends, excelled in all my classes and made the best of school. Junior year was actually tough and opened my eyes to the many responsibilities I had coming. I learned the importance of time management, hard work and college. Now I have reached senior year where I'm faced with said responsibility along with thinking about college and my future. It's amazing that four years flew by and though no school is perfect, this will be a part of my memories.", "I like my Automotive class. The people are great, and the teachers are funny. in the past 4 years I've made great memories.", 'The things Id like to see change at Saunders High School in the future is the lack of security. improvement on facility.', 'Throughout my experience at Saunders High School I enjoyed the rarity of having our magnet programs. The opportunity to gain skills within our magnets is not something that is common within schools around the area (Yonkers), so it is very nice to have the chance. If there was something I would change it would most likely be the participation of school spirit, including having more events to celebrate the school.', 'At Saunders Trades and Technical high school, I had many extraordinary experiences, I met such a large number of incredible individuals in the school. The instructors are astonishing and they help out with everything. Well the hospitality here isn\'t up to par, contrary to a five star inn. We are constrained to our school supplies since we don\'t generally get funding. Our school offers us a surplus of chances, for example, our magnets. Our magnets enables us to do what we adore and we improved soft and hard skills. We had a safety issue when they moved the enormous lunch tables and cones to hinder and obstruct the ways out. Due to the "one at a time" rule, we are forced to restrain ourselves from soiling our wears. Which is irritating in light of the fact that you\'re missing a lot of class time.', 'Overall I enjoyed my 4 years. It was a great experience and the saunders family will be in my heart forever.', "Attending Saunders High School was a great experience for me. I got a chance to meet amazing friends who I still love to this day. Saunders really paved the path for me to attend college and build myself a foundation. The resources they have there is great, especially the YPIE program which prepared me throughout the years. The staff at Saunders is filled with humble and caring people who will do the most for their students. Saunders is a family all about community. I loved my time here and I don't regret anything. I couldn't have been the person I am today without the experience I gained from Saunders High School.", 'What I like about Saunders is the academics the school has. When I first debuted in the school I was not really sure how my four years will turn out and now that I am a senior I can say now that I cannot believe I made it this far. I passed all my classes and regents with no problems because no matter how difficult some classes were I kept giving it my all, I did not give up, and I always stayed on task.', 'Most of the teachers were very engaging and helpful. They make sure all their students are getting the attention that they needed. I would like to see some of the more restrictive school policies change that were put into place by new administration.', 'Saunders is a great place to discover what you would like to study in college or pursue as a career. There are many opportunities offered by the administration to progress their standings in school.', 'I enjoyed the amount of different classes they provide. I would like to see more parents involved in school activities.', 'The teachers at Saunders Trades & Technical High School are always there. They will prepare you well for the future that you will hold. The faculty and staff always inspired the students to do the best.', 'After going here for years I can safely say that this is an amazing school for those who want to pursue a career in a hands on trade! Great education at a low cost!', "Saunders is a great school that offers something that most schools don't. They teach trades and technical majors for the student. So in the four years, I've been there I have studied architecture. It is with this that motivated me to further pursue it as a career. There are many other options that school offers from carpentry to culinary. The faculty and staff are some of the greatest people I've met, showing kindness and compassion, but they also care about the success of their students.", 'Saunders is a great school with a great amount of resources your child can take advantage of. I am currently a senior student and enjoy my time here. Although, I would advise your child to take interest in a trade that he/she genuinely enjoys theirself. Doing this would make your experience in this school far enjoyable and worth more.', 'My Experience at Saunders HS was the best. You have staff that actually care about you and how you are doing in school my 4 yrs of HS at Saunders HS was amazing my experience I wouldn’t change anything at', 'I am now graduating from Saunders. I can say that these years were very worth sticking with. I can say that although I did not do everything I dreamt of doing at the start- it was still a fun ride. The faculty are honestly the most diverse Ive ever handled. Theyre funny, wity and also clever at making assignments challenging; which is always great in life. In order to improve one must face obstacles to climb over.There will be people that will put you down with mediocrity- but its awesome when you rise above it and show them that you are deaf to the lies and open to the truth of success! I enjoyed Saunders and I recommend it to all incoming students. #UseYourSkills&Talents2SHINE', 'What makes Saunders High SchoolDifferent from other schools is that we have a magnet system. This gives students the opportunity to study their choose of feild. The school provides Architecture, Bio Chemistry, ECC, HVAC, Carpentry, Cosmotology, Fashion, Automotive Technology, and Graphic Design Drawing. The magnet that I choose for my high school experience was Architecture. I  say that coming in as a freshman never did I nor my classmates intend/expect to create such a tight bond with our magnet class. I believe that the relationships built in architecture are some that will last a lifetime. The feeling of family created in my magnet has been the best part of Saunders. I am president of the Christian club, a cheerleader, secretary of Hispanic Club, a member of Welness Club and also Poetry club. After school activities are always there. I don’t like that the security is not that secure. The district also fails to give us money for different kinds of programs and supplies.', 'It was the best decision I made. I met so many people with a passion to succeed. I love it here so much.']
column4: ["Saunders provides many opportunities to it's students however, the disconnection between faculty and students hinder many students.", "I have spent four years in this school and learned a lot from a multitude of experiences. As an incoming freshman, I remember the first day of school jitters and the nervousness I felt. I was alone trying to find my way amongst many others. I battled with social anxiety yet I slowly overcome each obstacle as I grew older. I ended the year on a good note looking forward to the summer. Come sophomore year, I enjoyed it much better than the last year and learned to put myself out there. I made friends, excelled in all my classes and made the best of school. Junior year was actually tough and opened my eyes to the many responsibilities I had coming. I learned the importance of time management, hard work and college. Now I have reached senior year where I'm faced with said responsibility along with thinking about college and my future. It's amazing that four years flew by and though no school is perfect, this will be a part of my memories.", "I like my Automotive class. The people are great, and the teachers are funny. in the past 4 years I've made great memories.", 'The things Id like to see change at Saunders High School in the future is the lack of security. improvement on facility.', 'Throughout my experience at Saunders High School I enjoyed the rarity of having our magnet programs. The opportunity to gain skills within our magnets is not something that is common within schools around the area (Yonkers), so it is very nice to have the chance. If there was something I would change it would most likely be the participation of school spirit, including having more events to celebrate the school.', 'At Saunders Trades and Technical high school, I had many extraordinary experiences, I met such a large number of incredible individuals in the school. The instructors are astonishing and they help out with everything. Well the hospitality here isn\'t up to par, contrary to a five star inn. We are constrained to our school supplies since we don\'t generally get funding. Our school offers us a surplus of chances, for example, our magnets. Our magnets enables us to do what we adore and we improved soft and hard skills. We had a safety issue when they moved the enormous lunch tables and cones to hinder and obstruct the ways out. Due to the "one at a time" rule, we are forced to restrain ourselves from soiling our wears. Which is irritating in light of the fact that you\'re missing a lot of class time.', 'Overall I enjoyed my 4 years. It was a great experience and the saunders family will be in my heart forever.', "Attending Saunders High School was a great experience for me. I got a chance to meet amazing friends who I still love to this day. Saunders really paved the path for me to attend college and build myself a foundation. The resources they have there is great, especially the YPIE program which prepared me throughout the years. The staff at Saunders is filled with humble and caring people who will do the most for their students. Saunders is a family all about community. I loved my time here and I don't regret anything. I couldn't have been the person I am today without the experience I gained from Saunders High School.", 'What I like about Saunders is the academics the school has. When I first debuted in the school I was not really sure how my four years will turn out and now that I am a senior I can say now that I cannot believe I made it this far. I passed all my classes and regents with no problems because no matter how difficult some classes were I kept giving it my all, I did not give up, and I always stayed on task.', 'Most of the teachers were very engaging and helpful. They make sure all their students are getting the attention that they needed. I would like to see some of the more restrictive school policies change that were put into place by new administration.', 'Saunders is a great place to discover what you would like to study in college or pursue as a career. There are many opportunities offered by the administration to progress their standings in school.', 'I enjoyed the amount of different classes they provide. I would like to see more parents involved in school activities.', 'The teachers at Saunders Trades & Technical High School are always there. They will prepare you well for the future that you will hold. The faculty and staff always inspired the students to do the best.', 'After going here for years I can safely say that this is an amazing school for those who want to pursue a career in a hands on trade! Great education at a low cost!', "Saunders is a great school that offers something that most schools don't. They teach trades and technical majors for the student. So in the four years, I've been there I have studied architecture. It is with this that motivated me to further pursue it as a career. There are many other options that school offers from carpentry to culinary. The faculty and staff are some of the greatest people I've met, showing kindness and compassion, but they also care about the success of their students.", 'Saunders is a great school with a great amount of resources your child can take advantage of. I am currently a senior student and enjoy my time here. Although, I would advise your child to take interest in a trade that he/she genuinely enjoys theirself. Doing this would make your experience in this school far enjoyable and worth more.', 'My Experience at Saunders HS was the best. You have staff that actually care about you and how you are doing in school my 4 yrs of HS at Saunders HS was amazing my experience I wouldn’t change anything at', 'I am now graduating from Saunders. I can say that these years were very worth sticking with. I can say that although I did not do everything I dreamt of doing at the start- it was still a fun ride. The faculty are honestly the most diverse Ive ever handled. Theyre funny, wity and also clever at making assignments challenging; which is always great in life. In order to improve one must face obstacles to climb over.There will be people that will put you down with mediocrity- but its awesome when you rise above it and show them that you are deaf to the lies and open to the truth of success! I  say that coming in as a freshman never did I nor my classmates intend/expect to create such a tight bond with our magnet class. I don’t like that the security is not that secure. The district also fails to give us money for different kinds of programs and supplies.', 'It was the best decision I made. I met so many people with a passion to succeed. I love it here so much.']
column6: ['I enjoy attending Saunders. I enjoyed being a part of my cosmo college. Saunders helped prepare me for college too.', "After spending 4 years in the school I can say that it gives the tools for success. However, its not the easiest in giving these tools, a student needs to reach out and get them. Leaving many kids not giving it their best. Slowly affecting those that are trying to feel like people don't care.", 'Saunders High School is good choice if you live in the Yonkers Public School District. With a variety of makors to choose from and lots of diversity, it was an excellent place to attain my high school diploma. I graduated with 4 years and am now attending a 4 year college that is suited to my financial needs. If you’re thinking about attending Saunders, you won’t regret it!', 'Loved it it made me feel at home I made friends and felt comfortable always.        I was always happy there', 'If you find a magnet that interests you, this school gives you excellent an preparation.  If you continue your studies in your magnet, you will find that you are light years ahead of  others applying to college in your field.', 'I love Saunders as a Cosmo student. The teachers are so dedicated. I am going to graduate with my 1,000 hrs that are needed and be able to take the state boards and have a career. Years ago when my mom was a student at Saunders 9th grade was a exploring yr. Each magnet the student would be in for 2 wks than move on to the next magnet. I think they should bring that back this way the students get to see how each magnet is and can have a better understanding of the Magnet and choosing one instead of going through your freshman yr and changing into a different one if there was room.', "I am a current junior majoring in Architecture, and although I don't admit this often, I do love Saunders. I love the people and variety of people that surround me. The majority of teachers have the student's best interest at heart and are always available to help or stay after school. Academically, there is a limited amount of AP classes, but there are multiple college-link classes with Westchester Community College and Farmingdale State College. You also grow  to love everyone in your major. Saunders feels like family over time.", "I had a great time at Saunders. I loved and cherish the time I spend at this school. Ms. Barnes was such an amazing teacher; she taught me more than just patterns and draping, but to stand up for myself and to use my voice. They have a lot of other awesome teachers as well. Ms. Malik is the most hard working assistant principle I have ever seen, she is really involved with the students. She is always there, knows everyones name, and really helps take you places you never thought of.  My four years in Saunders weren't perfect, but I enjoyed them and will be eternally grateful for all I learned.", "As a trades & technical school, Saunders offers a unique learning environment when compared to a typical high school. Students may enroll in a specific major such as Graphic Design, Bio-Chem Technology, Architecture, Electronics &  Computer Circuitry (ECC), Cosmetology, or Automotive Tech among others. You're with the same 30 people or so for 3 periods a year each year after freshman year - freshman year it's only one period a day. The majors let you explore a field of interest and provide a thorough idea of what it would be like to pursue a career or continue studying in that area. Administration sucks, they're awful. The principal and some ap's act like it's some sort of prison. Overall teachers are good, although, I question how some of them even became teachers at all. I'd like to see the administration change, they're horrible", 'My four years have quickly came to a end and I\'m glad to say Saunders Trades & Technical High School has got to be the most "family oriented" school in yonkers!The staff are extremely supportive and always motivate their students to over achieve and never settle for the very minimum. I\'ve participated in some amazing events I only drempt of being apart of. The school overall is a bully-free zone and the students are just as friendly.', 'I enjoyed my time at Saunders learned a lot in my trade and went on to the culinary institute of America and will be graduating in a week from college.', 'i liked going to saunders. They provided a lot of resources that helped me be able to get into college such as an essay building program called " Essay Busters" that helped build my applications and had free one on one SAT tutoring over the summer which helped me when i took the SATs. I think the education could of been better. The school itself did not have as much extracurricular activities as that of high schools in other areas, but thats partially due to the lack of money the Yonkers School District have been getting. The school was a trade and tech school that focused on magnets containing fashion, biochemistry, carpentry etc. and allowed students to gain a greater understanding of each course before deciding to go into college.', "This school is not like regular high schools, it has trades. For example, during my time at this school, I studied architecture, one of many trades this school offers. Others are automotive, bio-chemistry, culinary, fashion, etc. I can, without a doubt, say this school prepared me for what I wanted to study in college, architecture. During the months of each year at this school, us architecture students were assigned to design a park as sophomores, a house as juniors, and commercial buildings as seniors. By the time I got to college, I already felt like I was ahead of the game. Some of my peers in college were learning the material and drafting techniques for the first time ever. Students graduate from here learning much more and with the school spirit this school has, students really feel like they're a part of something bigger. From my experience, I wouldn't change a thing.", 'My experience was great at Saunders. I am currently a senior and I have had the best 3 1/2 years of my life. The students and staff are great. They work with you as much as they can to make sure you have everything you need to succeed. ', 'The school is great all around. The students and staff feel like family. The staff are very involved in helping students succeed. Definitely  a school that prepares students for higher education. ', 'My experience in Saunders trade and technical high school was amazing. In this high school you will always feel safe and comfortable. There are so many incredible teachers that you can get along with. They also great at teaching you and preparing you for regents ', "My parents personally weren't involved in school functions. There were a majority who did, mostly in sports. Sports played a big role in my high school. A lot of children were involved in them so that's where I saw the most involvement", 'The teachers very in Saunders. Some have excelled in their career and decided that they would like to teach afterwards. It is a school which is involves majors, therefore I believe the major teachers work the hardest considering they have to work with different grades 3 periods a day', 'There are many different types of clubs such as key club, Unicef, asian club, latino club and more.', 'My school is unique because it is the only trade and technical school and it is one of the top rated schools in Yonkers']
