column2: ["CPEHS is an okay school.....it isn't the best, but it definitely helped me obtain numerous programs considering their alliance with College Board Initiative (CBI), Girls Inc. , College Now Courses, Minds Matter, SEO Scholars, OppNet, etc. :)", "I felt that I didn't get the help I really needed throughout the years that I was attending the school.", 'I was a transfer student so I started attending Central Park East High School during my sophomore year. I was scared that transitioning from one school to another was going to be difficult. However, my first days in CPEHS was the total opposite. I began making friends right away and transitioning from one class to another class was very easy. One thing I would like to see more is probably more college counselors because as of now, there is only 1 main college counselor and I know how stressful that can be for both the students as well as the college counselor.', 'These past four years have been amazing here at CPEHS. It is academically challenging and full of supportive and compassionate staff. All the teachers here actually care about each individual student and it shows.', 'Central Park East fosters an environment where all students are capable of doing well with the rigor of the courses this high school has to offer. Central Park East has over 5 AP courses available for students to take, which prepares them for college level courses they will take in the future.', 'Central Park east high school is a great school the teachers are very supportive and want you to do your best in life. But could use more funding in the school.', 'It has a diverse class which whom you can make interactions and learn new things whether it’s about a culture or beliefs. It provides AP courses and college classes that can be transferred to your college when you graduate.', 'I like how Central Park East is a small school. This allows us ( the students) to build a close bond with administration and the teachers. Students are able to feel at home and feel safe in this school and that’s something I’ll always love about it.', 'I really enjoy going to this school, I live in the Bronx and the travel time is not that bad and I always get to school on time. There is many things to do around the area in case I want to hang out after school with my friends.', "When I first found out I was going to this school, I cried tears of despair as I had forgotten that I had even applied. As a class of 2019 senior, I look at that moment somewhat fondly as my experiences completely contradicted my negative expectations. Although a bit crowded and with some students who may not be the most motivated, the school is a diamond in the rough. With motivated teachers and staff, a plethora of college resources and support, and a tight-knit community, CPEHS provided me with an enriching high school experience that I don't regret in the slightest. The only potential downside is the crowded hallways and the, well, developing academic mentality amongst the students.", 'I really liked the support that many teachers provide. I felt safe in this school because security is always around. I just wish to see more art classes and programs in the school.', "The teachers are okay and you'll learn as long as you do the work but the kids are different and I MEAN IT! They do waayyy too much.", 'It was a great experience with teachers that are interested in seeing you succeed. The overall culture of the school is nice and comforting especially if you are opened minded.', 'I enjoyed the atmosphere. When I attended the school was beginning to offer more challenging classes, which prepared me for harder coursework in college.', 'CPEHS is a great small high school where us students get a lot of support from the very start so that we can be successful in high school and be prepared for college. It’s very rare to see fights at the school and the environment is very nice and friendly.', 'It’s a great small school in which students and staff are able to build a strong community. Students are given the resources needed to prepare themselves for college and I can honestly say I made a great choice in selecting this school.', 'Central Park East is a great high school. Though it’s small and not extremely diverse, it has a lot to offer to kids. They are all about college readiness. The college readiness I went through in Central Park East prepared me for college.', 'Has a great college acceptance rate and lots of teachers who dedicate their time to students. Lots of sports conjoined with other schools and clubs/activities to join. The administration is very caring and caters to the needs of both parents and students very well. No fights at all. No dress code, no metal detectors, and school starts at 9 am.', "I'm a rising senior at CPEHS and I do love the school. I will admit, at first I felt out of place. The culture of the school is pretty different then what I was used to- however, the school has a lot to offer, even if they are small. They're partners with great organizations like Oppnet and SEO, and they have fun activities throughout the year, such as PGC fun night, game night, etc. They have a plethora of clubs and many of the teachers are easy going and care for their students.", 'This school is very involved in helping its students. They go above and beyond in getting their students the tools they need to be able to succeed. The teachers are strict but they are not closed off towards students. If someone needed to just speak to someone the teachers would always be there to listen.']

column6: ['Central Park East has been a great experience so far now that i’m a senior. Everybody is so friendly and willing to help you with whatever your issue is! The teachers are very much involved with their students and helping them grow academically and mentally. Administration is also very helpful and kind. They will stay on top of you not letting kids slack but also know to give you your space. All administration pushes their kids to be involved in sports and activities and everyone is actually involved. We have great activities and everyone is very familiar and friendly with each other. Loved it.', 'Central Park East High School it’s a really awesome school. Students are challenged academically which prepares them for college. A lot of programs are provided to keep students interested and engaged. The teachers are really awesome, and they are not only teachers but they motivate you when you need that little push. Teachers also care about students and if they notice something different they communicate with you, and reach out. The school also assists students with anything they may need. The school also focuses a lot on getting students prepared for college since freshmen year.', 'It is a very small school community and everyone knows each other. This allows for teachers to develop relationships with  students. The teachers are great and always push students to do their best.', 'Central park east has always been an amazing school. I heard great things about it and knew it was a good idea to apply their. Once I got accepted and was able to love out my high school career, I realized that Central Park East was the right choice. The teachers are amazing, the staff treat you like part of a family and no one is ever left out. Although there was a lot of ups and downs in the math department, the school was overall very good and deserves a lot of credit.', 'Central Park East High School is a very challenging school that prepares you for life as a college student. The bathrooms could be revamped.', 'For a small school that Central Park East High School is, it has a wide range of extracurricular activities. There is a wide range of clubs and sports open to all students. CPEHS also invokes a very welcoming environment where the staff is open to students to come for help when needed during their office hours. One thing I’d want to change is having more options for AP classes.', 'It needs more academic classes like more a bigger variety of AP classes would be great. But overall, I love the school. The teachers and staff are great (for the most part) and they truly do care.', 'CPEHS has an amazing faculty, teachers, and student body. At the start of your freshman year, the student body helps incoming freshman learn to communicate and adjust. The school does an amazing job with college readiness and a supportive environment for everyone.', 'The school community is great. It feels like a family and the teachers really care about the students. Everyone helps each other succeed.', 'The school is small and very supportive of its students. The classes are great and very helpful. There is a library and computer lab where I go to do work. The school offers students many extracurricular activities and opportunities to get into programs that help students go to college. Some changes need to be made to improve classes and maybe create new ones, but overall great!', 'This school was very good in helping you prepare for college, but they pushed all students to go to college, even those who were set on not going. If they also had a different workshop for those who did not think college was for them, or who were taking a gap year, I think it would be better. The food is also bad, as most schools are, but they allow you to get food from outside during lunch. Central park east also has a lot of connections for programs, and provided many different options. This is school is more of a college prep school All in all, it is a good school, but it could better itself.', "I enjoyed my time at Central Park East High School, even with the last couple months left. I really don't want to let it go, I enjoyed everything about my high school. The people, the staff, the students, the activities, all of it.", "The teachers are amazing and approachable. Many go out of their way to help their students. There is peer tutoring offered on top of tutoring during teacher's office hours.", "When I was enrolled into this high school there's was nothing but a school filled with gang affiliation kids. Since this school is also near a few projects and bad neighborhoods I have witness a few shoot outs and robberys", "I hated being in highschool while I was there. But now that I look back on it the school is really good nad it's getting better. The teachers and the bonds studnets build with them go beyond the classroom.", 'Before I attended Central Park East High School, I did not know anything about the school. Now as a senior, I can honestly say that I do not regret attending CPEHS. I like that it is a small school so you will feel comfortable. The teachers will know you by your name and they are always available to help you during their office hours. I also like that we are fortunate enough to be able to go outside during lunch which requires a great deal of trust. There are a variety of sports and clubs that you can join in order to be involved as well.', "When I found out I would be attending Central Park East High School(CPEHS) in the Fall of 2014, I wanted nothing to do with the school. Being European and from Queens made me think that there was no way I would fit in with people from East Harlem--I am happy to say that I was wrong. I adjusted quickly, felt welcomed by the positive environment, and found a group of friends who changed my life forever. It's amazing how you can go into something thinking that you'll hate it, and find that it's just the opposite. All teachers, students, and faculty are friendly and open to helping everyone succeed in every subject. CPEHS is filled with overachievers who motivate the entire community to continue to do well and be college ready. After three years at CPEHS, I've learned a lot of life lessons from those around me. These lessons and positive experiences will stay with me forever, and having one more year left, if I could do it all over again, I would.", 'My experience in this school has been more than amazing! What I like most about this school is that there are many opportunities that surface for students to be successful in high school and in college in order to be prepared for the real world. But what I wish would change about the school is that the ratio between students to staff was a lot smaller so that the students who need extra help can actually receive it. All in all, this school is fantastic, and I personally love it just how it is!', "Im a junior in Cpehs and i absolutely love being a student in this school. I would not trade it for any other. Everyone has their cup of tea, and this school is mine. I've never been more proud to say this is my high school. All the teacher here are very encouraging and supportive. It's a very small community and so everyone knows everyone. You are very likely to get one on one help from teachers which is very hard in other schools. Cpehs also has a very low tolerance for singleing people out, bullying, fights, and promotion of these activities of any kind. Being here for three years i have not seen one fight. Im happy to say that in 2018 i will be graduating from Central Park East High School.", 'Central Park East High School is a public school that strives to help every student get i to college. This school uses all its resources usefully for its students and to make the school a better place. CPEHS has a friendly environment, has dedicated students, good teachers, etc']
column8: ["CPEHS is an okay school.....it isn't the best, but it definitely helped me obtain numerous programs considering their alliance with College Board Initiative (CBI), Girls Inc. , College Now Courses, Minds Matter, SEO Scholars, OppNet, etc. :)", "I felt that I didn't get the help I really needed throughout the years that I was attending the school.", 'I was a transfer student so I started attending Central Park East High School during my sophomore year. I was scared that transitioning from one school to another was going to be difficult. However, my first days in CPEHS was the total opposite. I began making friends right away and transitioning from one class to another class was very easy. One thing I would like to see more is probably more college counselors because as of now, there is only 1 main college counselor and I know how stressful that can be for both the students as well as the college counselor.', 'These past four years have been amazing here at CPEHS. It is academically challenging and full of supportive and compassionate staff. All the teachers here actually care about each individual student and it shows.', 'Central Park East fosters an environment where all students are capable of doing well with the rigor of the courses this high school has to offer. Central Park East has over 5 AP courses available for students to take, which prepares them for college level courses they will take in the future.', 'Central Park east high school is a great school the teachers are very supportive and want you to do your best in life. But could use more funding in the school.', 'It has a diverse class which whom you can make interactions and learn new things whether it’s about a culture or beliefs. It provides AP courses and college classes that can be transferred to your college when you graduate.', 'I like how Central Park East is a small school. This allows us ( the students) to build a close bond with administration and the teachers. Students are able to feel at home and feel safe in this school and that’s something I’ll always love about it.', 'I really enjoy going to this school, I live in the Bronx and the travel time is not that bad and I always get to school on time. There is many things to do around the area in case I want to hang out after school with my friends.', "When I first found out I was going to this school, I cried tears of despair as I had forgotten that I had even applied. As a class of 2019 senior, I look at that moment somewhat fondly as my experiences completely contradicted my negative expectations. Although a bit crowded and with some students who may not be the most motivated, the school is a diamond in the rough. With motivated teachers and staff, a plethora of college resources and support, and a tight-knit community, CPEHS provided me with an enriching high school experience that I don't regret in the slightest. The only potential downside is the crowded hallways and the, well, developing academic mentality amongst the students.", 'I really liked the support that many teachers provide. I felt safe in this school because security is always around. I just wish to see more art classes and programs in the school.', "The teachers are okay and you'll learn as long as you do the work but the kids are different and I MEAN IT! They do waayyy too much.", 'It was a great experience with teachers that are interested in seeing you succeed. The overall culture of the school is nice and comforting especially if you are opened minded.', 'I enjoyed the atmosphere. When I attended the school was beginning to offer more challenging classes, which prepared me for harder coursework in college.', 'CPEHS is a great small high school where us students get a lot of support from the very start so that we can be successful in high school and be prepared for college. It’s very rare to see fights at the school and the environment is very nice and friendly.', 'It’s a great small school in which students and staff are able to build a strong community. Students are given the resources needed to prepare themselves for college and I can honestly say I made a great choice in selecting this school.', 'Central Park East is a great high school. Though it’s small and not extremely diverse, it has a lot to offer to kids. They are all about college readiness. The college readiness I went through in Central Park East prepared me for college.', 'Has a great college acceptance rate and lots of teachers who dedicate their time to students. Lots of sports conjoined with other schools and clubs/activities to join. The administration is very caring and caters to the needs of both parents and students very well. No fights at all. No dress code, no metal detectors, and school starts at 9 am.', "I'm a rising senior at CPEHS and I do love the school. I will admit, at first I felt out of place. The culture of the school is pretty different then what I was used to- however, the school has a lot to offer, even if they are small. They're partners with great organizations like Oppnet and SEO, and they have fun activities throughout the year, such as PGC fun night, game night, etc. They have a plethora of clubs and many of the teachers are easy going and care for their students.", 'This school is very involved in helping its students. They go above and beyond in getting their students the tools they need to be able to succeed. The teachers are strict but they are not closed off towards students. If someone needed to just speak to someone the teachers would always be there to listen.']

column2: ['Baldwin Senior High School was a great high school experience for me. Here, I was able to excel in my academics, sports and social skills. The teachers are welcoming no matter who you are or what you look like.', "I think Baldwin's biggest strength is its many resources students have to get connected to their future career path or out-of-school events and activities. I think the music department is phenomenal and should get more funding by the district as should some sports teams that get more awards yet less attention than others.", 'I like this school because there are many opportunities to do well. My guidance counselor has been amazing and preparing me for college. My teachers are wonderful and help us if we need help. The honors and AP classes are difficult but if we have trouble, we have help. This school is a great school when thinking about education. There are many fun clubs to join. I like the key club. I have only been there for a year and there has been many community service opportunities.', "Baldwin high school is a great school. I came to this school my freshman year and I had one encounter with a bully that was a senior but the issue was handled very well and professionally. That was one of my concerns when coming to the school but I turns out they handle I very well. One other thing about the school is standards. Everything over 65 is passing and I don't think it should be like that because then you have lazy people like me who get anything over that and think its fine but its not. The bar should be set higher.", 'I️ loved the teachers and the great amount of diversity found here. Teachers and guidance counselors were always so helpful. Their music department was very good. One thing I️’d chance is the traffic there would be in the hallways, very dangerous at times. I️ would also change the fact that they allow lower class men out for lunch. Some of these kids have gotten hit by cars or just don’t end up going to class.', 'My experience at Baldwin High School has helped to prepare me for college. I was able to learn about leadership and teamwork skills through programs like Sportsnite and Intramural Night. My teachers have helped to guide me on choosing what majors I should study in college. Classes like art were great in helping me find my creativity.', 'It was an amazing place to spend for the four years I was here. The school is very diverse and has a lot of opportunities to do things you love no matter what it is. The sports programs are also very good as well starting with the coaches all the way to the team and bonding. The schools spirit is also insane. Everyday there are kids and adults repping and rooting for this awesome school. And one thing about the teachers is that they really care and look out for their students. Following that there is a lot of classes that can prepare you for life after high school including College and career planning, future living, ect.', "It was a ok school but I couldn't to graduate and finally leave that place after a while that school just slowly sucks the soul out of your body and leaves you as a empty husk.", 'I just moved from the city to Baldwin and my first impression of Baldwin High School was very interesting. It was not my normal crowd but it was fun seeing how big the school was and meeting the faculty. They were very nice. One thing that stood out to me was the lunch. Everything about the school was nice.', 'What I liked the most what the diversity and the inclusiveness. Every student is friendly and different in their own way.', "My experience overall with Baldwin Senior High School was Ok. The resources are there and there are a good amount of activities but in my experience, a certain amount of teachers don't teach too well. Some classes were unnecessarily hard to understand because of the fact that some teachers don't explain questions well. For the most part, the club involvement is great and students help each other and work well together. The food in the school wasn't good at all but the location is close to many restaurants and fast food places as well as a gym. The facilities need some more cleaning but it was mostly ok. I somewhat liked my experience.", 'My experience in this school was great there is a huge range of people to meet and talk to in the commons. Since the school is particularly big there’s times you’ll see people you haven’t seen all year. The administration is nice and accommodate to the needs of the students. Overall they do a good job st making the students succeed throughout their high school career!!', 'Baldwin Senior High School provided me with a nice experience, that not only prepared me for college, but also helped me get connections, in the workforce to help me pursue my dreams as an engineer.', 'Loved my teachers and extra curricular clubs and sports!! Its not as diverse as other communities but I grew a lot and was ready for college because of bhs. I still visit and am grateful for all I gained', 'I liked that  the school was very diverse and had a lot off kids from all over and everyone was made to feel safe. the school is an open campus and that is good so we can get whatever we wannted to eat and not worry about not liking the food they had at the school.', 'I love my school! We come from all different cultures and backgrounds yet we all are their for one another. There’s something for everyone at our school. We have an amazing music program, STEM program, sport teams are always in the news. We are inclusive and we stand strong together as a community. I’m a jr. now and feel I received a top notch education. My teachers and counselor have gone above and beyond for me these past few years. Always there to tutor or answer one of my many questions.', 'I like the different opportunities this school has. There are many clubs and sports. Also many students can have the opportunity to make friends. There is no bullying, everyone is free to be themselves. The teachers are very helpful both in education and giving advice for our personal lives.', 'What I liked most about Baldwin Senior High School was its diversity.  It was an extremely inclusive school and a great place to go to school.', "Baldwin High has been the most greatest high school experience yet. I'm so excited for college because of the way this school has prepared me for college", 'Baldwin is a school with lots of different people it’s very unique in all the clubs and with all the people it’s very easy to make new friends. Throughout my 4 years there’s been lots of crazy things to happen but overall I’ve had a decent experience going to the high school']

column6: ['Baldwin Senior High School has a very good curriculum and is ran by a very good principal Mr. Nolan and very good deans and administration.', 'Baldwin senior high school is a great school, with a diverse faculty members, teachers and students. There are many sports and clubs to participate in', "While many would consider a school's diversity not nearly as important as other factors, I cannot overstate the value of attending a diverse school district like Baldwin's. Having attended Baldwin schools for 13 years of my life, I am starting to see the value of the town's incredible diversity. Now attending college out-of-state, it is absolutely fascinating to see how small minded other students can be. Most of my peer's high schools were composed 95% of white students, and their lack of knowledge and respect for other cultures is concerning. Living in a country where diversity is rapidly increasing, schools are preparing students to not only be well-educated members of society, but to be open-minded and accepting of other cultures as well. While I don't intend to take away from Baldwin's stellar teachers, championship-winning sports program, or loving community, I felt it necessary to stress the impact of the school's diverse culture. Thank you, Baldwin, for an incredible 13 years.", 'Throughout my four years here I had a great time. Every single one of my teachers would always help me with whatever I needed assistance with and were very caring. There is a lot of college credit classes/AP classes which really helped me in my college career. There is also many different clubs and sports to join, ranging from engineering to business to the arts. The music program is very impressive. The school is really what you make of it.', 'Great in terms of academics, you get out of the experience what you put in. If you work hard you will find that most teachers are willing to engage with you. The Guidence department however is lax luster. Getting someone to care about anything past scheduling is like pulling teeth. Applying for college will be a nightmare if you do not have your own outside resources. Relating to the social issues of the students is a field that also needs improvement. A parent of a bullied child was once told to enroll the kid in night school instead of dealing with the issue. Other wise the school is great definitely a solid public school. As previously stated however the guidence department definitely needs to start anew', 'Baldwin senior high school is a very diverse school filled with teachers that care for the students education.', 'I enjoyed the diversity of the student body. I would improve resources for students pertaining to academic needs. there was a lack of college preparation as well as guidance on how to search for colleges and how to budget the cost. I did enjoy the science department of the school and believe that the teachers in that department were well educated and cared about there students although that may be bias because i enjoy all subjects of science. i was also let down on the lack of technology programs/ classes that were offered.', 'I came into Baldwin High School the middle of my Sophomore year. Baldwin High is very artsy, when you walk around the school everywhere you look there is some kind of art. The teachers in Baldwin High are very encouraging, they want all their students to succeed.', 'The students and staff were very diverse. There are so many clubs and sports teams available. The school is also located in a friendly and safe environment.', "Being a student here for nearly three years,  I've always appreciated the inclusivity and diversity that our school has a well known reputation for.  Most of the teachers I have had are generally passionate about what they teach, and try to project that same passion onto their students (my self included.) This has benefited me in ways, and has helped me to discover a strong liking towards the subject of social sciences.", 'Baldwin has wide variety of classes you could pick from if you have room on your schedule to take it if you are interested in a field', 'My experience at Baldwin High School was eventful. We went through a lot from the Girl Basketball and the Boys Basketball teams making it to the State Championships to bomb threats. This school has given a lot to me, like inspirational teachers, wonderful friends, and memories that I will never forget. This school was one of the schools that participated in silence for the victims who were killed in the High School Shooting in Florida. I am proud that my school made that decision.', 'At Baldwin, several academies are offered in concentrations of engineering, Medical, Communications, etc. Multiple extracurricular are offered as well such as clubs, volunteer programs, and the Nassau BOCES Program. Teachers are qualified and teach well and are willing to communicate with students outside of school in order to improve grades and performance. Teachers are also available for tutoring outside of the classroom and mandatory extra help sessions. Baldwin is currently evolving with multiple renovations and new programs. Baldwin also is the top AA Class school in sports and music program.', 'I just want to make it clear that the school is filthy, with bathrooms so disgusting that the bins are overflowing with paper towels and other garbage.  There are also huge cockroaches that I have found in many different areas, which is disgusting.  The food is bad and no one’s doing a thing about it.  These are only a few of my complaints about Baldwin Highschool, and if you are planning to go here just reconsider and think twice.', 'The school has an okay atmosphere around it, but the majority of the time there is a group of people that cut class and skip, leading to more "punishments" led out to the entire school.  Few absurd policies that are recently being thrown into place such as being marked late once gives an automatic detention, and with a school as crowded and large as BHS is, there will be many detentions given out, just wasting everyone\'s time.', 'I like my school. I joined mid year for Jr year because I relocated to LI coming from Frank Sinatra Performing Arts Schools. I miss it there and wish Baldwin had an Arts group so that I would continue dance.', "My overall experience at Baldwin Senior High School has been very enjoyable. The teachers  are very caring and willing to assist any student who is struggling in his/her class. This school is filled with wonderful students who care about one another's well-being and is one of the most diverse communities in Long Island. Overall, Baldwin Senior High School is a place where any student can walk in and express him/herself in a manner that will be accepted by his/her peers.", 'It is an overall great school, plenty of electives to choose from, clubs, and more. Very diverse school, and fairly easy to make friends. Teachers are very good, they know how to explain their classes. Open campus, so you can go out on your free period or lunch and enjoy any local stores or food joints.', "Currently a junior at Baldwin High School and it's pretty good. It is an open campus school, allowing you to go out for lunch or during free periods. There are also two cafeterias and a library to spend time eating lunch or studying in. The teachers all try their best to have every student succeed and are very supportive and willing to help.", 'The environment of Baldwin High School is filled with positivity, excellence, and school pride. Great school!']

I did enjoy the science department of the school and believe that the teachers in that department were well educated and cared about there students although that may be bias because i enjoy all subjects of science. i was also let down on the lack of technology programs/ classes that were offered.', 'I came into Baldwin High School the middle of my Sophomore year. Baldwin High is very artsy, when you walk around the school everywhere you look there is some kind of art. The teachers in Baldwin High are very encouraging, they want all their students to succeed.', 'The students and staff were very diverse. There are so many clubs and sports teams available. The school is also located in a friendly and safe environment.', "Being a student here for nearly three years,  I've always appreciated the inclusivity and diversity that our school has a well known reputation for.  Most of the teachers I have had are generally passionate about what they teach, and try to project that same passion onto their students (my self included.) This has benefited me in ways, and has helped me to discover a strong liking towards the subject of social sciences.", 'Baldwin has wide variety of classes you could pick from if you have room on your schedule to take it if you are interested in a field', 'My experience at Baldwin High School was eventful. We went through a lot from the Girl Basketball and the Boys Basketball teams making it to the State Championships to bomb threats. This school has given a lot to me, like inspirational teachers, wonderful friends, and memories that I will never forget. This school was one of the schools that participated in silence for the victims who were killed in the High School Shooting in Florida. I am proud that my school made that decision.', 'At Baldwin, several academies are offered in concentrations of engineering, Medical, Communications, etc. Multiple extracurricular are offered as well such as clubs, volunteer programs, and the Nassau BOCES Program. Teachers are qualified and teach well and are willing to communicate with students outside of school in order to improve grades and performance. Teachers are also available for tutoring outside of the classroom and mandatory extra help sessions. Baldwin is currently evolving with multiple renovations and new programs. Baldwin also is the top AA Class school in sports and music program.', 'I just want to make it clear that the school is filthy, with bathrooms so disgusting that the bins are overflowing with paper towels and other garbage.  There are also huge cockroaches that I have found in many different areas, which is disgusting.  The food is bad and no one’s doing a thing about it.  These are only a few of my complaints about Baldwin Highschool, and if you are planning to go here just reconsider and think twice.', 'The school has an okay atmosphere around it, but the majority of the time there is a group of people that cut class and skip, leading to more "punishments" led out to the entire school.  Few absurd policies that are recently being thrown into place such as being marked late once gives an automatic detention, and with a school as crowded and large as BHS is, there will be many detentions given out, just wasting everyone\'s time.', 'I like my school. I joined mid year for Jr year because I relocated to LI coming from Frank Sinatra Performing Arts Schools. I miss it there and wish Baldwin had an Arts group so that I would continue dance.', "My overall experience at Baldwin Senior High School has been very enjoyable. The teachers  are very caring and willing to assist any student who is struggling in his/her class. This school is filled with wonderful students who care about one another's well-being and is one of the most diverse communities in Long Island. Overall, Baldwin Senior High School is a place where any student can walk in and express him/herself in a manner that will be accepted by his/her peers.", 'It is an overall great school, plenty of electives to choose from, clubs, and more. Very diverse school, and fairly easy to make friends. Teachers are very good, they know how to explain their classes. Open campus, so you can go out on your free period or lunch and enjoy any local stores or food joints.', "Currently a junior at Baldwin High School and it's pretty good. It is an open campus school, allowing you to go out for lunch or during free periods. There are also two cafeterias and a library to spend time eating lunch or studying in. The teachers all try their best to have every student succeed and are very supportive and willing to help.", 'The environment of Baldwin High School is filled with positivity, excellence, and school pride. Great school!']

column2: ['I am a senior in High School I have been in Tuckahoe for about 10 years. I have to say, a lot of the memories I wouldn’t change for the world although you will have bumps in the road with people, girl drama etc... Although Tuckahoe is small, there are a lot of fake people in this school, but when you find your click, your like a family. Although we aren’t ranked Class A in sports, we are very proud of our football players. I would choose Tuckahoe again without a doubt. #classof2020', 'Tuckahoe High School has excellent teachers that are able to give individualized attention to each student because of its small size. However, its small size can also be extremely limiting, making it hard to find opportunities to grow and people to be friends with. It is definitely not the stereotypical large high school experience that most students have.', 'Tuckahoe High School is a very close nit school, it is  academic  outstanding. Everyone is well put together and kind. The teachers and staff are very caring and welcoming. The events are very heart-warming and fun and everyone is welcomed to be involved.', 'I’ve gone to Tuckahoe High School for all 4 years and honestly all 4 of them could’ve been way better. In my experience the people were trash but the education portion is great. If you find yourself a nice little friend group you’ll be fine. It’s super small so you will know everyone in every grade. But the teachers are somewhat helpful just depends on who. I could’ve had a better 4 years but I wouldn’t want to have my 4 years anywhere else to be honest.', 'We are so happy with THS. We were a bit apprehensive about moving into Tuckahoe from UES based on some school reviews, but local residents assured us that it was a fantastic school district. We love the school and living here.', 'Though people probablt feel my rating is too low, I would love to explain that Tuckahoe High School is extremely different than the elementary and middle school. People explain the love for most teachers, yet it is mostly on a personal level. Yes all the teachers are great people, but in my opinion there are only a select few who really and truly care about the students and do whatever they can to help. Teachers are rarely engaging in their lessons, which I feel is an important atribute. (Though select 3-4 teachers do have engaging lessons year round) In middle school, A large majority of teachers had engaging lessons. Even if curriculum is difficult or “boring” I feel there are little things that could make it the least bit more interesting. Teachers are stubborn about their way of teaching and do not change it for their student’s needs and do not believe the students when they try to explain what truly helps them.', 'Tuckahoe High School has saved my life and future, coming from England I embarked on a huge challenge by changing schools and getting use to the different education system. Without THS and the dedicated staff from the cleaners to the principle I would not have been accepted to the kind of schools that have asked for my admission. It has been a pleasure and a journey I will never forget as I prepare for my future. What makes THS so great is the dedication from all the teachers to make every student succeed no matter the cost.', 'The teachers are very nice and informative. The coaches are experienced. It is a positive environment.', 'My four years at THS were definitely a roller coaster. While not all teachers had me in their favorites, I still had an unforgettable high school experience. The friendships I made here have followed us to college, and the skills I learned from my extracurricular activities have proved to be incredibly helpful.', 'My school bus driver was a little... irresponsible. During the year we almost experienced many accidents. Once my bus driver locked kids inside before a drop off because they opened the bus windows and she was too lazy to get up and close them herself.', 'Unless paying $2 for a bag of chips (the cheapest item in this cafeteria) is full of variety and healthy go for it!', 'I would not choose this school over again.', 'In Tuckahoe High students are enagaging in sexual activity in our gym locker rooms without punishment or voided punishment. Our policies do not have priorities.', 'THere is almost nothing available to us. Most that is requires students to pay out of pocket to participate.', 'Personally, I attempt to work very hard and receive high grades but I feel that only the more wealthy students, students with family who participates in the PTA and other financially related students are more prone to attention during class, academic help, and higher grades.', 'Our school is so small that apparently the board can only offer cheer leading and football. A father of a student paid about 1 million dollars for the Tuckahoe Tigers football field and the superintendent decided to get a bulk of brand new chrome books! Yet the Science Olympiad  team members and teachers are paying out of pocket for all their supplies and transportation.', 'Majority of students are not caught nor harmed by drug use that is constantly occurring. Drugs of a great variety can be easily obtained from almost any peer.', 'All faculty will go the distance for kids.', 'Teachers will do anything for students.', 'Could not ask for a better school.']

column2: ['Overall the school was pretty good and had a good experience. The academics and classes were very interesting and good. There was a lot of diversity among students and teachers. For the most part, all the teachers were kind. They prepared to be very well for college. The clubs are fun. The safety is very good at this school. The school culture is very high and is definitely there. The food was okay, we had an okay amount of school resources. I overall really liked Brooklyn prospect charter school', "I am a current senior here at Brooklyn Prospect and I am also a full DP student. I think that this school has a lot of great things about Brooklyn Prospect, but there are also a lot of things that have hindered my experience from being great. The academics are so-so. One of the better parts about the school is their IB program. They have some really good teachers in this program who know what they're doing and are really intelligent. However, the retention rate with teachers is god awful and it sucks. The school also sometimes is too desperate for teachers, so they hire anyone who can just do the job (but not do it properly). The school is also insanely small, so you know everyone in your grade and they know everything about you (which can be good and bad, depending). Overall, I've had an okay experience here, but I'm excited to go somewhere new.", "The IB program at Brooklyn Prospect is fantastic and only getting better. However, the school is crowded (I think they are looking for a bigger building but still) and sports teams are a real failing. Other than Soccer it and boys basketball it is impossible to keep a team or really a club around for more than a few years. There just aren't enough people usually to keep the club going and the school doesn't promote the clubs or help them maintain a constant membership which is frustrating.", 'Brooklyn Prospect Charter School is a very diverse school. Additionally, they offer a program called the IB Diploma Program. This program is very similar to AP courses, but there are more requirements. I joined the IB program and I improve in critical thinking and analysis. The program is very beneficial and prepares you for college.', "The best thing about Brooklyn Prospect is the class size. With only 110 students per grade, each class is small which allows students to receive individualized attention from their teacher and get the help necessary to succeed. The teachers here are also another good thing. All the teachers I have interacted with are passionate about what they do and are motivated to help each student succeed. Teachers have designated office hours which allow them to meet students outside the classroom if they ever need any assistance. Additionally, the school's culture is something worth highlighting. Brooklyn Prospect is dedicated to making sure the school's community is diverse, not only by enrolling students of different backgrounds but also celebrating them within a school. We take pride in being a diverse community and provide opportunities for our students to take part in it. I would improve our lunch by providing healthier/tastier options for students to enjoy.", 'The small environment allows teachers to be more attentive to the students and it allows students to prosper more. The staff is always ready to help and actually care about setting the students up for success.', "It was alright. Brooklyn prospect taught me the value in exploring other cultures and understand that my opinions and thoughts are not absolute and everyone's points of views are valid.", 'I love their IB Diploma Program. The teachers are helpful and the Diversity at the school is Great!  The classroom sizes are small and there is a lot of one-on-one opportunities with teachers and students.', "Brooklyn Prospect was a great school! The teachers deeply care about you and always push you to do great! If it wasn't for this school, I wouldn't be attending Temple University.", "When I started 6th grade here, I was one of only 200 total students in the whole school because it was such a new school. Being able to grow up in this wholesome environment, and to see Brooklyn Prospect develop into a hugely successful school has been very rewarding. What has always been great about the school is the faculty passion and commitment. Through the seven years I've been at Brooklyn Prospect, every one of my teachers demonstrated great care in me succeeding. The teacher's show great respect and care for every individual student. I feel very comfortable talking to any of my teachers. Brooklyn Prospect has continued to offer a huge amount of clubs and activities in addition to great academics. The school constantly preaches that the students should be doing a lot more than just academics with their lives. There is a huge availability of varsity sports teams, clubs, intramural sports, after school programs, etc.", 'It is very academically based, and has pushed me to be a good academic student. The teachers care about students, and really want to see their students be the best they can be. ', "I haven't participated in many.", "The school is safe because it is small. There are cameras and students are required to use ID's to sign out.", "Its a small school so there isn't a lot but if there is an interest then it is created. It is easy to start a club.", 'I am not familiar with what goes on with the parents of the school.', 'Most teachers understand the close community. The teaching style is based on Ib principles and more discussion and group based.', 'As a new school, the extracurriculars are still in development.', 'The vast majority of the teachers are excellent.  They are engaging, demanding, and the work they assign is generally intrinsically interesting.', 'The school handles issues of health and safety well.', 'For motivated students, Brooklyn Prospect offers a challenging IB curriculum and terrific teachers.']

column2: ["Of course the food isn't great but the envirment was safe and the teachers were great. I graduated before they gave us Ipads but now all students are to use them and the teachers can see if they are participating in class through a bluetooth connection to all Ipads. When I was there, they definitly helped me with college readiness and had SATs tutors that you can apply for your students. Most teachers are understanding and will help out the students if needed. The school is small and so is the lockers, but now everyone has Ipads so thats no longer an issue.", 'H frank carey is a very good school filled with amazing teachers and staff. The only think I would like to see changed is we have no air conditionining in the school which at times of extreme heat ,makes it hard to focus', 'My experience is great in  H Frank Carey ,The teachers and staff are amazing .I Learned so much there in all fields from gym ,music .academics .i also joined a few clubs that i really enjoyed.This school offers so much for it’s students , I was so happy to be apart of this school.', "The teachers here are pretty nice and willing to help. On the first day of school, they will make sure everyone knows their free periods for extra help. Generally, teachers are pretty lax about rules, which sometimes leads to impeded learning. If you really want to learn a lot, I'm not sure if this school provides more than a catholic institution, but it's genuinely what you make of it. If you take AP courses and stay out of the drama, you'll get a decent education. The students (again, generally speaking) are very lazy. Most kids just slide by, and even in AP classes, there are relatively few students who are motivated. Because the students rarely try to achieve higher standards, I remember my counselor not really taking the time to help me when I told her I was interested in top universities. But again, if you find the right friends and choose the right course load, you should be fine.", 'I think Carey needs to focus less on popularity and sports, and more on education. Some teachers there are amazing and don’t get caught up in the popularity contest. Others, that’s all they care about it’s like they are still in high school it is sad. The business department is ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! They inspired me to become a teacher! I suggest if you go to Carey just keep reminding yourself that there are better things in life than high school and being popular.', 'I had a great time at H. Frank Carey. Almost every teacher I had was enthusiastic about teaching, and put in a lot of effort to make interesting lessons. There was a good selection of elective courses over the years and allowed me to really explore what I was interested in: math and technology. One of the few gripes I have with the school was that it tended to focus a lot on the sports program at the expense of others, such as music. Also, after I graduated, I heard that all students receive an I-pad to try to make the school go paperless, and I think that is a bit of a waste of money and adds a distraction in the classroom.', "Carey High School was a great place to learn. I've spent countless hours studying chemistry, math and history in this school, but the most important thing that I learned in these walls was who I was.", 'Overall, if kids take more AP classes, they will be more prepared for college. However, most kids did not take those classes. This school lacked academic rigor and challenge.', 'I loved my experience in high school, great teachers, outstanding guidance counselors. No child should ever feel lost surrounded by such the amazing staff they have. Great events and community opportunities. A real family setting.', 'The beauty of H. Frank Carey High School is found not in their good intentions but their results.  This is displayed in both their alumni and their pedigree.', 'In my opinion it was an alright school but needed more diversity and better ways to resolve in school issues. Not just put it aside and pretend it never happened. Academics, sports, food, clubs and activities were ok. However, resolving student issue is not their strong suit.', 'My high schoo, experience was honestly the best. I made new friends and got close with my teachers. The staff is the most friendly staff you’ll ever meet. A every teacher loves to be there.', 'School is very bad. Kids that go here are very cliquey, and do not accept outsiders. This school is also not very diverse, so if you’re non-white, you aren’t going to be treated the same as one of the Italian kids that go here. Administration has been caught not responding to bullying and concerning themselves with matters not considered serious, while ignoring actual cultural problems in the school. They’d rather tell kids not to curse at lunch then see someone getting picked on right behind them. One student conducted an experiment in which he pretended to bully people to see if the administration would react, and they did nothing at all. Once it was brought to their attention, instead of putting forth effort to correct the ways they monitor bullying, they instead attempted to silence the student by telling him to delete the video.', 'Sometimes the people in charge don’t take incidents with other students seriously, and blame you for it instead of providing adequate help.', 'The first couple of years were more fun and easier because I was still a kid at the time. But as the years went on I faced more challenges and difficulties. I overcame most of them. The ones I didn’t overcome were the ones I’m currently dealing with. I learned more from my experiences than the classes I took if I’m going to be on the more blunt and honest side. Also I believe that people are more influenced by what they think they will be judged for over what they want to do. I learned that the hard way. Overall my experience at Carey was a good one and it’s coming to a close next year so I’m hoping to make my senior year unforgettable.', 'No racial diversity- Lot of racist close minded spoiled bratty people- I did face racist comments in this school. Some teachers are great though. This high school isn’t as competitive as new york high schools. It’s very sports orientated- no clubs are taken seriously. Students and some faculty are trash. I hated this school. Don’t send your kids here', 'My experience at H. Frank Carey was incredible. I was heavily involved at school, often staying until 7 or 8 at night for drama club, flag line, musical rehearsals, jazz band, and more. H. Frank Carey has a lot of opportunities for students outside of the classroom, and has "an activity for every student and a student for every activity" (which is often stated by our Student Activities Director, Mrs. Bergbom.', 'This high school is one of the best public schools on long island. Being a recent graduate, I miss it so much but am grateful for the time I got to spend there. The teachers are incredibly helpful in every way possible.', 'I loved my years at H. Frank Carey. I loved all my teachers and how many resources I had. There was always some way to get help. After touring my top colleges, I have realized that they have had many resources just like Carey, and that was very comforting for me. I am so excited to see where my college career takes me and I can’t wait to see what I am capable of doing. I know for a fact Carey High School has prepared me to be on my own and ready for college.', 'At H. Frank Carey, each classroom has a different setting depending on the teacher. My experiences with teachers have been great until this year. I hope they get a better AP Calculus AB teacher and have toilet paper in the stalls in the future.']
column4: ["Of course the food isn't great but the envirment was safe and the teachers were great. I graduated before they gave us Ipads but now all students are to use them and the teachers can see if they are participating in class through a bluetooth connection to all Ipads. When I was there, they definitly helped me with college readiness and had SATs tutors that you can apply for your students. Most teachers are understanding and will help out the students if needed. The school is small and so is the lockers, but now everyone has Ipads so thats no longer an issue.", 'H frank carey is a very good school filled with amazing teachers and staff. The only think I would like to see changed is we have no air conditionining in the school which at times of extreme heat ,makes it hard to focus', 'My experience is great in  H Frank Carey ,The teachers and staff are amazing .I Learned so much there in all fields from gym ,music .academics .i also joined a few clubs that i really enjoyed.This school offers so much for it’s students , I was so happy to be apart of this school.', "The teachers here are pretty nice and willing to help. On the first day of school, they will make sure everyone knows their free periods for extra help. Generally, teachers are pretty lax about rules, which sometimes leads to impeded learning. If you really want to learn a lot, I'm not sure if this school provides more than a catholic institution, but it's genuinely what you make of it. If you take AP courses and stay out of the drama, you'll get a decent education. The students (again, generally speaking) are very lazy. Most kids just slide by, and even in AP classes, there are relatively few students who are motivated. Because the students rarely try to achieve higher standards, I remember my counselor not really taking the time to help me when I told her I was interested in top universities. But again, if you find the right friends and choose the right course load, you should be fine.", 'I think Carey needs to focus less on popularity and sports, and more on education. Some teachers there are amazing and don’t get caught up in the popularity contest. Others, that’s all they care about it’s like they are still in high school it is sad. The business department is ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! They inspired me to become a teacher! I suggest if you go to Carey just keep reminding yourself that there are better things in life than high school and being popular.', 'I had a great time at H. Frank Carey. Almost every teacher I had was enthusiastic about teaching, and put in a lot of effort to make interesting lessons. There was a good selection of elective courses over the years and allowed me to really explore what I was interested in: math and technology. One of the few gripes I have with the school was that it tended to focus a lot on the sports program at the expense of others, such as music. Also, after I graduated, I heard that all students receive an I-pad to try to make the school go paperless, and I think that is a bit of a waste of money and adds a distraction in the classroom.', "Carey High School was a great place to learn. I've spent countless hours studying chemistry, math and history in this school, but the most important thing that I learned in these walls was who I was.", 'Overall, if kids take more AP classes, they will be more prepared for college. However, most kids did not take those classes. This school lacked academic rigor and challenge.', 'I loved my experience in high school, great teachers, outstanding guidance counselors. No child should ever feel lost surrounded by such the amazing staff they have. Great events and community opportunities. A real family setting.', 'The beauty of H. Frank Carey High School is found not in their good intentions but their results.  This is displayed in both their alumni and their pedigree.', 'In my opinion it was an alright school but needed more diversity and better ways to resolve in school issues. Not just put it aside and pretend it never happened. Academics, sports, food, clubs and activities were ok. However, resolving student issue is not their strong suit.', 'My high schoo, experience was honestly the best. I made new friends and got close with my teachers. The staff is the most friendly staff you’ll ever meet. A every teacher loves to be there.', 'School is very bad. Kids that go here are very cliquey, and do not accept outsiders. This school is also not very diverse, so if you’re non-white, you aren’t going to be treated the same as one of the Italian kids that go here. Administration has been caught not responding to bullying and concerning themselves with matters not considered serious, while ignoring actual cultural problems in the school. They’d rather tell kids not to curse at lunch then see someone getting picked on right behind them. One student conducted an experiment in which he pretended to bully people to see if the administration would react, and they did nothing at all. Once it was brought to their attention, instead of putting forth effort to correct the ways they monitor bullying, they instead attempted to silence the student by telling him to delete the video.', 'Sometimes the people in charge don’t take incidents with other students seriously, and blame you for it instead of providing adequate help.', 'The first couple of years were more fun and easier because I was still a kid at the time. I learned more from my experiences than the classes I took if I’m going to be on the more blunt and honest side. Also I believe that people are more influenced by what they think they will be judged for over what they want to do. I learned that the hard way. Overall my experience at Carey was a good one and it’s coming to a close next year so I’m hoping to make my senior year unforgettable.', 'No racial diversity- Lot of racist close minded spoiled bratty people- I did face racist comments in this school. Some teachers are great though. This high school isn’t as competitive as new york high schools. It’s very sports orientated- no clubs are taken seriously. Students and some faculty are trash. My experiences with teachers have been great until this year. I hope they get a better AP Calculus AB teacher and have toilet paper in the stalls in the future.']
column6: ["I feel it's a great school with a few minor changes I think it would be outstanding. I think it's very diverse with the students and teachers.  I an very happy with the education my children have received from this school.", 'My favorite parts about H. Frank Carey High School is that everyone is so friendly and nice both teachers and students. One thing I wish would change would be that teachers should be more available for extra help.', 'Great experience overall. Nice that school just got many needed upgrades such as Windows, roof, solar panels, new auditorium seats and sports fields.', 'Recently graduated with the class of 2017. Every year I came across at least one amazing staff member or teacher that made the overall experience of high school better while making sure I did not stray behind on their watch.', "I went to this school back in the mid to late 1980's.  For me it was a horrible experience being a 7th grader mixed in same school with 12th graders.  There was no middle school and I was relentlessly bullied by older students.  Teachers didn't care.  I hope it has improved but for me it really ruined my life since I hungout with a bad crowd to fit in while there and led to some long lasting mistakes and bad choices.  I ended up dropping out senior year.  Should never have kids in same school with students that are old enough to drive cars.  Those age differences do not mix when trying to learn since I ended up just trying to survive.", 'Graduated from H. Frank Carey in 2011 and some of my memories take place in those hallways. I made lifelong friends and cherished the teachers that brought me to where I am. The vocational program Sewanhaka district impacted my college education as to giving me the advantage of learning technical and theoretical skills for my current architecture profession.', 'It was an amazing schoolThis was the moment I dreaded.  As I placed the money in my father’s dusty, cement covered hands.  I looked at his face.  His eyebrows were starting to furrow and the familiar crease made its way across his forehead.  I knew this look.  It was the look of disappointment…of worry.  $250, $350, $450, $350, $150, $30, $250 my father counted the week’s earnings and once again began to explain how they would be distributed.  I knew the speech verbatim; “$1050 for the workers, $500 for th', 'Overall the school is very good. The teachers are great and care about how the student do, but only if the student also puts in the effort. There are clubs for everyone and if there are none that you are interested in you are more than welcome to create your own', 'At Carey, there are so many clubs and activities to take part in.  I got to be involved in so many important groups such as student government, gender equality club, the kickline team, track and field, future business leaders of America, and many more.  My overall experience at Carey has been wonderful and i would do it all over again.  The only thing i would like to see change at Carey would be the cliques.  It would overall be better to see everyone unite and get along under one school roof, rather than see hatred and people not being included.', 'This school is nice and big. They have a great football team. Most of the teachers are willing to help. Carey offers a variety of AP classes. The only thing I would be willing to change is putting air conditioning in the school. ', 'This school is very nice. The teachers are well educated and teach me what I need to know. The teachers help me all the time when I need help. ', 'It is a good school and I learn a lot. The teachers try and help their students. There is a lot of great teachers and they make school fun. ', 'There are a wide variety of topics taught for all majors! From a liberal arts major to a premedical student, many classes are provided to explore their options and also get a head start in advancing with their career. I personally want to become a doctor and having classes like AP Chemistry and AP Biology will really help in giving me a college basis! Teachers push you to be the best that you can be and provide more than enough help and teaching for us to be prepared. The workload gets fairly big and teachers have high expectations with the work we give. Scheduling is done by consumers based on the classes we choose and can be changed if any problems arise. Teachers will go out of their way to advise clubs and provide extra help sessions every day! They are here during all times and also free periods to provide their time and knowledge to help you. Academics here are great!', 'There are SO MANY oppurtunities provided at H Frank Carey from sports to clubs. The extra curricular activities really bring out the best in a person physically and mentally. Sports are very intense and increase physical fitness and determination to do better. Clubs provide a chance to give back and help others such as the Red Cross Club and the Recycling club. Clubs range from a variety of passions to accommodate as many students as possible! Carey has really outdone itself in making extracurricular activities  a well known and amazing part part of the school.', "This school has helped me take my baby steps into adulthood. It has made me realize how intense competition between colleges has gotten and how I have to push myself to show colleges and society that I am a smart and intelligent women. This school has provided me with many clubs and educational oppurtunities that had broaden my mindset and has made me want to help more. If I'm on this website right now filling in scholarship applications it's because the school and teachers have guided me to spend my time thinking about college!", 'Overalls the quality of teaching is great! They have an organized game plan that helps lead students towards succes if they follow it. Teachers here are very knowledgable and challenging. They will push their students above and beyond to reach goals and accomplish things us students never thought we could accomplish. They stay on top of communicating with students and parents to ensure their help and provide many resources in order to be the best that we can be.', 'At H. Frank Carey there will only be one or two teachers that you will be faced with that may not be as great as the others, and that is throughout your 7th-12th grade years. You will leave the school with a handful of friends and amazing teachers that have helped encourage you to strive and push you to do better. These teachers will stay with you for years to come.', 'There are plenty of opportunities. It what the student put into it.', 'Certain Sports and clubs are favored.  Resources are not distributed equitably.', 'Some are better than others']

column2: ['At Verona High School, I feel encouraged to grow as an individual. All of the teachers are extremely friendly, which makes going to them for help easy. Additionally, Verona High places importance on mental health and provides struggling students with the Effective School Solutions (ESS) Program.', 'I really enjoyed learning throughout my four years. The teachers are all willing to put in extra time to help you whenever you need them. In addition, our sports are a very important part of the school body. When you are on a team, it is like a family due to the small size of our school. The friendships you make over the years are very special and will stay with you forever. The changes that I feel would improve the school are doing construction on the locker rooms and update the gymnasiums.', 'If you have Mr. Scott, you’ll love him! The classes are around 50 minutes and you have 6 classes in a day.', 'Verona was very unsanitary to start.  You can see cockroaches come out of kids lunches and mice running around at any point in the year.  The teachers are extremely under qualified and the administration isn’t oppressive and only cares about getting kids in trouble.  My sophomore and junior year I couldn’t drink out certain water fountains because there was traces of lead in it.  Verona high is somewhat diverse,   And you can have a great time with all the people, but the building itself and administration is just terrible.', 'Great school. Athletics and facilities top notch. Gets you well prepared for college. Best public school in tri state area.', "The school has good academic programs but there is stiff competition and people are always competing for the best grades. Student mental health isn't even considered and staying up late at night crying over homework is the norm. The cafeteria food is expensive and unhealthy.", 'Verona High School offers a wide variety of courses including many AP classes. They encourage students to challenge themselves and focus on what they are interested in. However, some of their choices in staff are questionable and some of the teachers are very easily distracted, share their personal political views, or are simply unwilling to help students, which I find to be unacceptable. Finally, there is virtually no diversity.', 'For the most part all of the students are very nice people once you get to know them. The teachers care about how well you do in their classes and are understanding.', "Verona High School is a good school with strong academics.  There's not much diversity and therefore the students aren't very globally / culturally aware.", 'The academics and teachers are very good. I feel very prepared for college after taking 2 AP classes junior year and I plan to take 3 more AP classes senior year.  I wish there was more school spirit and a better administration.', 'Teachers are dedicated.  Classes are challenging.  Music program is inspiring. I feel extremely prepared for college.', 'I think Verona High School is pretty much an average High School.  There is a balance of classes offered (CP, Honors, AP).  The administration is attempting to make the high school very technologically advanced but I have a problem with that because I have A.D.D. and all the electronics are very distracting.  Teachers are knowledgeable and you do have some that go over and beyond to help you out.  Not too much diversity here.', 'All the administration cares about is getting as many students to take as many AP classes as possible, even if they are not qualified to take them. This puts an enormous amount pressure on high-achieving students and gives them the fake belief that they must take an insane amount of AP classes if they want to get into college. Due to this extreme workload, many of the top students are forced to cheat their way through classes just so they can get a few hours of sleep. Cheating is a big problem at VHS, and it is caused by the insane and unreasonable amount of work given by incompetent teachers. The majority of these teachers are not qualified to teach AP courses and are forced to teach a ridiculous amount of information to their students. Students are prevented from succeeding because of the overwhelming amount of information that is "taught" in these classes, and many wind up failing the AP tests they take.', 'I feel as if I received a very good education, and I am prepared for college. However, the environment is very competitive, which can lead to stress.', "Overall, the school is VERY average with a population being deluded into believing they are above average. What is truly above average is the teaching department. There are so many talented and caring teachers in the building. However, this cannot be said the same for administration. They care less about education and more about pure numbers when it comes to AP classes, and numbers as in student participation in them (no one will know the distribution of scores!). No wonder the average ACT is below the state's average. Due to the school being small, cliques form and judgement is almost palpable, and many overestimate their abilities to be far greater than it actually is. Some people are nice, but it's really impossible to escape the cliques that form here.", 'Most of the teachers are very knowledgeable, but the students are very rude and only care about themselves. I would want the students to gain a better attitude and for the school to be cleaner.', 'Excellent school with great teachers who truly care about their students. They do a great job preparing the students for College level study. The school and near by area is very safe and has a very welcoming atmosphere.', "My overall experience with VHS was pretty decent, I definitely could have had a worse time, but also definitely could have had a better time. The administration does not care about their students' well-being and push for AP classes beginning freshman-sophomore year. The administration pushes hard for AP credits and classes to be taken, but does not regulate how well the classes are taught and all they really care about are statistics and how well the district does as a whole. This needs to be improved, because countless times I have heard students stressed out because of AP exams who are only freshman because administration pushed them into taking AP classes when they were not ready.", 'The experience that I had at Verona High School started off incredibly but ultimately became a drag.  The school I loved was taken over by two new authority figures that changed the school for the worse.  All of the fun things at VHS were changed and I cannot take a trip to the restroom with being "kindly" asked to return to class. There is an incredible fakeness at VHS and a Vice Principal who is determined to get as many kids in trouble as possible.', "Verona High School is a good high school with a lot of resources. There is plenty of opportunities and area to excel in.  In my opinion there aren't enough clubs or science based courses. Some of the teachers are exceptional while some others are not meeting expectations. There is not a lot of diversity in the school."]
