No wonder the average ACT is below the state's average. Due to the school being small, cliques form and judgement is almost palpable, and many overestimate their abilities to be far greater than it actually is. Some people are nice, but it's really impossible to escape the cliques that form here.", 'Most of the teachers are very knowledgeable, but the students are very rude and only care about themselves. I would want the students to gain a better attitude and for the school to be cleaner.', 'Excellent school with great teachers who truly care about their students. They do a great job preparing the students for College level study. The school and near by area is very safe and has a very welcoming atmosphere.', "My overall experience with VHS was pretty decent, I definitely could have had a worse time, but also definitely could have had a better time. The administration does not care about their students' well-being and push for AP classes beginning freshman-sophomore year. The administration pushes hard for AP credits and classes to be taken, but does not regulate how well the classes are taught and all they really care about are statistics and how well the district does as a whole. This needs to be improved, because countless times I have heard students stressed out because of AP exams who are only freshman because administration pushed them into taking AP classes when they were not ready.", 'The experience that I had at Verona High School started off incredibly but ultimately became a drag.  The school I loved was taken over by two new authority figures that changed the school for the worse.  All of the fun things at VHS were changed and I cannot take a trip to the restroom with being "kindly" asked to return to class. There is an incredible fakeness at VHS and a Vice Principal who is determined to get as many kids in trouble as possible.', "Verona High School is a good high school with a lot of resources. There is plenty of opportunities and area to excel in.  In my opinion there aren't enough clubs or science based courses. Some of the teachers are exceptional while some others are not meeting expectations. There is not a lot of diversity in the school."]

column2: ['I can confidently say that CHS has definitely molded me into the person that I am. I have met some insanely brilliant, hard-working and truly inspiring people, and I have met the lowest of the low. My school gets a lot of flak from my peers, and I will agree some of it is deserved. Though in my opinion, a sizable amount falls back on the student himself. While there are some atrocious superiors, there are just as many, and more, wonderful ones. Some days CHS seems like a gloomy hell that is going to suck you in and gift you a crappy seven hours, but it has its moments. I will never forget high school, it has been a great time. I still have roughly six full months of instructional days, but those months will escape me in the blink of an eye and I will be off to college. I will give CHS a 4/5.', 'It was definitely a typical high school experience. One thing I loved was how the music program was one of our highlights of the school. The one thing I’d like to see change is more scholarship opportunities offered', "Centereach High School was a nice public school. It had some great teachers who really cared for their students and wanted to see them succeed. But, like most schools, there were some people that probably shouldn't have been teaching. There were plenty of fun activities and school-sponsored events. While I thoroughly enjoyed my experience in the music program, it was obvious the emphasis was on sports (as it is in most schools) even though we had a talented music department and subpar athletics program. I felt I was well-prepared for college, especially with all of the AP courses offered.", 'Centereach High School has many magnificent things going for it. For instance, the school keeps on improving the athletic and academic areas of its building. Furthermore, the music and arts facilities are top quality with many different clubs that support it. The faculty who work there are brilliant people who know how to work with students and know how to get the best out of them. One area of improvement, however, is the quality of school lunches. It can definitely be healthier and better tasting while costing around the same price.', 'The classes are mostly very fitting for their level, especially APs and college courses, and I felt like I was really getting a quality education. Most of the teachers are friendly and very helpful, and they’re willing to work with students who may need extra help or tutoring. Extracurriculars are not the best but CHS has a diverse variety of sports and clubs such as hockey, bowling, a literary magazine club, and an LGBTQ+ club. I feel ready to attend college after CHS.', 'Guidance counselors don’t push you at all, they want you just to graduate, teachers are ranging from alcoholics to wonderful. AP classes are good and clubs are very good as well. If you’re not white , Hispanic, or white passing you’ll feel left out quickly. The only good thing is that smarts rule the school over sports, therefore you’re more likely to be popular if you’re smart', "Centereach High School is filled with students that are all unique from one another and there is people there who will like and accept you for who you are. The faculty and staff there are nice and polite and try their hardest to make sure their students are actually learning something and becoming good people. The school does its best to keep everybody in the building safe and provide top-notch resources for students to use. There is a huge variety of sports and clubs to join as well as music and art classes so it is difficult not to get involved!  What I like most about this school is it tries its best and succeeds at standing out from other schools. This school is full of personality which makes it enjoyable to attend!  Overall, this is a great school that makes me and a lot of others smile. As this summer vacation's end keeps getting closer and closer, I look forward to making the most out of my last year attending Centereach High School!", 'The academics such as AP classes were average, some classes were not serious and some were very rigorous. The clubs were very poorly organized and were not very involved. The arts and musical performances were exceptional. The sports were average. There was air conditioning so that was a plus but it was never off so the school would always be cold. The safety was poor and no one was checking who was coming into the school in the mornings so anyone could walk in and anyone could leave. Some fights. School was up to date with announcing events. Guidance offices had a lot of resources about college and volunteer opportunities in the community. Busses leave fast at the end of the day so you have to rush getting out of school. Most clubs only meet for 15 mins and if you don’t drive then you have to wait 45 mins for the late bus. Gym was a joke and they didn’t even do the fitness tests this year. Gym also has a written final but gym as a class does not go toward your GPA.', "Academically the school was really good and pushed you to do your best. The majority of my sophomore and junior year was spend studying for my AP classes. I loved the teachers, they made their classes worth being in. It wasn't boring... well not to me, I was very interested. Depending on the crowd you hang with, you will have a different experience as to what you think of the clubs and activities.", 'most of the teachers are very nice, the music program and teachers are fabulous. needs some improvement on learning skills in teachers.', 'Being at centereach has helped me out a lot. Doing some honor societies and a sport, also taking lots off college classes has helped me pre pare for college in the future.', 'Centereach High School is an institution with an incredible amount of unrealized potential. There are a few inspiring teachers, whose efforts are immensely undervalued, but the majority of the teachers and administrators seem to be uninterested with the genuine well-being and growth of the soon to be adults they are responsible for guiding. Our education was molded to help us pass a test, as opposed to sparking our passion and curiosity. All in all, though Centereach High School has the resources to allocate towards helping their students build a future for themselves, it does not use these resources effectively, choosing indifference over compassion. If a student is not motivated to exceed expectations, it is only because they are following this example set by the very institution that exists solely to teach and inspire.', 'CHS has definitely had its fair share of fights, but also has good teachers who genuinely care about their students', 'My best experience being at Centereach HS is my involvement in the Orchestra. I have really learned to love music and playing music. I am now playing the Cello and the Bass. I attribute my love and dedication to my music teacher. Her enthusiasm and support have helped me grow into a better student and better musician.  The only thing I would change about CHS is to have it start just a little bit later:)', 'Teachers are all very approachable and helpful. There are a great variety of clubs and afterschool activities. Music department especially provides a huge variety of opportunies.', 'I came to Centereach from a very small catholic middle school and despite the intimidating atmosphere, the teachers and staff were very good at making me feel welcome. I excelled in all my years here and it was thanks to the supportiveness of the faculty.', "Centereach High School is a very active school. There are many school events to keep the grades competitive with each other such as deck the halls, class competition, and homecoming skits. Along with these events many active members of the school come together for the homecoming game, Friday night lights, Trick or Treat Street etc. Our students have been doing well in the Academics department averaging higher than an 85% average for our Senior class. Many of the students here are socially accepting to others and there's many diverse clubs such as French Honor Society, Spanish Honor Society, Asian Fest Club, etc. When someone comes to Centereach there are many activities to be a part of, the more you participate the better the experience here at this school.", "Centereach High School was one of the worst expericences of my life. I've never wanted to cry more in a place than this one. It was disgusting, the children who went there were animalistic, a lot of the food was inedible and overrall just an awful place. Dont get me wrong, the learning experience was pretty worth it. I had taken classes here that wouldn't have been availible in my past neighborhood. Most of my teachers were some of the most peasant and wonderful people I've ever met, who actually cared for their students as if we were their own children.", 'My overall experience was great. The teachers I believe were one of the best parts. They are so nice and love getting to know each of their students.', 'Generally an average high school experience, life at Centereach High School can dull in comparison with its lack of extracurriculars dedicated to the average scholar. Educational groups such as the Debate Team or Model UN aren’t able to run because administration will always value sports teams over groups that focus more on fine arts such as theater or music. If students get a teacher in their schedule that nobody likes (which is a common occurrence), that student would try as hard as they can to change their schedule to avoid year long stress and torture.']

column6: ['My four years at Centereach High School were similar to many of others. I would like to point out that my time at Centereach High School was filled with some of the best moments in my life. I was able to accomplish and create some of the things I never thought were possible. I always saw myself to be a fashion designer but when I was introduced to the business world by some of my favorite teachers I instantly knew what I wanted to do with my life. Throughout my time I was introduced to many opportunities; internships (even paid sometimes), scholarships, and connections to amazing colleges and organizations.  The staff and faculty go above and beyond for their students, my teachers specifically always went the extra mile to answer the questions I had. All that said, I would like to point out that I felt as though there needed to be more of an opportunity for students to create opportunities for themselves without having to jump through so many hoops.', "Teachers are very good, so I'm not bored.  Got voted Class Secretary so that was a real highlight, do whatever I can to make school events more memorable for all the students.", "Centereach High School is a decent school. As someone who lives in Long Island which has very high taxes, I was expecting there to be more hands on STEM activities for student so we can know what we want to do for college as technology is advancing. I see the public education system is still backwards expecting us to do repetitive and non practical assignments that have no value. There were no trips or significant recreational activities that many other high schools around the area have. The teachers in the Advanced courses in math, science, and history were good but the language teachers were terrible. Some  didn't even show to class at least once a week or they never stood in front of the classroom to speak.", 'my experience at centereach high school was a great one. the teachers made learning more fun and simple. when you needed help they were always there to guide you in anything.', 'I would like to see better guidance in Centereach high school also more resources to help you with your questions throughout the years.', 'The teachers and staff are very caring, invested, and involved. I moved to centereach during my senior year and the staff has been so helpful. They have helped me prepare for my life outside of high school. They have helped me figure out the right college for me and what i want in life.', 'I loved all of my teachers at Centereach, each teacher truly cared about your progress and what their students would be doing after High School.  However, the administration was not as kind, they were not as helpful with the college process nor did they teach me about the scholarship opportunities that were available.  Like most High Schools, the food definitely was not the greatest.', 'The faculty here is dedicated to helping students succeed an providing them with all the resources and aid they need to ensure that success.', 'Overall not the best school but there are some really great teachers and there honestly was a decent amount of options of classes, clubs and sports to choose from.', "Centereach high is a school with lots of ways to get involved. It's pretty hard not to get involved, the people are so nice and helpful. Numerous clubs and countless sporting teams, which elevate the school spirit aura of centereach.", 'Centereach High School is a great high school in my opinion. This school offers everything from engaging academics to exhilarating sports and activities. I would rate my time at Centereach as a very fulfilling and rewarding experience. I was able to excel in my classes and achieve rank seven in my class. In addition, I became very involved with clubs and became the Student Council Vice President. Overall, Centereach High School was great', 'The teachers are nice. There are many elective options. The guidance department is very accommodating.', 'There’s no other high school I would have rather attended. Teachers were enthusiastic and taught with passion.', 'Centereach high school was the foundation for how I approach my social and academic success. IT is an average suburban high school but has become a place for many childhood memories and is a stepping stone for future success. They have the most wonderful art department with instructors who develop personal relations with their students. They also provided adequate information into transferring from high school life to college life. They also help with the whole process of applying to college and provide a motivational and academic environment. All in all it is not a perfect institution but my time spent here will certainly not be forgotten especially due to the art department and the loving staff that run it.', 'There are a lot of clubs and many activities. The educational staff is nice and I have not had any problems with anyone. There is no major bullying problems and the special education program is goof as well.', 'While many complain about my school, I found it to be an overall beneficial experience. I have met many great people, had access to a lot of advanced classes, most of the teachers had good characters, and there were many clubs to get involved in. I felt lost after middle school, but this school helped me realize my true potential and I appreciate it greatly for that.', 'The school is great in most aspects especially clubs and extracurriculars. Sports teams could be better as well as organization of it but the team spirit is good. Sportsmanship needs to be taught to some teams though. HAlf the teachers are really good and half of them are really bad. There are mostly Caucasians and then some Asians and Hispanics with very few black people. Security is very good here.', "Overall, Centereach is a good school. the teachers are mostly good, many offer weekly extra help. They pay for all the sophmores and juniors to take the PSAT, which I think is very nice. The music department is fantastic, I have nothing but love for all of the music teachers and programs they're involved in.", 'I like the fact that at centereach high school  most of the teachers are very knowledgeable and very willing to share that knowledge with you.  In  my 4 years there,  i have come to regard some of the teachers as agonist lunge mt servings family.  I have an immense amount of respect for them. And credit my knowledge & love of sharing it to them.', 'What i love about Centereach High School is how involved every single student is whether it be for a club, a society, a sport, the musical, after school events, or games, class competition, etc., every single student participates in something and the faculty makes the students feel comfortable to do so. I have has amazing inspirational and encouraging teachers who make it their duty and find joy in helping kids succeed rather than watch them crumble. I also love the school spirit and love felt when its spirit day or pink shirt day or ugly sweater day, everyone gets so into the fun events and competitions and i truly believe each and every student cares about their image and their dreams in some way shape or form. I love learning from students and teachers everyday and always feeling encouraged to be my best as a student, person, friend, and sibling.']

column1: Queens High School for Language Studies
column2: ['Very welcoming environment and will exceed most of your expectations. teachers are very friendly as well as the administration. they will help make sure you are always on track to graduate and that you are happy every day. you can always go to them if you have problems. they always try their best.', 'As a student here I’d like to say this schools academics are very good, theres a lot of diversity in the school and the teachers actually care about the education and the well being of the students here. The school staff strives us to achieve more than the necessary things for school such as getting an advanced regents diploma, help with college essays and a lot of college information. However, one of the issues in this school is the lack of ap classes and clubs. Overall though, I would recommend this school for anyone who wants to get a good education and wants a diverse small community where the student and staff bonds are strong.', 'There is a great atomsphere in the school. Great effort into exposing students to Chinese culture, as all students are required to learn Mandarin Chinese.', "It's a small well rounded community where teachers are able to help you more considering the size of the school.", 'This is a school with close knit community and everyone knows each other well. The teachers are very passionate in their role teaching the students and very friendly. Since this is a very new school, there are many aspects that is missing such as rigorous courses,  clubs, and it is sharing campus with 2 other schools.', "well, its a relatively new school, i wouldn't expect much. It expanded so much more over the years, which was great. Clubs are little, but its up to the students to make up clubs.
